Comment: Professor Nichols is super nice and very wholesome! There is a lot of reading, but you can get by without doing very much of it. He does talk a LOT and doesn't foster as much discussion, but I think the latter might also be because people stop doing the readings a few weeks in. He does appreciate participation and gives great essay feedback!
Very chill class and teacher, very easy grader, but talks for most of the class and does not really foster discussion.
Awesome, easy, knows literally everything about his subject it is crazy!

Prof. Nichols is a super nice and encouraging man. And most importantly, he is extremely knowledgeable and you will learn a great deal from him. The class is pretty easy 'cause he's an easy grader. He takes rolls at the beginning of the semester but you will be fine if you don't go to this class from time to time. Highly recommend!
Good Professor. Really nice and encouraging teacher. Class moves along at an enjoyable but swift pace.
Not very difficult and the reading is not very difficult. He knows his stuff.

If you aren't looking forward to taking Civ, take nichols. He doesn't hold you responsible for the reading and he is an easy grader. The assessments are reasonable and infrequent. The class is pretty boring, but it is important to go. Just regurgitate the lectures in your papers with a little extra insight and you'll do really well.

Smart guy. Is obviously interested in the books he chose and knows alot about them. If yo don't do the reading, you can get by. It's more interesting if you do though. Was on friday at 10 which was less than ideal, but a pretty good teacher. Papers were really easy. Just pay attention in class, and expand his ideas.

If you don't like the idea of having to take Civ, then Nichols is the guy for you. Discussions are more like lectures, so he doesn't hold people responsible for the reading. He grades papers generously and there aren't very many of them. You won't have fun, but it won't be that  much work and you'll do decently.

Nichols is an amazing professor--managed to make a course often regarded as filler extremely interesting.  Nichols speaks animatedly and is willing to engage students in a fast-paced, firm, yet comedic manner.  Harder than other Civ sections, but well worth the added papers/readings and final.  Very accommodating.  You will enjoy this course.

Prof. Nichols is my favorite professor at CMC. He is so passionate about the subjects that we discuss and is always willing to discuss anything if you have questions. That being said, he is not as easy as most civ professors, but he really cares.
Nichols is the best civ prof period
Nichols may be a goofy bald man, but between the giggles and the chin rubbing, this might have been the most i've learned in any class.  interesting stuff too.
Unbelievable professor. Makes class a lot of fun and is an interesting professor. Not too bad looking either-and he likes the Dodgers

Very goofy guy. During discussions he would stop for 2 SECONDS to see if we had any comments and launch into his own exposition. In retrospect the class was pretty easy and I got exactly what I thought I would get from Civ 10. Just enough.

This guy may be smart but he's a loony-tune. Talks endlessly, never listens to a word edgewise, and acts out every nervous compulsive twitch in class while he's rambling.  Drove me right out of the room.

I took two classes from him.  I did much better in the second one.  He talks on and on, the readings are dull, but the discussion is hot.  Don't be afraid to speak your mind and engage him.  He is one of the smartest profs. we've got.

gotta do the reading in this class and nichols is a talking head but he knows his stuff.  overall i got an A- and i think i aced the final cause i went back and made sure i read the sparknotes for each book, tho i read the real texts too
Great Guy...somewhat goofy.  Really knows his stuff.  Also definitely the guy to take for Gov 80.
Nice guy.  Understands and works with students.  Seems to like talking more than leading discussions.  Work load very reasonable.

Prof Humes is really knowledgeable, but her lectures aren't very clear and she often gets sidetracked. However, she's very willing to work with you outside of class. She allows little time for written exams, but she's flexible with deadlines if you just ask, and tries to thoroughly prepare students for such assignments, quizzes or research papers.

Awesome lady who's very knowledgeable about the subject matter, but expects a lot of her students. As someone who took this course to fulfill a GE, I was disappointed by the amount of time it required. If you're genuinely interested in Religious Studies, you'll have a blast! If not, get ready to slog through a LOT of reading & detailed note-taking.
Cynthia Humes is a brilliant woman but not the best teacher in the world. I have so much respect for her as a person, but her class was a struggle.
Her lectures are extremely confusing and her tests are extremely long and she does not give enough time to write too many essay questions in too little time.
Took her freshman class.  Very interesting. papers were the only grade and shes a fairly good grader.  I would take her if you have the chance.  work load is reasonable

Hard class, but I loved this class, real interesting. Prof Humes really cares about her students, even cooked great Indian food for us!! Only probem is she doesn't teach that often, and only teaches the same class when she does.
Really smart, very helpful. Loved the class!!!

Teaches an interesting course. Very knowledgeable, yet somewhat condescending. Erratic instructions and expectations. At times very friendly and others moody and snippy. If course material was not interesting her rating would be in the dumps.
Most students really like her.  She acts like she's "one of the gang".

If you fall behind it's almost impossible to catch up. He's a nice guy, but he's a bit difficult to understand during lectures. Expect to do a lot of work on your own out of the textbook to get the concepts down and use his lectures to supplement AFTER you've already looked at the lesson. Not a horrid grader, but the policy was unclear & stressful.
Wright is right  :)

Wright has a "cult following" status among CMCers. They have good reason for this -  he is a hidden gem of CMC. Despite his reputation, he's a great talker. Even though his teaching style and tests might make the class difficult, Wright is helpful in office hours & is willing to give out good grades despite a hard, but hilarious, class.

I heard people suggest me not to take his class but it turns out to be the BEST class I had in CMC. It's totally Ok if you don't understand stuff in class, just go to the office hour. He can't be more helpful and caring. He gives me wise life advices and makes me think deeper in econ. If you are really in to econ, take him!
Wright is a good bad even though he has a bad reputation. Class could be hard if you do not pay attention to his lectures. Despite that, overall it is a good class!

Everyone gives Professor Wright a bad rap on campus. When I signed up for his course so many people warned me against it; however, I enjoyed his course. If you pay attention in class and take his notes, you have all the information that he will test you on. Plus, he is more than willing to help anyone out during office hours.
Niceset professor ever! Really helpful!

Many says that he is hard and bad. I agree that he is not easy, but he is a really good professor. He knows what he is talking about. When you actually reflect on what he taught, you can apply many of them to real life. Not a lot of professors teach something flexible to use.
He is pretty good, very helpful! He is a very good person!
You should not take this class! This is the worst econ professor I have ever had!

Despite what people say about him, Professor Wright is actually a pretty good professor.  If you pay attention during lectures and actually try and comprehend what he is saying, it's not that bad.  Yes he is more math-based than others, but he is very helpful during office hours.

Absolutely amazing class. Love the discussions and Professor Wright has his unbiased views which make a lot of the discussions interesting. TAKE THIS CLASS.  He has been given a bad reputation in the Econ Dept. but this class is awesome and the course material is pretty interesting. TAKE IT!

He is great- doesn't assign too much work, but demands your full attention in class, which if you give him, will help a lot with tests. Plus his deviations and anecdotes during class are good times to catch up on the content and polish your notes. Very logical, no fluff, no spoon feeding, and a great professor!

Wright get's a really bad rep in the econ department. Personality wise, he is actually quite funny. The work load is quite easy, we only had two homeworks. All you have to do is study his modules, yes you have to know how to take the first derivative. But I found the use of math makes solving/understanding this class easier.

I thought Professor Wright's Econ 50 class was terrible for several reasons: 1) He is too math based. There were more equations than concepts. 2) Exams were hard to study for and questions were random 3) He taught the class assuming we had already taken Econ before in high school even though it's an intro course. DON'T TAKE WRIGHT!!
if you're not good at mnath dont take this class

Prof. Wright is a great professor and I learned a lot about micro from him. Being a Mudder, no one else in my class knew any real math so they thought it was hard, but the numerical approach to problems was realistic and easier for me to understand.

Worst professor I have ever had. All he did was talk about how we didn't know enough math. He doesn't use the textbook hardly at all and his tests come out of nowhere. Plus he's hostile at his office hours. I regret taking the class 100%. Take Bjerk instead...

He seems really hard but once you get used to his style of teaching, you learn sooo much. At times he is unintentionally intimidating but hes a nice guy really. He really knows his stuff and teaches Econ in a way it makes us think unlike other Econ teachers who use no math and just expect you to puke out defntions on the test. Best forthe long run

If you take this prof you are making a huge mistake. Makes easy problems hard and hard problems impossible thru his own incompetence as a teacher. You will be dumbfounded trying to teach yourself because most of the material he makes up and you have to make sense of his scribbled notes, and he makes zero sense in class. Save yourself.

Wright is not a good teacher!  I really like econ, but he is not good at teaching it.  There is no homework that you have to turn in, but the tests are very hard.  I liked the stories he told in class, and he's kinda funny, but I would've preferred if he taught better.  I took tons of notes, I thought i understood all of it, but the tests raped me

Wright's micro, though harder than other micro classes around, is more fun. There's no homework, so three tests decide your grade. Tests are repititive, so it's not tough to crack them. If you want to learn, then you should definitely take this class.

Perhaps not as bad as many people here say. There are only 3 graded assignments the whole semester. If you are unlucky enough to get him, go to class and study. Some people say if you get Wright, try again next semester, and that might be right if you aren't an econ person. Otherwise, you'll have a workless semester and a mediocre grade.

Uses math exclusively to teach concepts.  I didn't put a whole lot of work in to the class, but I really studied for the last test and did well.  If you're willing to do outside work to study and are good with math, you'll do fine and learn some.  Funny, but digresses into material of 101.

Everyday: "This is kind of Econ101 stuff that you all won't understand, but I'm going to say it anyway..."  and he was right...we didn't understand.  I learned a lot ONLY because I went out and learned it ON MY OWN...

very challenging, but dont take all of these reviews too seriously.  if you really want to learn about econ and take an interesting class, i strongly recommend it, if you are too lazy to study for 3 tests in one semester, then come on, you dont deserve to be at claremont
Arrogant, Unclear and Pompus.  Makes material harder than it is, and is terrible at providing examples.  Avoid him.
Without a doubt the worst prof at CMC back in 1996 and it sounds like he is still going strong...
he was funny in class, but unclear and the test material came out of nowhere...he is also too focused on math.  nice guy though
Wright is Wrong! Avoid like the plague.

Avoid at ALL COSTS. If he is the only one teaching the class you want, wait until later to take it. His class will ruin your GPA and leave you clueless much of the time. He's a nice and funny guy, but he is a sucky and unfair teacher.

What a ridiculous professor. He is very unclear and never does any problems in class to prepare students for the midterms. Also, doesn't curve tests when the highest grade is an 81 and says his normal grade for an Econ 50 class is a B-. Avoid if possible

He's not clear enough and the lectures are somewhat disorganized. Having said that, he does bring up some neat problems in class and you'll learn how to graph dozens of lines in one graph. But he's pretty damn boring to listen to.
Funny guy...I don't know about how nice he is, though.  Not very willing to help or explain, or teach for that matter. His class frustrated me more than any class at CMC so far.
Avoid if possible

Funniest prof I've taken. Also a genuine nice guy under his econ exterior. Only decently prepares his lectures, tends to ramble, but makes them good through poignant anecdotes. Hard subject, easy grader.
Good prof but difficult subject no matter who you take it with... He can be slightly intimidating, but to do do well, you just need to work hard.
Blub-blub-blub, students ten years ago cared about econ.
Don't you care about econ anymore? blub blub blub...  -Colin Wright
cannot teach, boring

Prof. Meyer is intensely brilliant and provokes thoughtful discussion, making tricky concepts fun to think about. Her class is deeply challenging, combining serious readings with weekly writings and asking students to critically analyze complex texts and images. You will succeed if you strive, and she'll make you want to strive. I recommend!

Prof Meyer is a very eccentric prof, no doubt about it. She is also very serious about lit, so if you take her class take it seriously. And if you like Dante, you must take her class. I personally was reluctant to take Dante, but she opens your eyes to his brilliance. One of the hardest and most stimulating lit classes I took at CMC.

Before I took the class I thought that Meyer's ratings were tough. They are not. Professor Meyer does not care about her lit 10 classes and she does not prepare for them. She is not that hard, but she assigns grades quite randomly.

She's a little batty (replied to a request to meet outside office hours with "Your second paper topic looks great."), but you come to love her. She leads the most intellectual class discussions I've ever encountered, and she doesn't overload you with pointless work. She LOVES Dante, so if you have any interest in him, take her class!

She can be intimidating at times, but she's an excellent professor with a vibrant passion for literature.  She's very open to student ideas and encourages expression at every opportunity.  You must do all the reading and attend every class in order to succeed, but you'll find that you enjoy it and you will learn a great deal.

I'm not a lit major but I've taken several lit courses bc of Meyer.  Despite what other negative comments there might be, give her a chance.  She doesn't demand much of you and she usually only assigns short essays.  She gets incredibly excited about the topics and (if you try some) you'll get excited too.  She's brilliant and awesome!

I love my experience with Meyer. She does not hold your hand in class, spoon feeding you information like you're a baby bird but leads class discussions forcing us to think about the text in new ways. She requires her students to respect the educational experience in her class, which is too much for some.
Very passionate and knowledgable.
If you're interested in French feminist literature, this is the place for you.  Very harsh on guys.

Seems to be very hit-or-miss. She loves butt-kissers. Do not question her statements (especially if you're right & can prove it) or she will hate you. Talk to her about the papers or she'll get grumpy. Tread lightly with her and you should be fine.
steer clear, but if you can't, dont get on her bad side
I don't know about her bad side, but I found her to be really passionate about the subject which was refreshing.  She was nice and seemed to be willing to accept different interpretations.
Don't get on her bad side but she's very clear as to what is and isn't acceptable.  If you participate in class then you are golden.

DO NOT GET ON HER BAD SIDE.
 again: 
 DO NOT GET ON HER BAD SIDE.

She refused to teach, instead making us lead our own class discussions (but interrupting frequently, of course, to tell us we were wrong.)  Better hope you agree with her viewpoints.  Also, if you're a guy, try and stear clear - MANHATER
My mom liked her.  I guess that's the only nice thing I have to say, about her.  She almost hit me with her car!  And I was a pedestrian... live in fear, people
No Comments
No Comments
Whoa.  Very serious and doesnt take well to those who dont do as she wants

Would not recommend taking him for fhs or even govt. A lot of people said hes easy but hes not. Hes become a very hard grader. What was most annoying was that we never got any guidelines on papers. He told us to write about anything and gave no structure. Also he has a very weird grading system in which he uses points. very boring class.

Get ready to write a one-page essay every week exploring one of the various different humanities subjects you will be exposed to in this class. Jay Martin is a really sweet and kind professor, and he has some cool perspectives and really bad-ass life experiences to share. Fun guy to get to know! (Also, take him if you want an easy-A FHS class.)
Boring lectures WHO SAID THIS CLASS WAS EASY? lots of readings. daily quizzes.   but he's a nice person
Pretty manageable intro gov class, lots of reading and daily quizzes, but no big tests or long essays, only 1 page papers. Participate and show you care

Very nice man. Writes amazing recommendations, so get to know him. Intro level gov class- His lectures could be boring at times, but hes clearly interested in the subject matter.  Participate for the debates and do the readings for the daily quizzes. An A is not impossible.

Awesome guy.  Old, tenured, but still clearly has a passion for education and learning.  Not in that he loves helping students but that he loves talking about his subject matter.  Lectures are boring and just a review of the reading, but he drops in nuggets about his life (was a spy).  CLASS IS GRADED ON A CURVE so 30% get As, 50% Bs, 20% Cs.

Really nice and interesting person. I recommend you go to lunch with him when he offers. There's a good amount of reading in the beginning but it gets easier. Had daily quizzes and then daily debates. We read a lot of supreme court cases.

Professor Martin is a very sweet man who knows a lot about different subjects, but he tends to ramble on during class discussions. Gives multiple one page papers plus a final paper of 12+ pages. Subject material (ballet and opera) is great. Easy class overall, but not very invigorating or interesting during class lectures.

FHS:Opera/Ballet.Signed up for it simply for the sake of trying something new.Now,I love the genres.I attribute my new-found appreciation and growth simply with respect to  lit. to Dr. Martin.1 1-page essay/wk.20pg final paper.no midterms.He practices psych, is a gov. prof,knows 7 languages,and was a Buddhist Monk.kind man;relaxed class;good books

Super laid-back gov 20 class. Took as a GE because I had no interest in the subject at all. Only downside was daily quizzes but definitely better than having huge exams to study for. Very easy class and good discussions in class.

I was someone that took gov in high school and had no interest in taking gov 20. if you are this person- jay martin is for you. he is the easiest prof i have ever had, yet he makes the class interesting for people that know a little about gov coming in. no hw, no papers, no final- just fill in the blank tests. easiest A ever
good teacher, a little spacey, wants everyone to do well
Interesting prof with so many amazing stories!

Professor Martin is awesome.  I had virtually no interest in taking Gov 20 but it ended up being one of my favorite classes at CMC thanks to him.  The second half of the class was devoted to Supreme Court cases which was really interesting.  He is always available for help and give you his home phone number in case you need it.

Jay Martin was brought to CMC to create the CIV program, thus...it's natural that he's really good at teaching it.  You look at a lot of classic texts (I had read almost all of them  in HS). One page reaction paper due with each text.  Lots of interesting class discussion.  Has a super interesting life.  Very particular about Strunk & White.

Best professor I've had at CMC to date. Highly knowledgeable, helpful, a good communicator, and a very kind person. You won't get nearly as much out of the course though w/o doing most of the readings. Lectures are chill, even funny at times. Office hours are great. Take him & you'll learn alot minus the stress & garbage assignments.
His class is fairly easy (1 page paper a week) until the end.  Then he smacks you with a 20 page final!

He's a bowl of knowledge and an interesting guy, very helpful in office hours and only one midterm and then the final, if you do the readings you'll be fine, if you don't it's not going to be fun...class gets relatively long, but he's an interesting prof!
guy is sooo smart and knows so many random facts!
Be prepared to sleep in class and still come out with an A. The man has lead an amazing life and you'll certainly hear all about it.

I took astro for my science GE, but ended up really enjoying it! Tom is a great teacher with a fabulous sense of humor. There's no HW besides studying for the 4 exams (all MC, challenging but fair) and the material is fascinating. There are only 5 labs, which are relatively quick/easy, but you CANNOT miss any. Would definitely recommend the class!

Although I do think he was very nice and approachable, his lecture style was very convoluted and hard to follow. The test questions were also sometimes hard to follow/confusing. Overall, wouldn't recommend it if you're planning on taking it for your science requirement - was not an easy class at all
Professor Dershem is a great physics lab professor! He goes in great detail of physics concepts and helps you for the physics lab practical! Highly recommend- very chill person
Great Professor. Great and interesting Guy. Learned a lot surprisingly despite my lack of interest. Has some strange tests question choices but is mostly straight foward in what he wants on tests.
His lecture is interesting and isn't difficult to understand. 4 exams were all made of multiple questions, and labs are very simple.

His lectures and his tests are accurate, I have no idea what the last reviewer was talking about. If you are an intelligent  person the tests are not that difficult at all- I got an A without trying to hard. In spite of the fact that his lectures are all powerpoint presentations, this is probably one of the most interesting classes I've ever taken.

an absolute nightmare.  I took this class for fun and ended up correcting him on every detail nearly half the time.  His tests were inacurate and he expects you to do most the learning on your own.  His teaching style is designed for (dare I say?) a large state school, which is what Claremont is SO not about.

Prof Dershem seriously wants you to learn-- my group was the last to leave lab every time and he still kept his patience.  Very tough to get a good grade but if you ask for help he will give it to you!  A really nice guy!
umm yeah...my mother says if you have nothing nice to say, dont say anything at all, lets just leave it @ that
No Comments
Great professor. Pretty interesting and not very difficult. Don't need to do any of the reading.

Really fascinating class and professor.  He's super smart.  Very much a lecture, but he does ask for your ideas and opinions and really likes it when you speak up.  He's very thorough and works hard to present all sides without bias.  The tests and essays are hard- I recommend talking to him in his office hours beforehand.

Davis is an excellent lecturer and a knowledgeable scholar of Philosophy.  He excels at presenting a relatively unbiased  , even-handed look at various historical philosophers.  The class is lecture based, but he does ask for student input. The course work is not particularly challenging, especially if you're interested in the subject matter.

Stephen Davis is a dedicated scholar and caring teacher. He addresses his students with respect but demands their best thinking. The only bad thing I can say is that he is retiring soon. I wish I could learn more from him.
Enjoyed his class. Learned a lot. However, I thought the way he graded the exams was quite unfair & unclear to students. Not a ton of work--2 5pg papers and 2 (tough) exams.

lectures are so clear & comprehensive that you don't need to read; just GO TO CLASS & take good notes. not an easy grader. knows a TON. open to student opinions but not much discussion - more focus on history of phil than student discussion. good class.

Davis is a GREAT lecturer and is always open to comments/questions, which he answers with clarity and respect. You hardly have to do the reading, because he just explains everything so well in class. He likes people who participate in the (minimal) discussions. I'd recommend him to anyone who likes a strong lecture class in an interesting subject!

Great professor.  Knows his stuff.  He cleans up most of the reading in his lectures and makes it understandable.  He keeps the class pretty basic and not extremely demanding, though there's a decent amount of reading.  Good for a GE, and a great religion/philosophy professor.

do NOT take this course to satisfy a GE or for an intro philosophy course. concepts are extremely hard to grasp and the reading is dense and circular. prof davis does a decent job explaining some of the material, but not all of it. he's a nice guy, though, and will help if you ask. if you're really into philosophy, this might be a class for you.
Davis is an amazing prof.  He's entertaining, engaging, and really seems to care about the students.  He's just generally a great guy

I loved him.  He is brilliant and known person in his feild.  He talks kinda dry, but if you are interested in the subject, the classes are very interesting.  He cares a lot about his students, and hears everyones different views.  He is a hard grader, with only four assignments all worth 25% of your grade.  If you want to learn, take his class.
One of the greatest philosophy/religion profs at the 5-C's - this is the man that got me interested in majoring in philosophy. Not that easy, but an EXCELLENT teacher.
Uses subjective nature of material to assign arbitrary and nonsensical marks.
Great prof but really only teaches one class.  All of his classes are the same.  If you love to argue though, this guy is quick and this is the teacher for you...
Very difficult. Expects you to be up to his level of religious philosophy. Lectures are very interesting and the topic teaches you a lot, however. Would recommend taking for upperclassmen.

I often felt as though he was trying to be openminded, but was just failing at it.  It becomes clear eventually that he's a pretty conservative Christian and that just biases him too much.  He is pretty nice, though.
He's very accessible, caring, and, at times, rather amusing.
The guy's a decent teacher, but is kind of an ass.
good lecture and discussions, clear, reasonable standards.
No Comments

Best professor Ive ever had at CMC. Anyone who disagrees just couldnt handle the heat she brings. Would be a waste of your education to not take Levinespecially if a Psych major and/or interested in statistics.
Very clear at the subject matter, net tired of explaining things over and over again. The tests and homework can be challenging but  they are necessary to get a solid understanding in psych stats.

She is amazingly clear in the lectures and capable of explaining concepts in different ways when necessary. Gives the most considerate and detailed study guide materials. Very dedicated to teaching. I'm not too into Stats but she was able to make it great a learning experience. Can't think of a better professor to take Psych Stats with!
Very helpful and really sweet. Always willing to give extra help. Expert in her field and is ridiculously smart. Not easy but very enjoyable.
LOVE Professor Levin. Stats is never fun, but her lecture style was very clear and she was very accessible both during and outside of class hours. She expects a lot, but you also learn a lot.

Extremely clear powerpoint lectures. Makes chapters/ understanding material much easier. Book that is used is terrible, extremely confusing, but her lectures make up for it.  Tests are super hard, but it's mostly due to the content being difficult.  She is very approachable so help office hours are always there. Need to be self-motivated to do well
very clear and comprehensive lectures.. extremely approachable and friendly, really wants you to do well, she makes everything easier to understand.. the rest is up to you
No Comments
Too stringent with following the rules, nearly to the point of being anti-compassionate.  Reasonably clear with expectations, but not very approachable.
Psych is such BS!
This class is less focused on politics than one would think.  It's interesting, but the tests are really hard and she isn't an easy grader on papers either.
The best professor in my academic years student center activity was on of his delivery style
The best professor in my academic years

as a person hes probably the funniest professor youll have at cmc and now that im out of the class i love the guy but hes too smart to be teaching entry level classes and is hard to understand a lot, also goes off topic a lot

as a person hes probably the funniest professor youll have at cmc and now that im out of the class i love the guy but hes too smart to be teaching entry level classes and is hard to understand a lot, also goes off topic a lot
Enjoyable class

Ok. He is a sweet, crazy, little italian man. He does care about his students, and will try to help you. The problem is that he makes absolutely no sense when he talks. His lectures are impossible to follow, and he often starts talking to himself in Italian. He is entertaining sure, but the novelty wears off quickly. Avoid if at all possible.
Lively classes.  Math jokes a plus.
Very interesting class.  Did not use textbook all the time.  Book was hard to understand and he did a great job explaining.  Suggestion:  Go to his office hours.

Very focused and interesting.  Book was boring and incomprehensible, but he did not use it all the time.
 Cute teacher.  Helpful.

Very sweet man. Too bad there seems to be no good teachers of differential equations around here. The book was wordy and annoying, and he didn't seem to be teaching from the book anyway which made the homework hard. Went off on lots of tangents, making class a general waste of time, and the lectures were either boring or useless.
the cutest little old, itallian man ever BUT terrible prof. i had the hardest time following him during lectures!
Awesome prof

Professor Martelli is absolutely awesome!! Although at times I sat in class confused about the topic, he is willing to help you until you understand during his office hours. As long as you go in for help when you need it, it is very possible to get an A in his class.
Most enjoyable class at CMC.

I love Martelli.  He sometimes goes off on tangents in class and laughs uncontrolably at the weirdest things, but he is just too cute.  He puts nothing in front of his students and will spend as much time as you need outside of class to help you.  I would take him again in a heartbeat if i had to take more math
Funny, outgoing professor.  Makes class enjoyable.

The class can be tough at times, but if you ask questions in class or visit him during his office hours he does his best to help you understand.  Plus he is just so cute and funny he makes you forget you flunked the last quiz...
pretty good teacher...great personality and attitude..a little hard to understand at times because of his accent...good and fair teacher.
Tough, but interesting class.  I have only had 8 profs at CMC, but he is the best.

Made a math class fun.  That is not an easy task.
 Very helpful when you dont understand.
hes a real nice guy...just doesnt teach too well
Interesting and fun class.
Tough****.  Hard to understand him.  Explains concepts as if you're on his level.  He's too smart.

Math is a difficult subject and I would prefer not to take any.  He tries to make us understand why higher math is important.  I don't agree with him on that.   He is full of energy and tries to make math tolerable.  I must admit that he makes sense out of Calculus.  He is always willing to help.
Tells jokes and makes you think.  Love his accent--he is from Italy.  He makes math fun, even though I am not good at it.
Fun class

If you're good at math, take him.  If not, at least sit in on a lecture.  Watching him teach is the funniest thing in the world, and he laughs for no reason at random intervals.  Super Mario + Santa Claus = Mario Martelli.

I've never had any problems in math so I figured I might do well in a math course. Well...I figured wrong. I've never been so confused in my life, and even when I understand it he throws the hardest problem possible on his exams, but he's a nice guy.

If you can speak Italian and are a brilliant mathematician go take his upper division classes. Otherwise get ready to make spend a lot of quality time with your textbook so you can pass the tests. Mama mia!
A little unclear and distracted but quite brilliant.  Curses in Italian all the time which is ok since he is Italian.

I love her. She is corky for sure but thats what makes her engaging. The classes are very chill and there is almost no homework. Only things that are hard are her tests because she is very loose with teaching... But if you study a couple days before the test you will be fine.

Absolutely loved her. Quite a character, but definitely a class worth taking as she keeps it very interesting. Easy GE with very little work outside of the classroom and easy exams with a wicked curve.

Charlop def knows her stuff after being in the autism center so long. A bit eccentric and weird but she is entertaining and an easy class. Would recommend if looking for an easy psych elective but if you want to gain deep knowledge about behavior psychology this is not the class to take

I took PSYCH 120 Practicum, a seminar class that works hands on at the Claremont Autism Center. It was much more hands on and no lectures or tests, so I may have had a different experience than other students. However, I found that if you reach out to her and show a genuine interest, she is very invested in your success as a student.

Arbitrary grader based off whether or not she likes you, so show up to every class, be polite, and you will get a grade in the A range.  She will put random facts from the book on her tests, so you must read it for the tests but not for class.

book needed for midterm/final but mainly based off her confusing lectures.very repetitive, easily sidetracked,always late for class. her projects are easy and class is easy to get an A in but if you are interested in psych or a psych major dont take,she wont prepare you for anything

I would strongly recommend not taking a class with this professor.  She is undependable, unorganized and does not  teach by the syllabus. If you are not a favorite student, do not expect an easy A. Learning/receiving a good grade is difficult  because there is no structure and the mid-term will be on what ever she feels like, not the textbook.

I had a huge interest in Behavioral Psychology. This class was a waste of time in terms of information learned. The material we covered over 1 semester could be taught in 2 class periods. Literally. Huge disappointment, because I actually wanted to learn. However, she is charismatic, hilarious, & entertaining. Easy elective, if ur looking for one.

This professor is fun and certainly knows her stuff. Her knowledge of behavioral psych and its application i.e. with helping the autistic kids in her clinic is an opportunity that claremont college students should really consider. Sometimes she is late, or absent - that is true. The class is simple though useful.
Knows her stuff
This class solidified my interest in psychology. C-C is not the most traditional of instructors but you do learn a lot in her class.  And what you learn, you really learn well.

One of the worst professors I've ever taken. Rude, not interest in students or their learning. If she doesn't like you, she will make your life hell--and she doesnt seem to like anyone. Made fun of an Asian kid in the class for squinting more than one time. Totally nuts.
No Comments

If the former entry is right, then I'm an idiot, too.  CC is here -and tenured - for one good reason: the autism center and her excellent work with it.  Seeing that she can't get fired and has a ton of time spent at the institute, class is boring and a waste of time.  She DOES know her stuff, but that doesn't make a good professor nor a good class.

Professor CC is just plain CRAZY and weird, but her class is easy. I don't feel like I learned that much, but I got a good grade in the class and I enjoyed her lectures for sheer entertainment value (crazy people are funny).

Anyone who bashes Intro to Psyche with Prof CC is an idiot.  She is a little wacky, and she might not care 100% about teaching, but she knows her stuff.  Her tests aren't that hard.  You'll get a good grade if you put in two hours of solid studying before the final and mid-term.  The projects are easy.  She wants you to get a good grade.  Take her.
I wish i had more hands, so i could give her 4 thumbs down
horrible class
No Comments

Professor Lofgren, aka, "Chuckles," deepened my knowledge of U.S. History when I came to CMC in 1975. In those days, all professors lectured for the full duration of the class. But lecturing does not mean that students are being passive--no, I was actively taking notes while listening and thinking to what this brilliant scholar was saying.
This class was fun.  It's mandatory, but I enjoyed in class discussions.
Professor Lofgren is easy to follow in class if you do all the readings prior to class.I would recommend going to his office hours. He is really caring and helpful if you get to know him.

Professor Lofgren is a very intelligible man who has a hard time displaying the information to his students in an interesting way. Although his class is boring at times, and his tests are fairly difficult, if you take the time to get to know him it makes the class more worthwhile. He's a great guy who really cares about his students.

Charles is clearly really knowledgeable about government and history, but his incredibly high expectations and cold demeanor make it hard to enjoy the class. He doesn't encourage students to ask questions, and often seems surprised when they do. I would definitely not recommend this class.

Prof. Lofgren is a very sweet man who really cares about his students. However, a lot of people don't like his teaching style, which is pure lecture (no powerpoint, but he provides a brief outline). He cares enough about his students to email you after class to follow up on a question you asked. Very knowledgeable.

Super tough. Super boring. Avoid at all costs. Clearly knows American History very well, but expects you to know it just as well as he does. Doesn't accept answers different from the ones that he is looking for, and expects you to know minute details from the reading. Do not take his class.

I don't care if Constitutional History is your favorite subject - think very carefully before you take this class. He has ridiculous standards that will most likely result in him harming your GPA. He is a nice man, but the class is not worth it.

A very sweet man with a voice that can lull a child to sleep. That being said, he expects a lot out of you and definitely expects you to do the reading. Class discussions are pretty dry as there are usually only one to two people who did the reading or are interested in the class.
Completely uninteresting class, turned me off to Gov studies. He is a nice man but his grading is ridiculous and his expectations are far too high for reading and knowledge.
The man is a genius but he expects way too much out of his students. Weekly reading is well over 300 pages if you do all of it and the class frequently changes from lecture to pop quiz.

Chucklin' Charlie we used to call him, due to the perpetual Burgess-Meredith-as-the-Penguin grin he always had. Dull but not unbearably so, affable and fair. Willing to help. Just do the work, behave and you can do fine. Nice man...I had him 20 years ago--sounds as though he hasn't changed much.
Lectures are dry, but much easier to follow if you have done the reading. He went out of his way to help me complete the class after problems in my other courses put me way behind.
Early U.S. History.  I did well in A.P. U.S. History in high school, but this guy is a hard grader.  He knows everything about anything he brings up in class.  He expects you to, also.
If there is any way not to take this class, don't. The most boring 3 hours of your week. Horrible grader. Expects you to know everything about everything. DO NOT TAKE.

It's pretty much all been covered, very smart, but very boring, and not a very good teacher to those who aren't as well-versed in gov.  If you know a lot about gov maybe he can illuminate some for you, but for causal students his lessons are convoluted and complex.

One of the most challenging classes I took at CMC but also the one in which I learned the most; Lofgren spent signifcant time helping me improve my writing and speaking style; helped me develop confidence and become a much stronger debater in class; totally fair even though my views opposed his

Great Historian, but just like the stereotype, VERY boring. He uses notecards to call on people in class and drills you with questions all the time. Makes you feel stupid if you didnt do the around 2000 pages of reading. Who has time for that much reading
Excellent historian, first rate.

how bout this... only 4 people registered for his class and one day, 3 of the students were absent.  Get this... he STILL lectures as if there are others in the class.  Lot of people didn't like the guy, but at least, he tried...

I don't know why he has such poor reviews! Prof. Black made my ochem experience as pleasant as possible, he is so kind and caring and loves teaching the material. Gave us lots of practice problems so the exams were very very fair. I know ochem is hard but he was awesome and I really learned a lot with him, highly recommend.

Professor Black is by far the worst professor I have had during my college trajectory. This class is taught in the following way: students are expected to read the textbook, and in class the professor does not lecture/substantiate on the readings, but rather does practice problems- not an effective method of teaching. Highly do not recommend Prof.
He is not helpful at all. He is not clear during lecture and during office hours.

He knows a lot of Ochem but he is not the best at teaching students with only a passing interest. He knows a ton and is a nice guy. I did badly under him but I got straight A's in 116 and 117 (and was more interested) after I took 116 again and 117 for the first time, with someone else. I can't help but think this reflects on him a bit.
No Comments

Suck it up, it's o-chem and it's not easy.  He provides excellent explanations that make you understand WHY so that you can apply things broadly.  He expects broad understanding, so you'd better have it.  Also, replaces lowest test score with grade on final exam.  this is huge, everyone bombs at least one test.

He is a teacher that expects a lot, and classtime does not seem very well used.  If you are a huge nerd who wants to live/breath ochem I think he would be a GREAT prof.  He caters for those that put ochem above all else and are pretty much the nerds of the school, if you arnt that choose a different prof.
Great teacher, loves the subject.

Awesome experience, loves his subject, and it shows!He teaches you how to critically think, instead of sheer memorization.  Learn the concepts and you'll do well on the tests...that's it, plain and simple.  Takes a lot of time to do practice problems, but my friend and I did ****loads of practice probs and the tests were easy,nothing unexpected.

He's useless in office hours, and classes are too large to afford individual attention.  He's enthusiastic, but a lot of class time is wasted while people struggle through problems that theylack the background knowledge to solve.  He expects students to le

He expects you to learn the material and read the book.  If you do that, highlight a****load, and UNDERSTAND every practice problem, you'll do well on the exams.  His exams are focused on lectures so not many surprises, especially if you know the practice problems.
you have to do a lot of work outside of class, but overall this class is really good.

His teaching style suited me perfectly for ochem but, when I had him during his one semester of teaching gen chem, it didn't transition over very well. He takes a more problem-based approach and, refreshingly, doesn't lecture at you. If you have to take ochem, take Black. Decent lab prof too.
Dr. Black is AWESOME, take him if you can.
Nice guy, but he does things his way and only his way.  If you have a question and he doesn't feel like answering it, you're out of luck.
He's an Ochem professor.  He means well but his teaching style just doesn't feel conducive to many students learning styles.  The lectures are more like tutorials.

Nothing but positive things to say about Prof A. She is amazing at giving feedback outside of class and will not judge you when you have the stupidest questions. She has a quirky sense of humor that makes her just even more fun to discuss with. Really cares about her students personally.
not very kind, snarky, plays favorites
can't explain concepts well  average at best
Prof Antecol has a fantastic brain AND great shoes.

She sucks. She maybe has published some econ papers but when it comes to actually explaining the material she sucks. She sucks. I did fine in her class... She has 10% participation but doesnt take attendance. There is no final and no homework. This means your grade is dependent upon what he overall opinion of you is. Which is good and bad...
Professor Antecol is in her element in this class. This is what she likes to research and it shows. Light work load day to day. Tests are very tricky but graded on a pretty soft curve.
She's awesome. She is able to teach the material well and is reasonable in her grading and work assignments. She's a great choice for a prof.

Antecol was all about proving microeconomic theory rather than explaining its significance.  Class is almost not worth coming to because you just get lost in her quick mathematical proofs.  Problem sets are due weekly...huge pain.  Overall the class seemed disorganized.
Prof Antecol is awesome. She's cool and caring and a great asset to the CMC community!
Not very good at explaining the reasoning behind stats, we pretty much had to memorize formulas and use a terrible book.  I would rather have learned something, but she was really nice.
Her class is easy, but that's about all it's got going for it.  Her lectures are right out of the book, and not very informative.  Nice lady, though.
She's small and loud, but helpful and often hilarious.  Powerpoint-driven class.
She's funny in a Canadian sort of way. Work load is pretty light.

He literally expects that you have ALL the time in the world to finish the work for his class-as if other classes don't exist, or thesis, or job search, or jobs. He rants and doesn't explain what he wants. Awful. just awful. He is nice, but so it George W. Bush...didn't make him a great president, though. Never take his class if you can avoid it

Haley is an awful professor who began every class with a tangent that no one could follow. The books were interesting but he can't at fostering discussion, fails to make the material accessible, and speaks for about 2/3 of the time. This class is hard--because you are constantly trying to guess the exact phrasing of exactly what he wants to hear.

Great professor. Passionate about the course material, has high expectations of students but gives them tools necessary to meet expectations, helps prepare students for the real world, gives really in depth and good comments on writing, have to read and write A LOT in his class, but its worth it...not just busy work. Lectures not boring but great!

Any IR major should definitely go meet with Haley. He's a great advisor and will really take care of you if you get to know him. He's getting senile, so he rambles a lot in class, but if you go to office hours a bunch you can do fine in the class.

This is probably the most reading I have ever done in my life.  This class will really expand your horizons, and Haley will invest a LOT in interested students... but you need to REALLY WORK HARD for his approval - he gets to be like your dad, taking all your successes and failures very personally.

My favorite class. Haley demands a lot, but he is worth it because you will really learn how to present and defend an argument under the kind of scrutiny you would receive out in the real world, where answers must be clear, precise, and short. Highly recommend. I got an A in his class and I consider it my biggest college achievement.

Very knowledgeable and extremely kind, but better as a mentor than a professor.  He's forgetful, picky, and kinda random.  Assigns TONS of reading and papers and grades very hard, you have to do *exactly* what he's looking for.  He'll read drafts of papers, which is helpful.

a good man, and clearly brilliant, but its  apparent that he is no longer fit to teach. forgetful when it comes to details as to what you have done; the writing process with him is infuriating; his goal teaching writing is to create intellectual clones of himself. his comments are incomprehensible, and meeting him for feedback is equally as useless

Expects a lot of his students. Do the reading, if you don't and try to BS an answer during class he will call you out. Very much discussion based. Extremely helpful during office hours. He made me change my major to IR and is now my adviser.

This class requires an outrageous amount of work.  This class was more work than my other 4 combined.  A 10 and 14 page midterm assigned Thursday and due Tuesday?!  He is also very unclear in what he wants.  I ask him a question about the final paper, base my entire paper on it, then he tells me 1 day before it's due that he wants something else!

U.S. Israel and Arabs is definitely worthwhile if you are interested. Otherwise, it would be painful. 3 10 page papers, weekend simulation, and you have to occasionally lead class. Haley knows a lot, but it can be tedious if people just read from notes for their presentations. Paper grading is fair, just if you know what he wants.

US, Israel and the Arabs: You learn a lot in this class, have to work very hard. He is not terribly organized and wanders, but is very knowledgeable. Work tends to pile up. The simulation is a lot of fun, but takes a lot of time and effort. He is a hard grader on papers.

There is no way Haley earned the reputation he has now by teaching this way. I really like him as a person but every day he shows up to class and talks about whatever he feels like talking about that day.  Its a waste of time to even sit through his lectures I would only recommend him for help outside of class

Very occasionally, you'll see flashes of brilliance.  The rest of the time, it's clear he's begun a downward spiral.  His lectures are abysmal.  Most of the time, he merely rants about Iraq, or some other hot-button issue.  The assignments are insultingly childish.  The only redeeming factor is his book selection, which was sporadically rewarding.

Haley classes are tough, he demands a lot from his students.  However, his classes are quite rewarding and they are at a level advanced courses should be tought at.  Great reading materiel, enthralling seminars, challenging research--you will learn fundamentals of political prudent leadership, how to argue, how to present and how to write.

His grading was absurd. He didn't get papers back to us for a long time and the simulation, while fun, didn't count for any of our grade. He wasn't even there for most of it. He's very particular for presentation and will make you start over if its not the way he wants it. You learn a lot, but you have to put up with his ****.

i think he's senile or just lost it. your final grade has nothing to do with the class. it's amazing how he even comes up with these numbers. you learn a lot in the class, which is great and simulation is fun. however, it's really not worth the absurd ending.

Tons of reading, long papers (I too was in the class with the surprise 20-pager with 3 days to do it), hard grader, but the best professor on the block. Will look out for you forever if he likes you. Might just plan out your life, and get you a job.
No Comments

Amazing guy! As a prof and advisor. Get to know him, go to his office, take him to lunch in collins (he loves that). You'll be happy you did when you need a rec. Great class. So knowledgeable and really cares about the topic. Sort of senile, assigned a surprise 20-page paper once, but then gave no final. Listen and learn, he's so great!

He's on the hard side, lots of reading, but the class was really interesting.  His lectures are painful, but thats why he tends not to lecture and lets students do the teaching.  I learned alot.  Haley's a good guy.
No Comments
Great prof if you're willing to work.  He will also give you the grade you deserve.
yes, you have to work.  yes, it is a lot of reading.  yes, his grading is hard.  but if you do what he asks, you will actually learn a lot.
Huntley Bookstore's inventory is not an indicator of whether students have completed the required reading.

Do not take calculus with this professor. DO NOT. Especially if you are new to the subject and think you will need help. He is cold, unapproachable, and often gives you a hard time for asking a questions as if you are dumb. When he does answer questions its not in a clear, understandable way. Worst professor I have had for a small college

He is the worse professor I've ever met in CMC. Unclear in class lectures. Unhelpful homework, especially mean to student during office hours. If there is an alternative to his DifQ, take the other ones.

It would definitely help to have some background in Calc before taking this class as he breezes over some of the important concepts, but overall it was an easy class. He gives trial quizzes that are identical to the real quiz, and will tell you all the possible questions he could ask beforehand. He also gives you 2 free pts on each quiz. Take him!!

He is a very intelligent person but does not know how to lecture. He was hard to follow and then was mean to students who asked questions. I took high school Calculus AB and still found it hard to understand him some times. The homework is not mandatory but it will help you understand the lectures more if you keep up with the homework.

Tells you exactly what to expect on day 1. The class seems easy because he types up notes for you to minimize work on your end, but the tests are pretty hard. A lot of work but if you stay current you should do fine. Lectures aren't very engaging, but they're only 50 minutes long. Good prof for differential equations

Knowledgeable professor who wrote the textbook we use. Every class was lecture with no participation required. Sometime he blocks the board but he always hands out notes before class with everything you need to learn. Gives out practice tests one week prior to exams that are almost identical to the actual tests. HW was optional

Not much to say. Gives prequizzes, helps those who need it although be it reluctantly as he expects you to immediately grasp the concepts. Still, he is not a mean teacher and he is quite funny if you like his humor. Helpful, Easy, take him.
This class was amazing! I really would take my next calc with this professor if he would teach one. He always gives prequizes and its pretty easy to prepare for them.

He's not very nice but tries to help in his office hours and over email or even on the phone. Super lenient on grades. Gives a ton of make-up opportunities. And it's quite true that he doesn't really cares about the students b/c he says a lot that he knows the majority of ppl in the class only take it to fulfill GE.

Didn't crack open the textbook. Make sure you take notes during his lectures and listen to his tips. He gives a practice quiz for everything and just changes the numbers around so review that. Easy A. Doesn't need much time. No need to go to office hours. Good if you memorize patterns. Realizes he blocks the board and types out notes for you.

Pretty easy if you read the notes and make an effort to understand them. He wants students to understand the material and do well, so the class is both helpful and easy. He also offers shortcuts where they exist without beating around the bush, which is great.
Very easy class. Homework not mandatory, notecard given on tests. However, Bradley's lectures are extremely dull and he moves pretty fast. Boring class, easy A.

easy class. assigns HW and never checks it. lets you use a notecard on tests and gives practice tests that are 90% identical to the actual exam. extremely boring as a teacher. if you dont mind studying the material yourself, and going to office hours for additional help, you will A+ this class. super nice professor. recommend this class highly!

This professor gets a bad rep of being boring and difficult. From my experience he was not the most interesting professor but he was nice and very fair with grading. He is always in his office to help you and lets you use a note card on all tests. He is great. Easy and taught me the material.

this is my review for calc iii. first things first, you get to use a notecard on all the quizzes. second, there is a take home worth lots of points = easy A IF you spend the time. third, the final is designed to bring your grade UP UP UP. overall, if you put in the time and understand everything, you and your notecard will rock this class, the end.

Reasonably good teacher if you pay attention, but he doesn't make the lectures very interesting, so that can be hard. Grades are based off of in-class quizzes and one take-home test, which can be problematic if you tend to make mistakes on tests. Then again, regular homework doesn't need to be turned in, so you can get away with not doing it.

If you are good at plugging things into a calculator and memorizing things, this is the class for you! However, if you are legitimately good at math and interested in the subject, you will find yourself regretting your life decisions. The guy lists "Linear Algebra using Graphing Calculators" as a Research Interest. That should say it all...

Very boring and monotonous. no homework. 5 quizzes a take home test and a final. tests are hard but he lets you use a flash card for all quizzes and a sheet of paper for the test. overall the class was still hard but not impossible

Absolutely awful professor.  If you don't know the material going in, he's not going to teach it to you.  Class is not worth going to, you might as well sit in your dorm and read the book (which he wrote and simply transcribes onto the board).  On tests you get a note card, which insures you learn nothing. Take someone else.
if you cant say something nice, dont say anything at all- except dont take this class unless you absolutely have to (and expect a grade lower than your standards)
awesome!
awesome professor. very straightforward and wont try to trick you. teaches all material you need, no homework assigned. note cards allowed and gives pretests- know these and you'll get an A
Yes, he allows notecards, but doesn't really teach the material. Does too many problems on the board during class for my taste.

very realistic. you aren't required to do homework, but he gives you extra problems if you them. tests and quizzes are very straight-forward and he allows a note card. he doesn't try to trick you. just study the practice quizzes and you'll be fine.

i think he is more suited to teaching higher level math. he can be very confusing at times, and if you ask questions that he considers dumb then he can be very condescending. but it's really cool that he lets you use a note sheet on every test and quiz and gives you a solutions packet beforehand.

doesnt seem to care much wether you learn or not. let's notesheets on midterms and finals. if you ask a lot of questions, especially stupid ones, he'll probably make fun of you and refuse to answer it. secret to a decent grade is writing down his whole practice test on your notesheet, he only changes the numbers around, but keeps it mostly the same
while i hated the material, he is a good prof.  i just didn't get a lot of it.
overall i liked this class - learned a lot from him

I thought he was a great professor. If you didn't understand concepts, he went out of his way to ensure you learned it, and if you did understand everything then he got out of the way and didn't bog you down with busywork. Highly recommended.

He can be condescending, not answering questions or making you feel stupid if you just want him to slow down, and he stands in front of what he's written so you can't read what he wrote. Homework isn't collected and tests are take-home. In conclusion: boring boring boring condescending easy easy easy.

Although his lectures can be confusing, you know exactly what is going to be on the tests & there's a pretty nice curve. As long as you go to class (which is optional), it's not hard to get out with an A.

Bradley is good if you've had math before. he's very clear and very helpful outside class. his tests are harder, but very fair. he tends to write a lot, but his explanations are very good. i would definitely take another class with him

He is a speed demon on the board. Sometimes I think he is going to pass out because he never stops writing. If you like to think about a problem before you do or while you are doing it, DON'T TAKE HIM! He doesn't stop class. He hates answering questions and dominates students who don't understand or question him.
I agree with the person below me so much that I will simply quot them "WORST TEACHER EVER!!" Don't subject yourself to this class. Show yourself some love and take math at one of the other colleges
WORST TEACHER EVER!!!!!!!!!!

Bradley can be condescending if you ask questions that waste classtime or are simply designed to make yourself sound smart.  He has office hours everyday, no homework, and very straightforward lectures.  Bottomline, if you are decent at math, you'll do really well in this class.  If you're bad at math, try Pitzer.

He wrote the textbook, so if you don't understand his lecture, you won't have a chance. He is a condescending prick that actually made me cry in class. I hate him with a burning passion and my class notes are filled with "I wish I could be anywhere but here" So overall, I would not recommend his class.
very helpful teacher
He is not very open to questions but the class is very easy and requires hardly any work to do well.  No homework and take-home midterms.

I've had so many classes from Bradley that I couldn't even fit all of their titles! I consider myself a math/history major with the Bradley sequence... Needless to say, I like the guy. And, if you're in his DE class, I may even be your grader! :)

If you've taken calc, Bradley is great.  He doesn't collect homework and doesn't take attendance.  I only went on test days.  If you haven't taken calc, and struggle with math, consider someone else.  I've heard that he's not helpful for newcomers.  Nice guy, though, and study sessions are helpful.

He's a fair prof in terms of grading and expectations. He's teaching style is at first difficult to follow but gradually (if you attend class) you can follow him. His handwriting is horrible and he often blocks the board. However, he is helpful in office hours and there are no surprises.

Bradley gives you numerous opportunities to do well.  He always gives sample tests, and has multiple review sessions.  Often, the quizzes are just homework problems.  He never collects hw, and his testing is really fair.

prof bradley is very easy if you have a background in calculus. he is a very smart person and at times is ahead of the rest of the class with some of his algebraic techniques.  however, easy quizzes, tests, no graded homework, and notecards on all tests/quizzes

The tests were a struggle for me, and I was a low A/high B math student in high school.  If we earned a grade on our final that was higher than our previous semester grade, the lowest grade we could end up with was an A- if we had gotten an A on the final, for example, or a B- for a B.

At first he seems easy, since you get to bring notes to the test, but he teaches so poorly that it's hard to actually do well.  The one really nice thing is that his exam is essentially what makes your grade, but it only helps you.  If you can self-teach, blow off the class and focus on the exam.

Horrible teacher... he doesn't answer questions and just disregards them.  He does outline all quizzes and exams and lets you use note cards on quizzes and a full page of notes for exams.  He's not very helpful. He stands in front of notes while writing on board, handwriting is very hard to read!!
Very reasonable quizzes, clearly outlines what will be on it and allows for an index card with notes.  Take home tests are harder, but managable.  Overall a very good math professor.

He's an alright teacher, although sort of oblivious to how his students are doing.  I really appreciate how he clearly puts as much time and math study into each class and test as the students.  He doesn't collect homework, which is good and bad for obvious reasons.

This guy does not teach! He only copies whats in the book anyway and is incapable of explaining anything to someone who has not already taken the material in highschool. If you want a guy who thinks he is way to smart to teach a basic calculus class and turns down every question,HERE YOU GO!

If you want an easy A take him. His exams are pretty easy and you don't really have to do a lot of work. BUT he clearly shows no interest in teaching the class. He has that stuck up attitude "Econ 50 is too easy for me to teach." His office hours aren't helpful at all. He will give you that dirty look for asking to clarify something.

He's great! He makes a lot of jokes and is incredibly straightforward. If you can do the practice exam, you can do the actual exam. Really knows his stuff, and helps connect the material to the real world
If you like econ, he's not a bad intro class.  He doesn't care a whole lot about the class, but you do learn your stuff.
he is awful.

This is the class that made me decide not to be an Econ major.  He simply could care less about the class and it shows. The answer keys on problem sets are disgraceful, since he doesn't give any explanations, and often even the answer is illegible. Exams really varied in toughness.  I got a B+ in this class and it was still the bane of my existence

course material was straightforward and interesting and prof w's explanations were pretty good. but he definitely surprises you with difficult and tricky test questions. the multiple choice questions are a pain and even worse than the rest of the exams. almost everyone did poorly on the final, and their grade dropped as the semester went on...bad.

class was interesting and straightforewatd. he told a lot of jokes about college students being hungover 24/7 but whatever.  I liked the class a lot because all problems could be solved by understanding the 3 or 4 graphs per chapter.  I would take again given the chance.

material was straightforward and easy, tests were very tricky and difficult, prof w enjoys throwing curveballs and phrasing test questions poorly to throw off students, tests are worth 85% of your grade and since he likes to be tricky and no straightforward on tests, the course can be quite difficult

Really straightforward material that is easy to grasp if you have any mathematical ability.  You don't have to read the text to get a decent grade just go to class and take good notes.  Homework assignments are helpful and exams are challenging only at some parts and for the most part straightforward. Hightly reccommended

Great Teacher.  At first i was having alot of trouble understanding the concepts but his graphs and explanations behind them made it more clear for me.  He really takes time out of his schedule to help students.  If youre a visual learner he's definitely the teacher for you!  Hes also just a really nice guy in general.  I recommend taking him.
He's kind of odd, and tells the same jokes over again, but I found the class interesting. The most important thing is to memorize the graphs and make sure to understand them.
very clear and incredibly funny.  i would recommend him if you want a straightforward econ 50 experience.  i also think he's a pretty nice guy.  just follow his system and you'll be fine.

def a dork, hard tests, does not grade easy, doesn't clarify the answer when you ask a question, will not help out when you have trouble, or had trouble, with a concept. make sure you label ALL CHARTS!!! marks off random point values.

Made classes interesting.  The jokes showed that he didn't mind being looked at funnily.  The best thing was he had a core set of stuff he wanted you to take out of the class, so he emphasized that.  I feel like I know the basics now.  Hard tests.
hez got the lamest jokes..he goes over the simple stuff over and over again and the hard stuff he quickly goes over..his tests..arent..easy..
Great prof for Econ 50.  His lectures and reveiw sessions really help.
He sucks.... He doesn't know the stuff and his exam is vague.

If you have to take econ 50 Weidenmier is probably easier than most of the other profs.  He gives you printouts of his power point lectures and practice tests for the midterms and final.  He also tries to be funny too.
excellent class, different, and interesting.
What??? CMC doesn't offer this course any longer?  Disaster! This was one of the best experiences at Claremont McKenna.  What happened?
cool class,  how come cmc didn't keep this program going??
excellent class & teacher! should be offered every semester - learned much more than just about the music.
I really liked the course.  We met at the end of the day and it was a great closer.  Always looked forward to Mon & Wed afternoons.  Super teacher - older than my dad, but hot.
Excellent class, well-organized, interesting, challenging, and fun!  Take it!

He is the BEST teacher I had the ENTIRE time I was at the Claremont COlleges. Very helpful and uses excellent books, he uses wonderful videos, and great concerts.  Truly an inspired, inspirational teacher and a WONDERFUL CLASS. Need I say more? YOUR ROCK PROFESSOR GRATZ!

One of my favorite music courses.  Gratz is really a nice guy, and a wonderful musician. If you don't go to his concerts and you don't participate in class, you will not do well. He is a fair grader and it is possible to get an A if you do the work. And his class is interesting.

I took this class thinking it would be easy, but anyone who says it is easy is CRAZY. His tests are difficult they made me want to cry--which is ironic, because music is supposed to be fun. But he is into small details and I just could not follow him. Not too many papers/tests, but grades very harshly.

Loves to teach and can be engaging because of it. But his class is poorly organized. Very easy. Lots of films of live performances. Mandatory attendance at 3 jazz concerts. Papers are generally reaction papers.

It's a class of mostly seniors so she's pretty chill about assigned work and grading. The tests are hard to prepare for because she isn't really clear about what's going to be on it, but if you're thorough and do all the readings you'll do alright. The lectures are pretty long and arduous.

Janet Smith is one of the finest professors at CMC. She throws the kitchen sink at you in terms of resources (textbook, PowerPoints, practice problems & solutions) that enable you succeed in her course. Her lectures are very focused. She is an extremely pleasant person and I learned a great deal about valuation of new ventures in her course.
This class is very helpful- but as usual, I've found econ to be common sense+quant skills.  Smith helps you apply both.  She is not the most profound, but she is very clear.
No Comments
No Comments

As a professor, she is insightful, a great educator and a discussion leader. After taking the class you'll realize the wisdom you have gained throughout the semester through reading and writing critically. This class takes quite a lot commitment but it's totally worth it.
Professor Bilger is the best professor ever! Strongly recommend to international students.

Bilger is by far the best teacher I have had at CMC. She is a really great teacher who makes every class fun and interesting. We read a lot of great works in her class and she has truly helped me improve my writing. Take her class she will change your life!

Professor Bilger was one of my favorite instructors while I was an undergraduate, and now that I'm in grad school, I appreciate her even more.  The assignments and discussions that I participated in for Professor Bilger prepared me for the rigors of graduate study and I regularly refer back to ideas from her classes.

Professor Bilger is amazing! She's a really nice person and eager to help you if you don't understand. Taking feminist theory with her was definitely a good choice. The class was mostly discussion about the text you had to read for homework, which may have gotten boring sometimes. You can ask her to help edit your essays too!

Prof Bilger is funny, nice and interesting. Lots of reading, but what do you expect in a lit class? Really uses class discussions well; our class on theater did performances too, which were fun. She knows her field well, and she gives you lots of freedom and feedback on papers. Definitely worthwhile, especially if you like seminar classes.
Audrey's passion for Literature definitely comes across in her teaching

One of my those life changing professors. Really listen to her, and take the time to prepare thoughtful class discussion topics and essays, and you will benefit as a student and as a person.  She truly wants every student to learn and succeed, and will help you in any way she can.  I can't wait to take another class with her.

I took Feminist Theory from Prof. Bilger sort of because I felt like it was something I ought to do before graduating from Scripps.  It ended up completely changing the way I view the world.  It was empowering in the most amazing way.  The material is great and Bilger lets the students take control of class discussions.

A fantastic class with a great reading list and engaging discussions.  Professor Bilger is knowledgeable, supportive, and accessible.  First class I've had where student led discussions have been fun and effective.  Very helpful during office hours.
Brilliant and amazing.  Expects a lot, but will work hard for you if you work hard for her.  Her classes will change your life.

This was a bad class. Prof. is very defensive and at times hostile, rejecting students ideas that don't line up w/ her own narrow, feminist, anti-male perspective. Grading policies are subjective and unfair. Don't touch w/ a ten-foot pole. (I want a refund.)

Terrible teacher.  Teacher lets feminist ideologies get in the way of teaching.  She plays favorites and will not allow contradictions to her own ideas.  She will actually grade people down for stating contradicting opinions during class.  She's an easy te

She has one of the largest cult followings at CMC. She's a hard grader. Her office hours are jampacked.  That said, she's incredibly, incredibly nice and down to earth. Go chat with her just for fun (if there's not a huge line).
No Comments
fantastic teacher.  Very helpful in and out of class.  Perhaps the most caring and compassionate prof I've ever met.

She's awesome!  She definitely keeps each student accountable for the reading.  Each student has to post in an online discussion on WebCT before each class.  At first I found this really annoying, but it keeps everyone reading.  This makes for some great discussions.  I highly recommend her class!!!

This has been my best and favorite reading based class I've taken at CMC.  She keeps all of the students engaged and accountable for the material, which helped us get somewhere with class discussions.  I became a better writer in her class.

Professor Bilger is a wonderfully compassionate human being and a caring teacher.  I'm in graduate school now, but I still think fondly of her.  She taught me so much, and was always there to help and encourage.  Highly recommended.
Great prof.  Really helpful.  Good class discussions.

Nice guy, but gets lost easily, often creates too tricky examples that even he can't work through. Homework can be on subjects not covered properly in class and at a level that has not been explained. Tests are not bad though. Out of 19 or so at the beginning less than half remained...
Doesn't know the math he's trying to teach
his classes are easy but boring

He is a very bad teacher, but the class was easy (that might be because i took it in highschool).  Every class was the EXACT same, except he varies how he says "Now let's see if you've learned any of this".  you only have to do the problems he tells you to turn in and the tests are easy.

Do not take this course.  If you must take CSCI 51, take it at Pomona or with Professor Lee.  Pinter-Lucke should not be teaching this course.  He is helpful in office hours but class-wise, extremely unclear.  Too many useless assignments also.  Any class where half the students drop should tell you something about the professor.
this class isn't even worth going to, i understand the book a thousand times better than i understand the lectures.

The material covered in the class was pretty easy, I understood it, but the grades are not a good indication of this.
