Homework is graded on accuracy, tests are hit or miss, and I felt like I had to struggle to try and get a B on the tests.  Basically everyone I knew got a C.  Pretty hard to do well.
nice guy, willing to work with you during office hours, but not much help at all. tests are very hard and classes do little to prepare you
Very tough to follow; lectures often have little to do with homework and tests. The book isn't much help.

This is the worst class I've ever taken. His lectures are weird, scattered and confusing; the textbook is even worse. All the hw is submitted via WebCT so if you miss the window, that's it. The problems are difficult and time-consuming.

This is the worst class I've ever taken.  His lectures are weird, scattered and confusing; the textbook is even worse.  All the hw is submitted via WebCT so if you miss the window, that's it.  The problems are difficult and time-consuming.
really not a  good prof - doesn't explain things well at ALL.  tests are too long for time period given.  avoid having him if you can.
Good man with reasonable expectations. He was the best for calculus all things considered.

Pinter-Lucke is the man, there are maybe ten problems due per week. 3 tests total, and they're pretty basic, straight-forward. He's pretty unorganized though, he sometimes loses himself in his lectures
it's basically been stated by everyone else already. He's not a good teacher.
terrible class....almost as bad as wright
Standard, high-school class. If you know your calculus than it is an easy A. Boring lectures but fair grader and fair workload.

Quite possibly the worst professor I have encountered at the Claremont Colleges. He assigns way too much work and some of the homework problems are so ridiculously complicated, he can't even do them himself.he was helpful during office hours, though.
this class was the worst - I knew more than he did at the end of the class, ridiculous amounts of work and the tests were horrible
Just don't do it. Seriously, get another Prof.

Hatcher-Skeers is a great professor, but does tend to go a little quickly at times. Although she is really friendly and nice outside of class, she does come off as intimidating and sometimes a little rude during lecture. Helpful during office hours.

Very good at explaining the material and makes sure you get it. Classes are very fast (rushes through topics) and very packed with material (covers a lot of topics in one class). Exams are relatively hard but nothing you can't handle if you've done the reading and come to class. Would recommend her class if you don't mind the hard work.

Great Teacher and Extremely helpful! she explains well , but lectures are extremely fast and very "dense" (material wise). she will cover a chapter per lesson and usually expects you to "fill in the blanks" ( what you didnt understand in class) by solving problems from the textbook. and a lot. thats how she expects you to get the material "down".

Love her! Her tests are very hard because of time constraints but her lectures are crystal clear. Might seem intimidating at first but is such a wonderful person and teacher. Even if you are just taking this class for a GE, she makes it easy

She's really smart, but she assumes you have a good background in chem and goes very fast. If you get left behind you have to work very hard to keep up. A fair grader but very demanding, intimidating, and rude at times. Her labs and tests are very hard. Not a bad teacher, but not very nice.
She is really cute and sweet, I liked her a lot.  She really wants you to suceed, but she doesnt curve and is fairly tough.
No Comments
Great lecturer, great tutor, great friend...highly recommended.
Good professor, tough class w/ exams very hard to finish w/ the time constraint.

Hatcher Skeers is a very good teacher. Although the tests are tough, if you do the assigned readings and assignments, it isn't that bad.  Your grade defenetly reflects how much work you put into the class.

Prof. Rosenbaum's FHS class is about the intersection of eastern and western history and philosophy. The assigned readings involved a diverse range of primary sources and novels. Each writing assignment helped students reflect on one section of the class. He raises key points in class discussions, and is always happy to elaborate on them in office

Professor Rosenbaum has fine-tuned this class over many decades. He enjoys discussions with his students, both inside and outside the classroom. I felt inspired by the discussions and arguments that he raised. Students have a say in the topics that are discussed after the initial part of the course. This is a rewarding class for engaging students.

The professor is a nice guy, but his class is just way too boring. His lecture is not organized at all, and he just say whatever jumps to his mind. He gives way too much reading and the readings are boring but not as boring as his lecture. Don't take his class if you are really interested in Chinese history, cuz at the end of the semester you won't

Modern Chinese History could've been a great course, but Rosenbaum was just so boring and, above all, disorganized. He rambled on and on without really saying anything, and he strayed off the syllabus for weeks without being aware of it. Nice guy, and obviously knowledgeable. Perhaps his teaching skills declined as he aged, which is too bad.

The worst teacher I've had at this school. Lectures go absolutely nowhere and use of Powerpoint is almost redundant. I guess he is willing to help outside of class but his classes are boring and a huge waste of time. He asks for opinions but shuts them down if they challenge him or does not go along with the lesson plan. Don't take his classes.

Professor Rosenbaum is such a great guy! His lectures can be a bit boring at times and he does assign a lot of reading, but you learn tons and still really enjoy the class. If you talk in class he will really appreciate it as well. There is a pretty decent amount of work but if you try hard you should do well.

Rosenbaum is a fantastic professor if you're interested in the material.  He knows his stuff and will go out of his way to help you learn.  The only problem comes on his bad days, when the lectures can become boring if you aren't super into the material.  If you are, take him!

Extremely insightful and knowledgeable professor. If you're interested in East Asian philosophy/history, you won't be disappointed. However, if it's not your cup of tea, the class may seem very dry. Participation is important so read the material before class and be prepared to discuss. Essays were manageable most of the time (3 5-pg. & 1 10-pg.)
boring
Extremely knowledgable, I learned a ton, but he assigned an unrealistic, intense amount of reading.

Takes a little while to get used to and his lectures can be boring (as are the textbooks) BUT not a bad guy, doesn't grade too hard if you put in a little effort, if you are a history major then take him.
he only emails back when he wants to. you can never get extra office hours. he ignores students that he doesn't like.

The Baum is The Bomb.  Gandhi and Mao should really be called Gandhi and/or Mao though.  Class was long, but he is a nice grader, and a nice guy.  It's a lot of reading and writing, but he will reward you with a good grade.

A lot of work, but if you do it expect the grades to be good.  Nice guy too.  He keeps the class interesting, challenging, but he's also understanding if you make minor screw-ups every once and a while.

Mr. Rosenbaum is AWESOME! He is an expert in his field who really helps you out and helps you to learn the material.  He really exposes us to extremely interesting topics, and runs a really great class! His personality and friendliness make me feel as though the class is one big family at times.

Class sessions were really boring but that was influenced by my disinterest in subject and the early hour course was taught; Professor is incredibly kind and cares about students; he is also passionate and knowledgeable about his field; write strong, well researched papers and class is an easy A
No Comments
Didn't have him as a prof but he's my advisor and he's a great guy. Very nice, very helpful

First two mid terms can be quite challenging if you start studying 2 days before the test. If you start studying a week before the test, then you have nothing to worry about. Final exam is very easy compared to the mid terms.

His lectures are really thorough and interestinghe doesn't take attendance but you shouldn't miss them. I found his ecology elective a lot more engaging than the intro 44 class; in fact, I'd say tropical ecology was one of my top 5 favorite classes in college and I'm not even a STEM major or pre-med student. No lab.

Lectures are a bit sporadic, but combining notes with a few classmates, you can get the info needed to ace the exam. Very friendly, great attitude, adorable Australian accent, and very passionate about the info he teaches. Exams are similar to the past exams that he uses as practice exams. Little outside of class work. Very pleasant overall.
Every other word out of his mouth is "ummmmm" other than that he's really easy, ulta tight and way out there...go Bio!
Wonderful Professor! Helped me see Biology as number of interrelated interesting theories,instead of a bunch of random facts. Great lectures, really funny!

She has a great attitude and wants all of her students to thrive. Short quizzes once a week, but they help you grasp the basic concepts and prepare before the test pops up. Lots of practice tests/review sessions, and sometimes she will recycle test questions. She is always willing to help.

so nice and accomodating. never gets angry with students and very sweet. not the best lecturer but if you even skim the book you're fine. very fair tests and quizzes. lab is boring but that's not her fault.
SO BORING.  She writes heaps on the board, but it's impossible to retain anything or stay awake.  Still, she lectures better than some other intro bio profs.  Save yourself and take Sadava.
No Comments
It seemed that she wanted her students learn, but I did not find her to be that good of a professor. She is not the most interesting lecturer, take Wiley or Sadava.
Very helpful teacher who will always go out of her way to help her students.  Writes notes on board and tests are pretty fair.  Good experience.

Dr. Justice is a wonderful professor who gives her all to her students.  As my thesis reader, Dr. Justice helped me learn more about biology and scientific research with wonderful insight and instruction.
One of my favorite profs at cmc. Super easy class, not much reading, but is able to participate in discussion even if u didnt do the reading. Super chill guy

Professor Huang is a great professor who really understands "ancient" and "modern" philosophy. He also has great discussions on ethics and technology, and is a very applicable class. Because of him I am looking forward to taking more philosophy classes.
Love Dean Huang. Great guy, extremely easy class while I still managed to learn a lot taking a GE. Teaches you how to argue clearly and logically as long as you participate plenty in class.

Amazing discussion leader, emphasizes what is most important. Very engaging and never bores you. You should never worry if you encounter difficult concepts in the reading, because he gives great explanations in class. A few papers, some simple assignments, and a final. Overall it is an easy intro class, but you learn a lot.

Dean Huang is a f*$&ing G.  This class kicks ass.  Everyone should be required to take it just so you realize how badass the CMC administration really is.  Plus, you've got to give the man props for his style.  Orange sunglasses and a suit without fail.

What a great class.  You don't waste time on long-winded works: you study good summaries/examples of what each topic.  You get a huge breadth of information, which is great for an intro class.  Most importantly, you get to discuss ideas for most of the class, which is the whole idea behind philosophy.  It's a great class, and he's an easy grader.
No Comments
Very interesting course. Great person. Not lots of work, but lots of thinking. I learned a lot.
He made me think about what matters.
Dean Huang's class is really fun.  It's easy.  No midterms!  Only 2 papers.  And one group project.

The tests are hard but he is VERY GENEROUS with the curves. He is a very sweet man but can be a little boring but he makes such bad jokes that it's kinda funny. You get 4 pages of notes on each test and 12 pages of notes on final. He isn't the best prof but much much better than the other accounting profs so I recommend him

Rosett is so nice and is always cracking jokes. Lectures get boring but it's necessary to go to class to show you're putting effort into the class. He requires a lot of memorization of very small details but he has 5 tests which breaks up the information into smaller chunks. Homework is not graded and test curves are generous.

He teaches by writing out notes and explaining them; lectures are pretty good, and he is clearly intelligent. However, the material can be dry and the textbook is terrible. There are 5 quizzes (full class periods) that are very fair and manageable if you study and know what you're doing. The overall class isn't amazing, but I would take him again.
Lectures are boring, and can be skipped. He puts in the effort to learn his students' names. Very nice, smart professor. 5 quizzes throughout the semester  too many.

Didn't like his teaching style. Really liked the 5 quiz system. Didn't like the online portion of the class. Professor Rosett has an odd sense of humor that can be really amusing, but is also easily distracted from the course material. Most of the learning is self-study
One of the top professors at CMC. Interesting, helpful, engaging. Highly recommend if you're at all serious about learning accounting.
Very good professor, but I hear that he is not the best in the accounting department.

if professor Massoud didnt have such a great reputation, rosett would be regarded as one of the best professors in the department. hes an amazing guy- he likes to challenge his students, but that just makes you perform at a level you never could have expected of yourself. amazing man.

A good teacher. Better than average. Also very friendly. His corny jokes really helps me get through 3 hours/week of numbers and words. He teaches most things clearly, but if anything is confusing, he doesn't clarify any better, even if you ask him during office hrs. Tests strongly based on class notes-not too bad. Accting is sometimes interesting.

Professor Rosett is very funny.  He does his best to enertain in a class like accounting which generally isnt very enertaining.  The quizzes are really tough unless you are committed to learning the details that are covered in the book.  The accounting concepts are not difficult and they are important for upper level accounting classes.

Rossetts conveniently posts everything from the homework to your letter grade over the net.  His tests are tricky and he gives 70 MC, which is torture but overall he is a "nice" teacher with sloppy handwriting.  I find his notes to be helpful but I feel like my grade doesn't deserve the effort I put in.  his lame jokes WILL KEEP YOU AWAKE IN CLASS
No Comments
Introduction to Accounting really isn't all that hard. Somewhere between the lame jokes, the disorganized notes and the "tricky" MC questions this course became torture!

You'd think that grades in accounting would be clear but his grading is shiftier than a manual transmission car because he curves to a murky "historical" class average.  Despite telling corny jokes, you won't be entertained - avoid the pain.

I always was one of those kids who "just doesn't get math." Prof Peterson changed that. During office hours she walked us through problems in the level of detail I needed providing alternative explanations. Her feedback and guidance during freshman year were invaluable in my later finance courses. If you put in the work she is a great resource.

The worst teacher I have ever encountered. Homework was rarely covered in class and tests were tough. If you have never taken calculus before, avoid at all possible costs. Lectures are boring and she'll constantly get through explaining a topic before going back on everything, realizing she did it wrong.
The only reason I passed this class was because I already took IB Calc before and couldn't get credit for it.  Avoid this professor!

For your health and sanity... Don't take a class with this professor. She is just not a very intelligent person who is no where near being grounded in reality. Too put it simply, she is a bad teacher. If you have taken calculus before then you are a better teacher than she is.

do not take this class. this women is possibly the worst teacher i have ever encountered.  calc and math in general will be ruined for you. it will be the worst part of your week. some kids never come to class except for the tests class is so unbearable. stay away.
This woman will make you hate math. Avoid at all costs.

The class is easier if you've already had calc before. Watch out for tough tests and some crazy problems in homework assignments that aren't covered in class. The final is basically bits and pieces of each previous test so if you study you should be okay.
Stay away whatever you do. She will torment you with terrible explanations and homework that is so much harder than any of the tests. If you're lucky, you'll get another teacher

Terrible Prof. She will make you hate math. Her problem is she relies way too much on the text for her explanations and makes everything more complicated than it has to be. Don't take her for intro courses
she was quirky, and somewhat entertaining, but took a subject that I'm normally good at and between her and the book, made it much more difficult than it actually is.
Bad intro teacher. During classes, she just reads from the book... avoid for intros
She is picky about strange things and explains things in confusing ways. Her homework is always much harder than the things we cover in class. I do not recommend taking her class.

While she may be helpful and willing to answer questions, she wouldn't have to if she explained the material fully before assinging homework. She does a very poor job with in class explanations and examples. She also gives very, very, long, difficult homework assignments that do not reflect what we learned in class. In my opinion, an awful prof.
Prof Peterson gets a bad rap, however she is pretty easy and is always willing to answers questions either in class or in office hours. Her tests are easier than the hw.

Apparently she used to tell jokes and not the material but teaches the material and not the jokes. Not terribly hard if youve had some calc in high school, but math requirement is just annoying anyway and need a 5 on BC AP to pass out, which is, difficult.
She teaches the class like a kindergarten teacher and it is very boring.  The homework is much harder than the tests, and she does not know how to solve any problems.  Easy tests though!

Peterson's great - never gives up until everyone understands, and takes time and care to answer questions. tests are easier than expected, and very helpful in office hours.  very very very nice and funny in a nerdy way. only bad thing: hw due every class is really annoying. better than most cmc math profs.

Easily the worst teacher - in the world.  Absurd and completely unhelpful homework assigned every class period, expected to take 2 hours.  She is a complete jerk - I took this class in high school and understood less after taking this course.  Math30 is a requirement but taking prof peterson is not - avoid at all costs.
Ugh. Worst math prof. ever. Can't teach for s***. Highly confusing and no help in office hours.
No Comments

If you've taken calculus before, you will do fine in this class.  If not, steer clear.  She can be difficult to understand if you don't have some sort of calc base already.  Other than that, her tests are straight forward, office hours are open and grading isn't out of line.  Definitely do your homework and show up to class.  She's pretty nice too.
If you've taken calc before or math is your strength, it's easy to do well. Frankly there isn't much choice in calc teachers at CMC and it seems she's the best you can do.

You better have taken Calc before, because this lady  cannot teach. She's nice, but very very very nerdy and boring and confusing. IT also might be good NOT to take this class if you've had upper-level calc already...like I did. The easy-A is not worth the pain in class.
Peterson, though a very nice professor, isn't one I'd choose to teach me mathematics again. I felt her classes to be very unhelpful, sadly. So...nice professor, not the best teacher.

She has a great sense of humor and likes to enertain the class.  She throws around a lot of weird/random math jokes, but does a good job getting the material across.  If you have any questions, she always spends extra time in class talking them through, and all tests are very straight forward.

Compared to most other professors, Peterson is paradise! She actually explains the material in class and is always open to questions. She was never unable to answer them and never gives up trying to explain things from different angles until one understands it. Also very good in office hours.
Shes a horrible teacher, I didn't learn a thing. She doesn't seem to know the material very well, and she doesnt appear to prepare for her lectures before hand.  Avoid her at all costs.
she's a "teacher?"
She's a sweet person and a good prof, but you have to put in some effort to learn something.

Unless you have already taken Calc 1 and everything will be review, stay away.  One comment says you will do fine if you know your math, aka, already took Calc 1 and everything will just be review.  If you actually need to LEARN it, STAY AWAY.

Preest is a nightmare.I had her for lab/class. She will ruin any interest you have in biology. I took Bio,considering it as a major, but after her class, I will be switching. She is inconsiderate and doesn't care about her students. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS/LAB WITH HER! It is not unusual to get a D on a lab report without any comments. Beware!

Preest is not bubbly, but she is extremely caring. Expectations are high but extremely clear. Labs are fun (you get to play with a lot of animals) but to succeed on lab reports you must spend a lot of time meeting with her for guidance (and if, god forbid, you hurt an animal, you should probably run and never come back). Highly recommended class!

Her tests are based on memorization rather than understanding of the material. Thus makes it hard for certain people. Will judge you based on whether or not you sit in the front or the back of class and if you bring your laptop or not. Very useful during office hours. Somewhat intimidating though.
Lectures are really clear. Hard to raise your grade especially if you're not a great test-taker.

Preest expects you to know what she has taught you, and to know it well, but not at all to a ridiculous degree.  She truly engages in the material, and gets her students to as well.  I appreciate her side stories and examples of concepts she's talking about.  Wonderful!

Grades labs very hard (I don't think anyone ever got an A on a lab report). Lab will definitely bring down your grade, but on plus side, you get to play with toads. Lecture is very easy. Don't even read the book. Just study her lecture slides. Generally nice and approachable, but can be mean/moody at times. Yelled at me for being late to lab once.
Grades lab reports ridiculously hard. She isn't clear on what she wants on them either. Lecture's pretty easy though.
I would recommend if you have to take Intro to Bio, to avoid Preest.
No Comments
This class was terrible. Prof EG seemed pretty knowledgeable but the class was so repetitive and disorganized. Also she grades things she disagrees with more harshly which is kind of dumb.
She's super passionate and explains everything well.  If someone is confused, she can easily come up with other explanations/analogies. Prof E-G is also one of the most adorable people ever.

She focuses only on "feature investigations" which are hard to understand because she doesn't teach the basic material well at all. She skips around on the board and isn't clear at all. I'm sure she is great of Molecular Bio but intro bio isn't her world.

She's pretty terrible. Assigned at least 50 pages of reading in the textbook each week. Doesn't curve her tests, even though everyone failed the second one. Exams are extremely difficult and she likes to pick random buried facts from the text and test you on them. Avoid at all costs.

really don't like her. she spends way too much time lecturing on the "feature investigations" from the book and doesn't even come close to covering the material in class that she should.  nice in person, but bad in lecture. her tests are too long and pretty hard. take someone else if you can for bio43, but she's probably good for upper level stuff.
Very friendly and nice person, but can be a bit confusing. Tests are fair enough.

Nice and very friendly, cute overall. Pretty bad lecturer; she just posts pictures from the book and jumps around randomly to new subjects. Her assignments and tests are pretty pointless, but she'll count almost anything right if you BS a little. If you put in a little work the class is pretty easy, but you really have to teach yourself.

Not the best lecturer but really helpful and painfully nice and funny. Has gotten better in lecturing since the first semester and more organized, but can still sometimes go off into tangents. Office hours are helpful though if you want more clarification. A fun person to talk to as well, and is overtly nice and cute in a motherly way.
Mol Bio with Edwalds-Gilbert, is fantastic :)  Take it

To put it simply: DO NOT TAKE Bio 43 from this prof!! The class is a waste of time. She just goes over the pictures in the bio book, which she says NOT to read b/c it's a waste of time and b/c her exams are only on info from classtime... which is funny, b/c we never learned anything in class.

Honestly, I felt attending class was a waste of time.  She would only put up overhead pictures from the chapter, and never reviewed the concepts from the text.  There is a lot of reading from a dense book, be prepared to teach yourself bio chem.  Overall, not helpful, and doesn't motivate the studen

Not a horrible teacher, but be prepared to do a lot of group (groups are assigned, you dont get to choose who to work with) work for homeworks and stuff.  Classes are pretty dull and the lectures are not all that helpfull.  Not a bad teacher though.

Dr. Spalding is a fantastic teacher - she's challenging, thoughtful, and a great person (she set up a ton of DC opportunities for our class & is more than willing to help with networking, even after you leave DC). It seems most students that don't like her do so bc of her politics (god forbid students should be exposed to a different viewpoint).
Dr. Spalding is fantastic! While she is a tough grader and does not necessarily lay expectations out plainly, she is always there for help and to answer questions.

I liked Professor Spalding. From her, I learned when to speak up and when to shut up. She expected me to actually know what I was talking about, and would listen to my arguments (even though I was a liberal) because I had reasoning and evidence behind each thing I said. She expects a lot out of you, and I think I was much better for it.

Extremely kind, very invested in student learning and well-being! The class is almost entirely discussion based, but Professor Spalding steps in when necessary. I would disagree with previous comments; I cannot tell which way Spalding swings politically. I will say that she is not an easy grader, though.

I heard current students complain, so here are my thoughts from '08. The class is a waste b/c the prof doesn't actually teach. She would be ineffective even if she did, because she doesn't tolerate other opinions. She can never justify the grades she gives, and she's totally unapproachable if you have a problem with her or her class.

Spalding is the only thing wrong with the D.C. program.  Her grading is subjective and arbitrary, her favorites are obvious, and, though she may seem nice in a group setting, she's a witch when she has a problem with you.  As a director, she doesn't hold to her own program rules, punishing students on a whim...and I'm a conservative male.

Be very careful before entering the DC Program. While Spalding may be a good person, she is by no means a good teacher. Her grading scale makes no sense. She prefers men to women and will grade accordingly. She has favorites. She isn't fond of liberals. I would argue that she is one of the most frustrating teachers I have ever had. Beware!

One of the best professors at CMC. An excellent leader of the program and a sharp mind. Be cautious if you cannot defend you views well. She makes sure that any argument made has some basis in more than "feelings". A semester in her class will make anyone better prepared for the real world.
Prof Spalding is one of the best professors at the Claremont Colleges.  She is smart, nice, and very fair.  I would recommend the DC program just to get a chance to study under such a fine person.

Contrary to the previous reviews, Spalding actually expects you to know your****. So come to class prepared, do the reading, and be able to defend your arguments. I suspect the reason why there are so many disgruntled individuals is because they weren't allowed to fire off their loose-cannons. Sorry, but in the real world, you are held accountable

Don't show your liberal side if you have one, your grade depends on it. Regurgitate passages from the reading in class and never stray from the Bush agenda. Don't talk about other foreign policy books that aren't assigned. Rude, rolls her eyes when you speak, refuses to let you talk then gives a bad participation grade. Say what she wants to hear!

Very partisan.  Does not direct discussion but expects you to stay on her imaginary road map.  She will hold your political views/actions on group orientation against you.  All in all, kind of a ****.  Republicans rejoice, others ... walk softly and carry a big stick
She's a nice person.  Unfortunately, nice person does not a good prof make - good luck if you find yourself on the DC program.

Quite possibly one of the worst professors. Arrogant, rude, neo-con. She does not care about her students and lets all her coservative views come through in her discussions and in grading you. She is just awful, and unwilling to help with any misunderstandings. Insecure, Condescending. Don't take he

Dr. Tang is just about the friendliest teacher ever and she is undoubtedly brilliant. Unfortunately, she is very difficult to understand, which makes the difficult material in AISS even harder to comprehend. She graciously spent lots of time in office hours going over the materials again. It is evident that she sincerely cares about her students.

Prof Tang's Cell Cycle, Diseases (Cancer), and Aging class is extremely interesting and manageable.  It is based on a series of research papers that relate very well to class material.  It is a very well organized class, and she is very passionate about the subject.

wonderful, sweet woman, but a truly awful teacher. She is one of those people who just has no teaching abilities. Her classes are disorganized, the homework does not match the lectures, and her tests are on material she has not covered. I could learn the material better if I just used the time I waste in class and hw each week on teaching myself

she is super friendly and passionate, but she does not explain things well at all and her lectures were completely disorganized. Even though i was really excited for the class, she did everything but destroy my interest in cell bio. I love her as a person but she is probably the worst prof ive had at JSD. dont take cell bio with her

I completely agree with another comment--she is super friendly and passionate, but she does not explain things well at all.  The best example of this is a lecture that we were told to read chapter 11 for.  It touched on topics in four different chapters, three of which the reading outline never mentioned.

Wonderful professor.  Really cares about her students and willing to help outside of class.  You get use to her accent and her lecture slides make her lectures easy to follow.  Knows her stuff and is very passionate about the material!

Biochemistry joint-taught between Dr. Wenzel and Dr. Tang. Her lectures are incomprehensible. Hard to follow & unorganized. It's sad because she is SO PASSIONATE about Bio and is BRILLIANT. Knows her stuff. She cares so much about her students but I'm sorry to say, her effectiveness in teaching/explaining is too low to be helpful.

Gives practice exams that shoe exactly what is going to be on the test. learned only from these. easy. i recommend her, even though class is pointless becaue you can;t understand her. She clearly knows what shes talking about though,
No one could understand her because her accent is so strong. The labs take forever and seem like a waste of time. She never explains techniques in lab so you just flail...
easy, fun and great teacher. all of you are trippin'. Tang is great and if you WANT to learn, then you will. so enthusiastic...she makes things so much easier than they already are.

AGAIN: Don't take her if you don't have to. Course is a waste of time and you will come out of class with no understanding of the material. Poorly organized structure, poor communication, and little grasp of the class dynamic. Two thumbs down.
DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!! going to class is a complete waste of time. you cant understand what she's saying because of her english. if you want to learn something take someone else.
nice lady, but bad teacher. you wont learn anything and the class is the biggest waste of time. dont take her if you want to learn something.

DO NOT TAKE. I MEAN IT. Do not take biology with this lady. You will learn nothing. She knows her shtuff, it is obvious, but doesn't speak clear English. Her class is poorly organized. Just reconsider. Try Sadava or something.

I was not as enamored of Bradley as many of my peers.  If you're already a strong writer, you'll do well in the class, but he didn't seem helpful for people who were struggling. He also allegedly mocked my class to other students. He is clearly very intelligent & the book selection was interested, but it was clear he did not want to teach Lit 10.
Hard class, but Bradley is very engaging. Great teacher to have but come prepared in class or he'll know

Professor bradley is a great teacher! he's got a great speaking voice and he dresses great and amazingly beautiful....overall I'd have to describe him as a tall mug of hot chocolate with tiny mini marshmallows :)

great professor. Engaging discussions. Has a great background and is doing some really neat things. Hard grader and I agree that if you go to his office hours it helps because it then that you know what he wants and/or expects from you.

He's a great guy...super smooth and cool. He grades pretty hard and is picky about it too. I suggest going to his office hours and talking to him about papers...only thing i couldn't stand about him was the fact he had to mention his graduate work at Harvard every class...
Bradley is one of a kind.  So passionate and knowledgeable, but open to student opinions.  Helpful beyond belief, no matter what the problem is.  Honest but easy going w/ constructive criticism.

Great guy but his teaching style is flawed. You'll spend an entire class period on the first page of a book and he assings annoying little papers that are too small to care about but then he grades them kinda tough...Office is always open though and the material is interesting, so if you're fine with getting a B then take him.

-Nice Guy
 -Ditto on the sometimes mind-numbing lectures
 -I consider myself a good writer and still got low B's and an A on three of my papers (dont have the others yet)
 -Really only get graded on papers so that's what's hard
 -Otherwise easy, ok if you miss a day reading, ok reading list, and sometimes makes HipHop music references (kinda cool :

I thought Prof. Bradley was great.  His class a great way to start out your college experience because he doesn't torture you. I loved his reading list. I found his class to be kinda hard, but some kids that think they know everything think it is easy. He's very helpful and easy to approach.
Professor Bradley is amazing! Very intelligent and extremely nice. Class is a nice balance of lecture and discussion. Assigned work is reasonable. He is very approachable and understanding.
Ridiculous grader, by far.  If you regurgitate everything that he says in class, you'll do wonderful.  He's very full of himself, but if you like to kiss ass you may get an A.  Good luck, though.
cool prof.

A really nice guy and a fairly easy teacher, but not terribly easy.  His ease comes from the fact that he doesn't assign much work.  We had four papers in the semester.  He does grade a bit toughly, though, so if you don't want to do much but don't mind a B, he's a good prof.

Bradley likes to talk about the fact that he went to Harvard... a lot. Like every day.  He plans his classes and lectures very carefully, so what students say in class rarely matters.  Fairly hard grader on papers, and classes can be very boring  Nice guy though
I LOVE prof Haskell! He's so funny, and while sometimes the class lacks structure, he's pretty good at answering questions so ask him about the things you don't feel clear on.
Professor Haskell might be the best professor I have had at CMC! He is absolutely fantastic and super knowledgeable. Take the time to meet him for coffee to talk about an assignment or just life.

Great Professor, very funny, definitely not the type to coddle you.  The most interesting government class I have taken at CMC.  His textbook was great to read, it was like he was just talking to you personally.  Not sure why the negative ratings, everybody who went on the DC Program my year thought he was one of the best Profs they ever had.
Extraordinarily engaging. Loved going to his class. Great speaker. No outside reading required.

Contrary to a few people on here, I thought Prof. Haskell's class was the best in D.C.  He's interesting, witty, and amazingly makes the budget process somewhat enjoyable to learn.  He's a tough grader, but it's objective and consistent.  The program is tough, and so is he.  You can do well if you put the effor in.

Despite other arguments, Haskell is not a good teacher. He doesn't answer questions but instead defers them to the students without giving any answer. He is completely unhelpful and often doesn't reply to e-mail. He spends class time making condecscending jokes and dropping the names of all the 'important' people he knows. Don't put yourself in hel

fair grader on midterms, very funny and witty,   great person to chat with, very helpful with questions, TOUGH grader on papers. however, i looked forward to going to his class every week. he SHOULD not be fired.
Great guy. Hilarious. Awesome Prof.  Knows the budget process inside and out.  DC Program is the greatest.  If you can't hang you are stupid.

Haskell never gets the praise he deserves.  Most students who complain don't like him bc he won't let you get away with BS in his class.  He's funny, witty, and makes you work hard.  Yeah, his grading's tough and the budget is boring, but he is a great prof. who calls people on their BS.  I found it refreshing.

WORST. Blabs on about nothing. Grades like an a**. Thinks he's a comedian. Makes condescending comments. Thinks everyone needs to memorize intricacies of the budget process because he devoted his life to nerddom. Study like no other, use examples from the reading. Will give you a bad paper grade, guaranteed. He needs to be fired. ****ing DC program

Professor Haskell enjoys telling jokes.  He's very smart and I think he wants the students to learn.  HOWEVER, he provides no structure in his class, does not give clear advice on what he wants and grades like a mo fo, out of nowhere.  Worse than Weintstein.  He's a terrible teacher.  FIRE HIM.
He is very fun and entertaining.  His class is not too much work, but he is a hard grader.
I love Professor Yoo!  He is very nice, funny, and really loves what he is teaching about and seems to love his students.  His is easily my favorite class this semester.

This was my favorite class this semester! met once a week, and sometimes Yoo would let us out early. one test which was easy and a book per week. one paper 15-20 pages which was worth 55% of your grade, if you're not a good writer 4get the class. Take this class if you want an easy grade. Yoo is very laid back. students led class discussions

I really liked Yoo's class. He planned a field visit for us to a Buddhist center. He also had former students come and talk to us about writing a dissertation and finding a job as a professor because he felt this was as important as the class material since most students were interested in teaching. Very easy to talk to and very friendly.

Great classes. The class did sometimes feel like a book club meeting instead of a history class. If Yoo would take a more active role in leading the discussion, it would be an amazing class. Yoo's comments are always helpful, and he structures his assignments to make sure his students do well. I can't wait to take another class with in him.

Although he lacks energy a lot of the time, I thought that he was very thorough in presenting the major issues within ASAM history. Also a very nice guy. If I could have, I would have taken another class (I was a senior).
No Comments
No Comments

Professor Costanzo is one of the best professors I have had at CMC. He truly brings the topic to life in hands-on demonstrations and real-life scenarios. Truly a skilled professor. He is always asking for feedback and truly takes it into account. Take one of his classes!
So chill.  If class isn't needed, there won't be class.  Very practical, you learn a lot and it's straight to the point.
Informative and entertaining
No Comments

He's by far the best Professor at CMC. I have never met a person who has not been fascinated by him, and his classes are incredibly interesting. Easily my favorite class I've taken. Cannot stress enough how amazing this dude and class are.

The class is GREAT, the professor so-so. His reviews all remarked how preferential he is towards males, which is tough in a participation-heavy class, and we struggled with his lack of clarity of assignments (and making 60% of our grade due the week after thesis!). That being said, the class is AMAZING, one of the very best, just be prepared!

He is a great professor. The majority of the grade is participation so you'll need to make sure you speak up. He is very clear in his expectations and his course readings are interesting. This was probably one of the best classes I've taken at CMC!

Probably the coolest, most awesome, prof i have had at cmc.  Class wasn't to hard and he made it very easy to make it through a 3 hour seminar.  I would recommend him to anyone and after taking his class I am now making him my advisor.

great professor. Probably the best I've had at CMC.  He has a very good reputation in his field, and completely deserves it.  Discuss case studies in class, making the learing very applicable.  He made class low stress and easy to participate with.

Honestly, I think a class from Kirkland should be a requirement for Govt majors. All the information you learn is relevant, much of it you didn't know before (I didn't) even though it impacts your life in a big way, and it will continue to be relevant when you leave CMC. Many people in Govt don't know much about the military, and that's a shame.

Class was awesome!  I loved it. We went in depth about topics (NOT wars and stuff).. why war crimes? does army change you? recruitment?  great topics.  There is a lot of reading because you NEED to talk as this is a seminar.  1, 5 page paper a week too!  so it's a lot of work and you need to participate. harder than i thought

Major Kirkland is the best. He is compassionate, funny, and actually keeps the class interesting. He also doesn't have unrealistic expectations on the amount of work we are supposed to do. I highly recommend him.

Only one paper makes up pretty much your entire grade, so it kinda makes it hard to want to go to class, since it'll have no effect on your grade except for the little participation and weekly summaries.  But he's super funny, giggles, brings us food, and is overall very interesting.

He is such a cool prof- he brings cookies for every class.  He brings the topic to life, brings in guest speakers, and the class is fun.  All the MilSci kids love him too.  Decently easy class- 15-20 page paper due at end of semester.  You're graded for participation and analysis of weekly articles

Professor Halpern is very intelligent--and she knows it. She is fairly condescending and isn't very sensitive if you don't understand something. Her class is easy if you are good with memorization. Don't slack off because one bad test grade will come back to haunt you. A very interesting class.
Just make sure to read the book every week and you'll be fine!

Prof. Halpern is a wonderful human-being. She is the top of her field (in sex differences) and many of the articles we read cited her work.  Excellent and enjoyable class- and she gives you a rice-krispie-candy break for tea :)

our class was about 40 people, so lecture style and class size was enough that she knew our names but not enough to become close with the teacher. is a good lecturer, but some lectures straight from textbook and not very engaging. she is an easy grader on projects, homework, and essay portion of test, but multiple choice is hard. watch out!

Very professional, very smart, very good at explaining course content. It's necessary to read every page of the textbook to do well on exams. Multiple choice on the exams are KILLER if you don't read, but the essays are easy. Don't take the course to get an easy A, there is a lot of work involved. HIGHLY recommended for Psych majors.
She is right up there with the best. Underneath the professional demeanor and highest standards is a topnotch teacher who cares deeply for her students.

Extremely engaging professor.  You'll learn a lot and it's pretty easy to do well.  Classes are usually fun and go quickly.  Halpern really cares about her students and wants them to understand.  Go to her office hours, she's a lot of help and always asks for suggestions to make the class better.

Had her for cognitive psych.  awesome class.  awesome prof.  easy grader.  very interesting lectures.  there are a lot of projects and you have to do all the text reading to do well on tests, but most people get As.  not bad for a GE
The best professor I have had at CMC and an incredibly intelligent person.

One of the best professors across the Claremont Colleges. Lectures are intensely engaging. The Robert Day Scholars like to dominate this class, so be prepared to put in the time if you do not have an intellectual leaning towards finance.
She is an awesome lady in every way.  Best finance prof at CMC and maybe best prof overall.  She is also hilarious.  And hot, really hot.

she is for those who willing to devote much efforts. a lot of time required to prepare for each and every class. class is designed in a way if you dont put into work you learn nothing. she teaches great but very demanding class

Easily the greatest professor at CMC. Everything she says is gold. Demands a lot from her students, but it's worth it. Very nice and helpful when you visit her in her office. Also, her snarky comments are absolutely hilarious (and she dresses well).

Amazing Professor. Probably the best at CMC. Good real-world applicability. Learned all my Finance from her. Don't take her if you're neither smart nor hard-working. She is allergic to BS, but its ok to make mistakes. She can be intimidating, but very good natured if she knows you care about the subject. Would definitely take her again.

Prof. Meulbroek sets the standard to which all other professors at CMC should aspire to. Her style makes students prepare or suffer-and sooner or later everyone realizes they have to prepare. She has private sector (BCG, Goldman) experience, as well as public sector (SEC) experience AND taught at HBS before CMC. Don't miss the chance to take her.
She is a miserable woman and provides limited tangible feedback to students.
Best class at CMC. Work hard, prepare the cases and she will respect you for it. She will cold call you and if you say something stupid be prepared to get grilled. Great prep for the real world.
great class!

great course, case study method so there's a lot of work every week. she can be intimidating but she's nice if you can show her that you know what you're doing. no final exam, only a final group project, so overall, the workload is a lot more than for other classes during the semester, but slightly less work at the end of the semester. good class!
Tough prof, a lot of HW, but you learn a lot. case-study method is great. You're using Harvard Biz school material. she doesn't take any bs.

Corporate finance is a great course, and Meulbroek is the one to take it with. Lots of great case studies, and everything she says is gold. Pay attention and do your work; you'll learn a lot and have fun.
good class, case method

He is very enthusiastic about his subject, but I didn't really learn anything in his class that wasn't covered in AP Gov. He is a very interesting person and has great stories about working in government, but I wouldn't recommend him as a teacher. Your grade is completely based on arbitrary textbook terms.

After taking a few more classes at CMC, I discovered that Uhlmann is the worst teacher I've had at the 5Cs. If you are a liberal, DO NOT try to speak your mind or challenge him. He is a very staunch republican and very set in his opinions. He does know historical facts, however, he oftern presents them in an offensive way. DO NOT take for a GE.

Great teacher, knows what he's talking about because he was there. sometimes his lectures are long, he repeats the stuff he wants you to know for the tests over and over again so its easy to predict whats on the tests. If you study and pay attention you'll do great in the class.ask to meet him outside of class and he'll answer any question you have

It's really cool to know he worked in gov for a long time. However, it is very difficult to speak your mind in that class, especially if you are a liberal (he will burn easily you miserably). It was always hilarious seeing a student from Harvey Mudd try to attack him with his overconfident comments but the prof always knew how to control him.

prof was not very hard. lots of reading assigned but the lectures/midterm/final had nothing to do with it.  most of his lectures were the same, and that was our midterm word for word.  Easy workload...2 5-7 page "book reviews" (book reports...ya know 4th grade) and 1 midterm and a final. Personally I would take him again if given the chance

Extremely interesting anecdotes of his actual work in the US government for Reagan.  Uhlmann gives tests he says are "without surprises" but are quite difficult.  Remember obscure vocabulary terms for tests.  Lectures dry.  Is never in office when you need him to be--went during office hours four times, not there once.  Interesting, but hard.

Uhlmann is always willing to help outside class. His lectures can be boring at times but taking notes in class helps on the tests. He is an accomplished politicians. Coming to class with questions makes lectures very interesting.

Although Uhlmann's knowledge of the subjects he teaches is beyond reproach, his lectures are mind-numbing and his tests are ineffective and unfair. If you don't absolutely love the subject, find another prof.

Uhlmann is very willing to help outside of the classroom. He is also a very accomplished politician and very knowledgable. (he was special assistant to Pres. Reagan!) His lectures can be long, but if you do the reading and ask questions it's much more interesting. This class is better for those who like gov. We had three tests,one paper, and a fina

Uhlmann is very laid back, willing to give extensions and help outside of class.  He is a CGU prof, but plans on teaching more CMC courses.  He is pretty easy, assigned only 2 essays.  He's grandpa-y- kind and concerned about his students.  Sometimes his lectures can get boring, but overall, good

She is the best professor you could ever have, especially because she helps you become more driven and curious. The course material we read is intense but really interesting, we learn about different societies, and she gives great feedback. She is definitely not an easy grader, but I improved so much between my first written work and the last one.

Do not take Prof. Aitel's class. Incredibly difficult grader on papers even after meeting with her for help on papers multiple times and with the CWPD. I thought she would be easy given her rating on Rate My Professor, but it is MISLEADING. Fazia is kind in class, although her grading is harsh! Everyone in my class would agreed. Stay away!!!!

Do not take Prof. Aitel's class. Incredibly difficult grader on papers even after meeting with her for help on papers multiple times and with the CWPD. I thought she would be easy given her rating on Rate My Professor, but it is MISLEADING. Fazia is kind in class, although her grading is harsh! Everyone in my class would agreed. Stay away!!

DO NOT TAKE FOR FHS! The absolute worst professor I have ever had. Assigns an absurd amount of reading, reflections every week (which she grades very harsh), following the prompt on essays is not enough. No readings or films from this century (assigns a french film). Does not provide helpful insight, all she does is mediate discussions. Horrible.
good professor very clear in his explanations motivates students well. I had a good result everything is perfect
very good teacher that I recommend she takes the time explains things well very good teacher

Strict grader.  Did not give clear instructions on assignments and gave a penalty later.  Participation matters.  This prof was under the impression that there was some lack of motivation and gave me low grades.

Maybe it's because she was forced into teaching the class, but ugh. She means well, but she doesn't explain things well and didn't understand that this was the first time most of us had learned this material (FREN22 did not prepare us well). Textbook was horrible at explaining things she didn't, so it was difficult to learn what she expected us to.

I loved her! She was very helpful and definitely took note if you were proactive. I went to office hours and sent her lots of drafts for my papers and received good grades on them because she saw I was working hard. Overall awesome prof

Very nice prof. and very understandable. I really enjoyed the class as a whole except the material moved very quickly (as it was suppose to). There was only homework from the workbook due every monday along with a quiz. Overall easy class but that being said, she's not that great for teaching speaking fluency. It's all grammar.

LOVE HER! geniunely wants to help students (will correct your essay 4 times if you send it to her before turning it in) - keeps class interesting, does her best to have everyone participate - take a class with her you won't regret it!

She is AWESOME! She's really helpful and she has a very clear teaching style.  She moves a little fast in the beginning but that's okay because she makes it interesting.  She's an amazing Professor! I wish she was teaching 33 next semester!

I love professor Aitel! She does her best to keep the class interested during discussions and is always asking questions so everyone can participate. Though she assigns a good amount of homework, I found it all to be very interesting.
I absolutely loved taking French with Professor Aitel. She is funny, nice, understanding, and easy. She is so good that I took 33 and 44 with her. I highly recommend taking a class from her!
Very good teacher has recommended. It was through her ​​that I like to study and learn thank you very much for all

It's really thanks to Mrs. Aitel I learned really really very easy to recommend for languages.
 Explanation easy to understand very well taken. This is the best teacher I had

A pretty uninspired prof.  We didnt do any very interesting readings.  Class discussion was little to none and any discussions were pretty poorly facilitated.  For a French class, we barely had the chance to speak much.

Okay professor, she's kind of hard to get to know outside of class and she seems distant. Very helpful in office hours though, workload is light and not that hard, tough on grading but allows you to write drafts of papers first. You'll do well in class if you put in the effort

Aitel is a really nice, thoughtful french teacher.  sometimes class can get a bit boring, but it's pretty easy.  aitel is from paris, so her french is excellent.  she's super understanding, and she let us rewrite our papers 3 times each to get better grades.  great teacher!
No Comments

I really loved her class, she is adorable!  she will answer any questions you have, but she can be unclear at times.  She speaks fast and was probably the hardest french 33 prof, but your speach and comprension becomes better.  She really cares about her students, and classes were fun.

No essays, so you won't 100% die, but do need to participate, read studies, and do forum posts. Grades rigidly and the syllabus makes him sound utterly scary and unforgiving, but he's nice guy. You'll pick up good study strategies as a side effect.

Professor Cook is a very fair professor. He gives you notes that has all the slides and important concepts you need to know for the tests. If you study the way he suggests you'll do very well. Get ready to participate.

Professor Cook is awful and boring. He basically reads the slides out for you. Besides that, he gives pop quizzes so attendance is mandatory. Tests are easy if you study the textbook well. Otherwise, he is rude and often makes derogatory comments. I would NOT recommend this class.
Terrible at explaining concepts- instead talks about his personal life. Subjective as can be.

Professor Cook is so boring. He takes 30 minutes to say something that could be said in 2. I went to his office hours with 1 easy question and he talked for an hour. Also, he is very unclear about expectations for the group project (did not provide a rubric). I really do not like this man - even listening to him talk makes me frustrated.

I had him this semester (spring 2019). I would definitely not recommend for cog psych. His lectures covered concepts that seemed really obvious but the tests asked very specific questions that we did not go over in class. As a professor he made me really mad all the time.

Took for stats and cog psych. Would not recommend for stats. Lectures and HW were pretty easy but did not leave with a solid grasp of statistics after taking the class. Tried to teach R instead of SPSS and that led to a lot of trouble. Cog was easy class. Tests came pretty much from class handouts and a couple questions from textbook.
Worst professor ever. Really inappropriate in class, demeaning, and HORRIBLE at explaining material. Take your stats course anywhere or with anyone else but him!

I don't know what your other options are, but I do not recommend this professor.  Like others have said, he's a good speaker, but literally nothing he says makes sense.  Really bad at explaining the material and answering questions.  I learned from the book.  His tests are full of errors and poorly written.  You'll survive, but it will be painful.

At first, I was excited to go to class because the teacher seemed interesting. He might be a good orator but nothing he says helps clarify or exemplify the concepts unless you read the book beforehand. So, it is a hard class that requires a lot of studying, but he doesn't help reinforce it as well as he could. No practice besides doing the homework

I wasn't a fan of the group project, but he really helped my partner and I hone in our experiment and get all of our statistics in order. Kind of scatterbrained, but is eager to help and be a resource for his students. Really enjoyed having him as a professor.

Gives students everything they could possibly need to get an A on the tests and gives soft deadlines for the long research paper so you can't procrastinate (super helpful). Tells us what we need to study and makes a spiral book for us to take notes in with notes already in it on each section. Really nice and doesn't mind giving lots of extra help.

He uses a textbook that is easy to comprehend, gives handouts of his powerpoints (what his class lectures are based on), and makes a book outlining everything he teaches with spaces to take notes. He tells you exactly what you need to know for every test so it's super easy to get an A.

Cook is a really nice guy and extremely willing to help. However, I would definitely NOT recommend him for Stats. He is very unclear in class, and will confuse you even more if you ask him a question. He is slightly condescending, and does not agree with info in the book. This means that if you plan to learn from the book, don't expect a good grade

The material is HARD in any class.  His examples and attempts to clarify concepts were very relevant.  I never really needed outside help, but I heard he wasn't as available as he might have been.  He seems a bit scattered and more like a student- he's not your typical stuffy, arrogant CMC prof.  Overall, I really liked him.
Awful. Absolutely terrible. Avoid this professor if you ever want to understand what you're supposed to learn and get a half-decent grade. Do yourself a favor.

Very fair teacher. I ended up learning more than I thought I could. Like any good prof he expects you to put 100% into the class and not expect things to be done for you. If you're a lazy student you might find this frustrating.

apparently much improved from last time, but has trouble understanding questions. teaches advanced topics that are not on the test (he just thinks they're important to know). do the reading if you haven't taken stats before, otherwise skim. workload is reasonable.

I took Cook for both Stats and Research Methods and found him fair.  He was only following the standards that Stats. and Methods profs. established before him.  Seemed hard at first, but ultimately his distribution of test scores was identical to those of other profs. in these courses.  Mostly As and Bs.  They're just tough classes with ANY prof.

He made us do all our homework from the book and then he tested us only on his own weird way of doing problems (not in the book). He is very confusing, and the only way I learned anything in that class was from reading the textbook.  He makes even the simplest concept seem difficult. He is a VERY frustrating professor! Don't take him!

I normally don't like the expression "Avoid this professor at all costs," but it seems pretty fitting. Unless you have some grisly murder planned if you avoid Cook, I would suggest at least giving him a few years to get comfortable teaching here and hope he improves or gets the boot and goes back to georgia.

the worst prof i have ever had.  very unorganized in terms of due dates so everything is pushed back until the final few weeks.  everyone failed the first test b/c he refuses to tell us what he wants from us.  never take a class from him.  i hope he is not here in the future.

Agree with previous reviewer: impossible to ever know when stuff is due. He just mentions duedates in the last few minutes of class when you are already so bored from listening to him ramble the entire class. He loves his voice and he loves to be right and he loves to be in charge. Full of himself, and poorly organized class. So boring it hurts.
Boring material, fun prof. Date-less syllabus is the most frustrating thing ever, though.
Prof. Lejon is one of those rare professors that take the extra effort... He is extremely organized. He was of tremendous support. Take this class!
Professor Lejon was very helpful and accessible. In addition, he was a great discussion leader. He showed immense enthuthsiasm for the topic.
I gained true academic knowledge. He's interesting and engaging.
He is very passionate about his field. I strongly recommend this class.
Grett class! Great Professor!
He has written many papers on how religion has affected the presidency of the US and because he is a foreigner from a mostly secular country, he brings an interesting perspective.

Not my favorite professor. He did not guide discussion well, he assigned a TON of reading and writing, and did not seem responsive to his students. He is knowledgable about the topic for the most part, but I did not enjoy the class
Great prof! Must take this class :)
He is an excellent professor!
I really liked this class. Excellent lectures!
Professor Lejon is very, very knowledgable. I very much recommend his class!!!!
I agree. Prof. Lejon knows his subject and is extremely interesting. I do not understand some earlier comments at all!
He is one of the best professors I've ever had. He knows a LOT! His class has been very helpful!!!

Professor Lejon is one of the best professors I have ever had. I don't know what these guys are talking about. If you go into his office hours he will love you can give you a good grade. He is also really interesting, he was a MP in Sweden and had great stories. His class was really interesting.
Boring. Grades weird. All around just not worth it. Great for napping.
Prof. Lejon, while not the best professor is very nice and not a very hard grader. He is a bit unclear and doesn't hand a lot of papers back, but he is interesting.

Prof Lejon is GREAT! his class is an easy A, and you can get away w/o doing most of the reading. he doesn't hand back papers which is annoying, but he's really, really nice & funny, a great guy. You get out of the class what  you choose to put into it.

This class was an easy grade though I learned almost nothing. He does not teach. It is a big free-for-all with your most outspoken classmates dominating everything. Like previously stated, he does not grade assignments.

Ok this man doesn't know what day it is. All he talks about is how great Sweeden is and how much he wished US students were like they are 'back home'... please. His tests are insane he stumbles over his own words, other students correct him...need I say more? just don't take any of his classes.

Lejon unforunately could speak a bit more clearly and give better class direction to what he wants to see in written work.  While I liked the readings and some discussions, he never hands any papers back.

It seems like he doesn't understand the American education system.  He never grades assignments or gives any indication of grades.  He also does not structure the course in any discernible manner and leaves most of the teaching up to the students.  Also important: he takes his military background seriously; don't show up late.
This was a great class. Pretty easy grader. Super chill, relaxed class. But you also actually learn a lot. Great, fair marker.

Wonderful, wonderful teacher. Super supportive. So basically, a wonderful, wonderful guy. Who also happens to be lovely to look at. Let's just say I actually made an effort to wear look nice for this class.
 I think he made my boyfriend jealous because I talked about him all the time!! His wifey is a lucky lady.
No Comments

Compared to the other Bio 44 classes, this one is by far the easiest. If you have him for lab and lecture you are set for a good grade! Make sure to use his practice exams because he uses a lot of the previous year questions.

Guthrie is hilarious! You should get a good grade if you come to class and listen. He often recycles questions from old exams, and usually in his review sessions emphasizes things that won't actually be on the exam. Don't bother buying the book, all of his questions will be straight from lecture. Easy and fun to be in class!
This man is hilarious. He has very dry humor and digresses all the time. He uses a lot of the same questions on tests from practice tests and previous years. Unlimited time on tests as well.

Guthrie is AMAZING!!! One should invest in this course. Although his methods are strange he is a phenomenal teacher and I would not take another professor given the chance. You learn without actually realizing it.

This class is very interesting. He gives short summaries on environmental issues that are interesting and pertain to your life! He is also very nice in office hours and answers e-mail questions right away. I recommend this prof. for non-science majors definitely. The class is interesting (short and sweet) and the labs are easy (but boring).

His grammar does not make any sense and often he gives horrible data which makes no sense to do the assigned labs from. He also does not value the opinions of women. He generally does not care about this class or making it enjoyable or useful for any of the students.

GREAT class. It is incredibly interesting for anyone who is interested at all in questions about the origins of humanity and life.  Guthrie's class is structured in a way that lets him simply tell stories about the things that interest him.  other bio44 profs will make you memorize crap - not guthrie. Great, laid back, interesting class!

By far the worst professor I have ever had, not just in college but in my entire academic career. Not only is he unclear about what will be on the exams, he is misleading, saying certain topics will not be tested and then proceeding to test the class on them anyway. He is unapproachable, ridicules you when you ask questions. DO NOT take him.

Hands down the worst professor I have had. He's extremely unclear in what he  expects from the class - making midterms and exams very hard to prepare for. Don't let his humorous persona fool you - get out while you can!

I really didn't like how he belittles you when you ask for help. He literally makes fun of you or gets mad if you ask question. That is even during office hours. You have not only memorize and understand every single page of the assigned reading but he always chose little topics that seemed not important and he did not emphasize during lecture.

Avoid this class if you can; you will get graded unfairly on questions that are completely unclear. Lectures are very confusing and though he stressed the importance of writing down everything he writes, there are never complete sentences or clear diagrams on the board.
Unhelpful during office hours and refuses to explain material. Exam questions are unclear and very vague while the answers he looks for are very specific.
Just a bad teacher. One of those professors that looks for ways to take points off on exams. Study guides didn't help.

Prof. Arndt is one of the best professors I've had in my time here, and is completely unpretentious, which is increasingly rare.  I wish I could take more classes with him.  He doesn't take it easy on you, but he knows his stuff.

This professor is easily the worst teacher I have ever had. He belittled me when I went to his office hours. In addition, his lectures are worthless so you need to take all of your notes from the book. Do not take any of his classes if you can avoid it.
Very friendly professor. He's willing to help a lot with explaining the concepts in class or at his office.
He's going senile, so he keeps repeating himself.  He also grades somewhat harshly.  The course material is amazing easy, as it's impossible to get through much with that many repetitions.

He can be boring during lectures but if you actually go and talk to him during his office hours, he's very helpful. Besides, he's a very friendly professor, so no reason why you shouldn't enjoy taking his class. But you've to read the class materials carefully though cos he's a strict grading style.

Arndt is nice and funny.  His class is fine if you're good at Econ, hard if you aren't.  He gives reviews sheets & sample questions, but they're not very indicative of his tests, and he even said certain questions wouldn't be on the test and then they were.
awesome guy that teaches well. he can be boring at times, but he is the man nonetheless

Wiley is a great teacher, incredibly enthusiastic, and someone you will want to do research with after her class. That being said, she is hard. Her tests employ applications of topics to completely new scenarios more than just regurgitations of information. Don't take her if you want to coast.
Very enthusiastic and nice but relies entirely on the book.  Does zero teaching.  If you are a good book learner then you are good, but if you are an active learner it is terrible.
I really really love professor Wiley. She is so enthusiastic and helpful and will bend over backwards to help her students with homework, labs, and research opportunities.
Very nice and helpful teacher!

Wiley is one of the best profs I have ever had! She is so much fun to have in class and always helpful in office hours. She also works to remember your name, which makes a huge difference. Definately take her if you can get into her class!
Wiley is so cute! She is very enthusiastic and interested in what she teaches. She was very helpful and really cared whether or not students learned. I really liked her.
Great teacher, super nice and smart.

She is soooooo nice and will do anything to help you do well.  The class is pretty easy.  Tests come right out of your notes, there are no surprises.  She is really into the subject and gets very excited about everything.
One of the best teachers out there. Has amazing stories and really knows what he's doing
Amazing professor. He clearly knows what he's doing and always has the greatest stories.
Dave Hamilton is the man! His class is awesome.
Overall, class is pretty "Rad".

Absolutely adore her. This is my 2nd time having her (SP44 last year). It's a hard class that requires dedication and critical thinking. Never a boring class with Martinez. She's hilarious. Make sure to take really good class notes;she won't write everything down, so listen,& ask if you need clarification or are confused:Very helpful for studying
Amazing teacher! Go to class!
She is the best spanish teacher there is.  Comes off as very intimidating at first but it a total sweetheart.  She is so funny and makes class really fun.  It's a lot of work but totally worth it.
Great teacher. She forces you to speak spanish in her class. If you attend all her classes and try you will be rewarded with a better grasp of the language and an A. Highly recommend her.
Class is more conversation and literary analysis than grammar.Great class-much more interesting and rewarding than typical Spanish 33 and 44 classes!

if you go to class, study the practice tests, and do the homework, you will get an A easily. class attendance is MANDATORY. she teaches quickly and demands you speak a lot, but i learned a lot of spanish and the class was always fun. her bark is way worse than her bite - she acts tough but she is a total sweetheart and i loved the class.
Go to Class! Be ready to talk in class, do your homework, and attend classes and you will be fine.
Excellent class overall.
Great professor. Seems very intimidating but by the end of the class you will love her! Go to class and study your practice tests and you will be fine! Highly recommended.

Profesora Martinez is an amazing teacher. She seemed really intimidating at first but she's actually extremely helpful, understanding, and fun. She wants to get to know her students. In fact, we have taken multiple field trips. She makes sure everything's clear and class discussions are really fun too.

Martinez is amazing! She is so sweet and funny, and really helpful. Class discussions are mandatory so be ready to talk A LOT. You write a lot of short essays, and one longer 5 page essay at the end of the semester. Altogether, a great class, and easy to get a good grade if you participate in class, and do all the assignments.
Martinez is super cool and super sweet. Homework is easy...tests are exactly like her practice tests. GO TO CLASS if you skip she will notice!

Profesora Martinez is one of the best teachers that I have ever had the opportunity to learn from. Her classes are so much fun and we talk about the most random topics. She's flexible with assignments and tests and there is not a lot of busywork.
Fun teacher, sometimes talks a bit fast, but explains material very well, amazing spanish teacher.
Awesome professor -- fun class -- you'll learn a lot without doing too much busywork
The best spanish teacher there is...anywhere.

Ethnic Minorities & Mental Health Psychology was hands down the highlight of my semester.  Prof Hwang served as a very knowledgable resource for our learning in a very important issue on our campus.  Discussion-based course, great readings, would highly recommend for anyone wanting to increase cultural competency, not just for psych majors.
very interest topics covered. My only problem with him is that he doesn't communicate well regarding his expectations for projects and papers.

He was insensitive when teaching a class that involves a sensitive topic. Also, the class involved purely on memorizing contents (which he told us what's going to be tested on - thus easy test) and NO critical thinking. He also taught based on old DSM-IV-TR not DSM 5. Such a bummer because the topic is supposed to be fascinating but the class wasnt
My favourite professor at CMC! Always willing to help students. He wants you to do well and is always in a good mood. Also, he brings his super cute dog to class!

Really discussion-based so prepare to participate, tests were straight-forward and fair, all you have to do is read the textbook. He knows a lot in his field and is really welcoming. The content is super interesting too. Favorite class I've taken at CMC by far

One of the easiest classes i've ever taken at CMC. However, the guy was amazingly inadequate as a professor. He routinely gave out blatantly incorrect information and showed a lack of a basic understanding of anything not directly related to his field of study. Great class to fulfill your GE in silence.

Class seemed to improvise structure. But I liked that the class was almost completely discussion based and he is really open to having you participate and share your personal opinions. Assignments were easy but awkward (i.e. asking a friend about how they related to their race). An interesting, non-traditional way to fulfill psych GE credit.

ASAM Psych course extremely discussion-based.  Will often present views/material that are foreign to students, tries his best to explain concepts, sometimes fails.  However, gives amazing explanations of his own work (would like to see more explanation of procedure, however).  Tried to blame quietness of class on Asian stereotype--only sore point.
