Bird's class was extremely difficult. He gives an insane amount of reading per week. His classes are confusing and feel as though you are being talked at versus a dialogue. No answer will satisfy him, he will always have something negative to say about it. He is a nice guy, but not a prof I would take again. I studied dayght to pull off that A-

Great professor but you'll definitely have to do the work outside of the course. He expects that, as a college student, he doesn't have to hold your hand through the course and that you'll do the readings and come to class prepared. I learned a ton and he's hilarious and I will definitely visit CMC to catch up with him again.

My first math class in years! Graham's funny and clear examples and teaching methods really made this class FUN, as hard as it is to believe. I aced it thanks to the availability of class videos which I re-watched at home, and the multiple weekly tutoring sessions made available by his awesome TAs. Definitely would take his classes again.

A lot of students seemed to find this class boring, but I thought it was super interesting.  If you don't do the readings, it will seem boring and random.  If you do the readings, it will seem quite relevant to what's happening in the world today.  You will get out of this class what you put into it.

Graham bird is a funny brit, that is as much positive as one can say of him. His lectures are confusing, his tests are difficult and he will not help unless you ask. Even then he provides little help and going to office hours is nearly useless.
He is British. He is funny. He is not particularly helpful, and not particularly clear. Found my Indian classmates much more helpful.

Professor Bird has a very different teaching style. He expects you to read long, dry chapters before each class, and then answer his very difficult in class questions that stress him out. Hard grader. My class was very behind, and didn't cover taxes, fiscal, and monetary policy. I had to work extremely hard to get a B+.

Prof. Bird is thorough and tough, but he knows his stuff and will teach you well.  His lectures are far from boring, which is saying something when it comes to Global Finance (dull).  He won't let you get away with weak answers, but if you care about Econ, you will learn a lot from him, and I love his self deprecating humor

He is not helpful at all! He doesn't answer questions ever and gets frustrated and a little angry if you ask any. His quizzes and tests are not impossible if you study what you've done in class, but it's not worth how boring and unhelpful he is as a prof. Everyone falls asleep in his class. Bird needs to learn to ANSWER QUESTIONS!
Professor Bird is terrible. He barely explains anything and is not very approachable. He doesnt prepare you well for the midterm or final. DONT TAKE HIS CLASS.

Mr. Bird is an adorable british man who constantly tries to keep his class entertained with silly jokes. I wouldn't recommend his econ 50 for students looking to learn as much as possible, but he is entertaining and good grades are easily attained as long as you speak up in class, laugh at his jokes, and read the text every once in a while.

He tries to be funny but class is still very boring. He never answers questions in class and makes you feel bad if you have a question. You need to go to office hours to understand something more because class is not clear. He doesn't write on board very often and expects you to be able to understand everything just by listening to what he says.

Hilarious British Professor. If you really pay attention this man is hilarious. Great for a GE. Don't but the newest version of the book, the versions haven't changed very much at all. Also because there aren't many grades be sure to go to office hours and really make sure you know your stuff
Adorable British man. wouldn't recommend for econ majors, but good to get the GE done, most ppl get a decent grade with little work. Ask him about his son Simon Bird from The Inbetweeners.

I started out liking his class, but it eventually became a drag to attend. His jokes don't get any funnier and his lectures are hard to follow along. He doesn't lecture from the book and just talks; you have to pay very good attention to get good notes.

He's not the best teacher for those who want to be Econ majors. He is very organized with handouts, lecture outlines and problem sets, but does not work from the book but rather "suggests" we do the reading. There is not a lot of work assigned but don't let that fool you because you probably won't understand the material unless you do outside work.

His lectures are very clear and there is very little work throughout the semester. The midterm and final were hard, but he gets all of his questions from class notes. He also tries to make the class funny which I think is very commendable considering how dry Econ 50 is.

Great prof! I really like him and his teaching style. Granted having 75% of your grade resting on one test is incredibly stressful. There is little to no work in this class all semester long. If you understand what's going on and review your notes, the tests are no problem. He is theory based.

Bird is a visiting professor from England, so his teaching style is very much British. You don't have to go to class and the final is 75% of the grade, but he is an absolutely great teacher. He's very approachable and explains things very clearly, and the midterm and final are not too difficult.

She is very sweet and passionate about neuroscience. She sometimes mixes up terms in lecture, but she's quick to point out her own mistakes. Our online tests were open note, so they were a bit on the harder side, she's a nitpicky grader. Homework assignments were good ways to bring up my grade, and she's great at explaining dense research papers!

Professor Coleman is a wonderful professor, and makes the class extremely fun and interesting. The tests were also interesting though. They always felt really easy, but it did seem like she would take off points just to get you down to a certain grade. It was almost like your grade was predetermined. Besides for that, great class and fun professor

Professor Coleman is fantastic! I took neurobiology with her for the GE, and even though I didn't enjoy the subject material, I learned a lot. Professor Coleman is kind, funny, and clearly passionate about science.

Professor Coleman is super sweet and always brings her dog Elmer to class. She is super passionate about biology and neuroscience but sometimes her lectures can be a bit unclear. She definitely cares about all her students!

Great professor! Has the best personality and interesting\entertaining lectures. Very helpful in class and during office hours. Requires a lot of reading but makes sure to explain all the topics very well and keeps it interesting. Definitely take her class if you can!

Neuroscience 1. She is the most approachable, friendly, funny, up-beat lady (which is awesome for a Neuroscience class). Always willing to meet with students in her office and offers great 1 on 1 help. Makes lab fun! Highly recommended!

A great teacher. The class is hard though, although the bad grade was largely my fault. She holds really fun labs that make it interesting for a non-science major, unlike pretty much all the other science courses you can take here. And they're usually short--another plus.

This class is way too hard for a non-major GE, way harder than most other sciences.  Most of the labs were pointless and some of thes were really long.  She might be great for science majors, but if you want a good grade, I don't recommend her for a GE.

She is a wonderful teacher. She really cares about her students and goes out of her way to make sure they are learning as much as possible. She lives basically on-campus so is very available for office hours pretty much 24/7 when you can make it. She also invited the whole class over and cooked us dinner.  She is overall a wonderful lady and makes

Prof Batta is amazing as a professor and person. He is always willing to help out over office hours and in things not class-related (introducing you to people, helping on research, or finding summer opportunities on your behalf). In Accounting Data Analytics we had to code in R for midterms, he will spot-check your code so you avoid syntax errors!

Professor Batta is easily one of the most well-versed academics within the Robert Day School. His lectures include real-life applications and are relevant to current events. Intense workload towards the end of the semester. Most students in the class are Robert Day Scholars, so be prepared to work hard if you are not a natural at econ/finance.

Class is very structured and organized, which I liked. The lectures are pretty boring, though, especially if you're not interested in the subject, but not because of Batta, it's just the accounting material. It's a demanding workload, so if you fall behind a little, get help ASAP. He's willing to help you out.
One of the most knowledgeable teachers at CMC. Class will be difficult at times but very in depth and you will learn a ton. Very helpful in office hours and wants students to learn.

Batta is one of the hardest graders I've ever had, but doesn't seem to realize it, so he challenges his student to an extent that appears to be out of his control. The class was informative and necessary for my major, but I would never take it out of pure interest or for the sake of experiencing a great professor.

Professor Batta is extremely smart and his vast knowledge of accounting is evident in the depth of the course.This course covers the basic, the intermediate and the advanced of financial accounting.He is a young professor who incorporates technology into the course(good Excel proficiency).You will work very hard but learn a lot at the same time.

I had no real knowledge of accounting before this course. I got a good amount out of the material and am glad that I took this class. His class project was about 1/10th as long as professor Massoud's* project, so that was a plus. Sometimes there was material on the exams that we had not encountered before (in the long problems). Overall good course

Accounting is a demanding class regardless of which prof you take it from, but if you go into his office hours and send him e-mails he will get back quickly. However, I found his tests to be quite different from his practice tests-- many concepts were thrown into a problem at once and it was difficult to solve.
This professor rocks!!! Harvard background, clear expectations, made econ. 86 ineresting, recommend his class.
He is a great prof. His lectures are clear and understandable. His mixes powerpoint with lecture and bases tests directly off of the powerpoint and sample tests. Recommended!

Wall is a professor of literature yet has a strong accent which could be both hilarious and very distracting/annoying. She is extremely inflexible in both assignments and communication and easily becomes passive aggressive in person and over email. I don't know how she does in language classes, but she is terrible at literature. Worst prof ever!

Prof. Wall is a great professor if you already have previous knowledge of spanish 1.  She is very accessible and encourages people to come for extra help. If you are dedicated in the class, do all of your homework and PARTICIPATE!!!! you will have no problems.  I really enjoyed it, and learned a lot
Definitely plays favorites and can be very passive aggressive. She is easy to understand but does not provide much positive feedback at all
Profesora Wall tried her best with an 8 am class. She's kind of a hard grader. She is very goofy and really stresses participation in class. the more you talk the better you will do.
The class was pretty hard and there was a ton of homework, but if you work at it, you can do well.  She is also a pretty good teacher who encourages you to contribute a lot.

This is the hardest intro spanish class I could imagine. Many of my friends are in 33 and don't understand our homework. She's good at teaching and I've learned a lot, but the tests are very hard and she gievs out about an hour or two of homework most nights. Attendance is mandatory along with multiple out of class activites. Very difficult course.

I took Jasmine at Quest Univ, Canada and I can tell you that she is the greatest instructor ever.  Yeah you have to work hard but she works just as hard. On students' papers she writes pages of clear and helpful comments. Her brain seems full of info, like we all wondered how a head can contain that much. Her insights will blow your mind wide open.

I am sitting here with a friend who went to USC and had this prof too and we both thought she was so great. I took her for a GE course that other profs teach too. She's the hardest one but taught a great class and is a lot of fun. I loved talking to her in her office hours, she can talk to you about anything and you'll laugh a lot.

Aimaq took a required GE and turned it into one of the most intellectually stimulating classes I have taken at the 5Cs.  I didn't always agree with her POV, but she challenged my views and made me rethink my assumptions about the subject matter.  You might not get the easy A you would with another professor, but it will be worth it.

I wish that Aimaq could teach the bulk of my classes at CMC.  She is amazing: EXTREMELY intelligent, witty, hilarious,understanding...  It takes a lot for a teacher to be able to teach you SO much, whilst letting the class run the discussion.  We watch great clips, too! On top of teaching us so much, she jokes and has fun. Very, very fair grader.

I don't know how anyone can NOT like Aimaq. she is fantastic and makes every class into insightful discussions. She is very open to many ways of thinking and to students' opinions. Even if there is a youtube video you find interesting, she will let you play it. NOT a hard grader. I would take another class she taught in an instant.
Wicked smart - she can talk intelligently on nearly anything. Tough grader, can be intimidating, and little emotional connection to students. Still, if you want a challenge, try her.

Essay prompts are confusing and unclear.  She gives papers back with no feedback except for the grade.  In her office hours, she is intimidating and hostile.  Discussions in class often led no where, and since we had too many books to cover in a semester, we were not able to delve deeply into any.  I would not recommend this prof to anyone.
No Comments

She has the most work out of all the Civ10 teachers.  She is a very hard grader on everything you turn in.  She expects you to read about a book a night.  She's a very smart teacher.  You learn a lot, but your grade suffers.  I wouldn't suggest taking her if you are looking at Civ10 as an easy class.

Professor Armstrong is THE professor to take at the Claremont Colleges. I had her for genetics and her enthusiasm is unparalleled!!! I never missed any of her classes because of how awesome she is, even though waking up so early is tough. Do whatever you can to take any of her classes, even if you have to change majors!

Armstrong is fantastic.  I completely disagree with the other criticisms; in Bio 43 I never once opened the text book because everything I needed to know was in the lecture notes. She is a great lecturer and very straight forward with what you need to know.  If you go to the book for studying instead of notes, you'll only confuse yourself.

I didn't take any AP science classes in high school, and was actually pretty rusty in science, but I still managed to get a good grade in her class. Her lectures and drawings are based completely off the book, so if you don't get anything, you always have a literary reference. I was honestly never confused. She's very chipper, even at 8AM.

She comes across as a really nice lady. Don't let the smile fool you. She believes that everyone took AP Bio when we all didn't. Overall, she's an average teacher but I would not take her again. She is always available outside of class. Although that doesn't mean that she will help you fully comprehend the material. It's up 2 you. Read the book tho

One of the best teachers that I've had at CMC! His lectures are very clear, detailed, and he uses many different examples to get the points across. He has great humor and is very helpful during office hours.  Also, the work load is very light and reasonable. I highly recommend him!

The worst prof that I have had at CMC so far. Test and practice questions are completely different. Chooses grades based upon his own views of arguments, and will refuse to agree with other students' views in class even when his is clearly the weaker point. If you are stuck taking him, make sure you write about only what he wants to hear.

Professor Gardner is fantastic and really cares about presenting the information as clearly as possible.  With practice exam questions and availability for office hours, you are able to do very well as long as you put in some effort. Reading isn't always necessary, but being in class is vital for understanding the information.

his notes are definitely clear, but it is not enough to do well on tests because they are more like outlines. his tests are tricky (watch out for the true/false) and go in to see him about papers. although i think his tests are unfair, he is an energetic and all around great prof.

He posts very clear notes from each lecture on Sakai. He has 5 mini exams throughout the semester. Going to his office hours is EXTREMELY helpful. He's very understanding and worked with me to raise my grade after two bad test grades. I went to see him before I turned in my first paper and I got a higher than class average grade. Great guy.

One of my favorite professors so far, great teaching method, grading is fair and straightforward.  He puts all his (very clear) notes on Sakai, so studying for the little quizzes is not difficult.  Great introduction to philosophy, and is also an easy class if you're not interested in the subject.

5 Exams worth 10% each, 2 four page papers worth 15% each and 5 reading responses. If he doesn't agree with your argument be ready to expect a B. But otherwise amazing professor, loved his teaching style specially his examples. He is very chill and also always willing to help outside of class.

Loved this class- fav this semester! I actually had no trouble waking up for this 8:10am class because I never wanted to miss any of the discussions! He is extremely clear, engaging, and passionate about philosophy; willing to help with anything or even just chat. Amazing class, great Prof & person. If you like philosophy, you'll love this class :)

Took Prof. Gardner for Philosophy of Mind and Fundamentals of Logic- two of my favorite classes thus far.  Prof. Gardner is thorough in his explanations and very open to questions/discussion. Hes energetic and makes class fun! Tests aren't easy but if u pay attention its doable. Be interested in the subject or you'll struggle to enjoy it/keep up.

wow. i saved this GE for last because i wanted to take it so little. I took this class at 8am and it was by FAR my favorite class of the semester. his tests can be hard, but you can dispute any question and hes usually very open to giving you points back. very little work, easy grader, and an incredibly engaging professor

Great professor. Really helps you learn, and very dedicated to making sure the class understands everything. The tests were somewhat difficult at times, but he's very reasonable if you want to dispute any of the questions. Reading isn't very necessary, and you'll do well if you just study the class notes before the test

Professor Gardiner is on a permanent acid trip. Take his class and find out why. He will send wackjob arguments your way and when you rip them apart all he says is "You didn't convince me". Sign up if you want an easy A and the most boring yet frustrating experience of your life.
He is a good lecturer I took a Database course. He gave two mid-term exams and one final. lots of assignments and a group project. But the difficulty was fair enough.

Somewhat intimidating and his lectures can be a bit awkward if nobody participates, but overall a great prof if you pay attention and do the homework. Don't procrastinate on CS homework, but if the whole class does, there's a high chance everyone will get an extension. His voice is pretty chill.

This was my first computer science class. There were three written tests  (as opposed to homework assignments done on computers) given throughout the semester that were very hard. The professor was understanding when I talked to him in person but impatient with questions during class. He had a hard time explaining.

Need to learn htmlcss, javascript (and jquery), php, and ajax. If you can do this and do simple programs with them, then its an easy A. He gives extensions for homework (there weren't many homework assignments) easily. Not super clear, but if you go to him he will tell you what he wants. Has many examples, use them when you do homework.
The course web site is well organized and has a ton of really helpful resources, which makes up for his occasional lack of clarity.

This was the worst class I have taken in college.  He does not teach clearly, if you go to his office hours he is completely unhelpful and just makes you feel bad for not knowing the material.  Hands down worst professor I have had in all 3 1/2 years of college so far, worst class.  Claremont- go to Mudd or Pomona for this class.

Literally the worst class I've ever taken. If you don't understand something and go to his office hours, he makes fun of you / criticizes you for not paying proper attention rather than helping. I used to be so interested in this subject...but I'm not taking any more CS classes, at least, not with him.
Just do the work - spend hours on it, dedicate real effort to it, and you'll be fine. Art Lee gives you all the materials you need, but is not the best at answering questions. Just work it out.

Art Lee is a very effective professor. His lectures are clear and illuminate the subjects. His problem sets do an outstanding job of helping me internalize the material. If you are interested in CS this class will be both easy and super helpful.

He has a lot of industry experience and it shows. He knows what he is talking about most of the time. His lectures are extremely organized and his notes are a god-send during finals week. He gets some bad rep for his teaching style, but at the end of the day, that is how he ensures that you learn the subject matter. Good class. 3/5
I used to love CS. Now I dread the subject. Homeworks take forever and he doesn't understand that we have a life outside of his class. His exams test you to see if you can be a compiler. Useless.
oy vey
Exactly what the person beneath me said.

This teacher is thoroughly boring and misleading. If here were more comprehensible students may notice more of the continuous mistakes he makes is speaking and diagrams. Just get his power point slides and read the book, he is completely useless.

Prof. Blomberg is a great guy to get to know. Always gives good partial credit on tests, and only 3 problem sets per semester, but challenging and engaging enough to make you think and keep you interested. Extremely helpful outside of class, and just a really nice guy in general. Best Macro prof at CMC for sure.

Professor Blomberg is a very engaging professor.He makes an effort to know his students and is extremely knowledgeable in the study of Economics.His tests can be challenging and it's not an easy course to get an A.However, if you are an Economics major who is looking for a good foundation in Macroeconomics, take the course with Professor Blomberg.
What a homie. You don't exactly know how to get an A, but he knows his stuff and makes class fun ("Let's talk about how you can impress people at a cocktail party")
He rocks
awesome

I cannot tell whether Blomberg enjoys teaching or not. He sometimes seems angry when he is trying to show that he is excited. Makes econ make sense though...Overall a nice guy, knows his econ so well he never once brings notes to class to profess off of. Smart. Engaging.
No Comments

The lectures are fabulous. A very humorous professor who is very experienced in teaching and research. His experience with the Fed and IMF makes his lecture very interesting. His grading system is not as clear compared to other professors. The quality of your answers is determined by how well your answers are compared to the rest of the class.

Honestly, don't worry about all of these reviews. Nita is not that hard and she has a great message that you can leave the class with: colonialism and orientalism colors every part of our society. I learned so much about the world and even though she lectures in tangents, it's an easy class and if you put in the work you will get a good grade.

She can be a bit disorganized, and her response rate to emails varies wildly. She also is very set in what she wants, despite not the most clear about her expectations. There was a lot of group discussion but she often tries to dominate it and steer the conversation in her own direction. Be interested in the material to make it a better experience

Super caring professor! Not a lot of homework - just weekly posts and readings which you should keep on top of. She is super helpful in office hours if you need clarification on anything! The material is incredibly interesting , I really liked this class!! Don't expect to get an A by doing the bare minimum...

Although at times the class was disorganized and had a lot of work, she is an extremely caring woman and if you get to know her (go to her office hours!) she will be very helpful. She assigns a lot of reading but you don't have to truly do it. I really liked her as a professor and think she is very caring about her students

The class was very unorganized and her grading policy is unclear. Intense amounts of reading in an unreasonable amount of time. The class is specifically for first years but she was treating it like an upper-level class. Please do yourself a favor and don't take it unless you truly have an interest in the subject.
LOTS OF BUSYWORK NICE LADY RESPECT HER

Extremely boring. Assigns very dense readings. Discussions and lectures have little structure, and grading is very arbitrary (not easy either, as some people would have you believe). Nice and eloquent, but confuses you with various muddled theories so you end up not knowing what you should take note of. Would not recommend.
In a class on India and Pakistan, we did not discuss Pakistan till the last day of the class.

Took South Asian Hist. Through Literature. Could have been awesome, but her goals: teach us that there is no unified "indian culture"/grand narrative. She's opinionated and not always available. She's upset because CMC won't let her teach w/in her specialty, which is education and Russian history/language/government.

Usually I don't take the time to write these reviews, but this teacher is ridiculous.  Yes, this class could potentially be interesting but the amount of reading is a little over done.  Especially since the paper that we're supposed to write is due the class right after the reading is assigned. This happens almost every time! It's ridiculous.

Nita Kumar is by far the worst professor I have ever taken at CMC. She is opinionated and biased, she spends most of the class time trying to convince us to believe her conspiracy theories without any form of reasonable proof. Unless you enjoy getting frustrated by bias opinionated teachers, DO NOT TAKE HER CLASSES.

Her South Asia class has the potential to be one of the most interesting classes at CMC. Unfortunately she spends most of her time trying to convince you that there is no such thing as culture or society. She's very unclear in a lot of things, but the papers are easy, and the class was easy.
Incredibly boring. Acts like she's falling asleep. Seems stoned. But her class is super easy. Easiest A at CMC.

Prof is up to a lot of great things. Unfortunately, she's not the greatest prof, IMHO. Lectures were somewhat confusing. She asks a lot of questions (to get us to think), but somehow there was a barrier we couldn't bridge. Class was based on readings (which we discussed), several short papers, and a presentation - no exams or a final! Overall, ok.
I love Amy Leal!  Great, fun, friendly, caring, wonderful professor!  I wish she had never left the school!!!  She really encouraged me to improve my writing!

One of my all-time favorite teachers... she really makes writing fun.  Her texts are classic, but she also mixes it up with some really gothic literature and tries to make everyone really connect to the books.  Her assignments are off-beat and required presentations are challenging.  One of the easy fun classes that will REALLY improve your writing
No Comments

Professor Leal starts out a little strange and ends the class leaving you with a taste for old literature like you never thought you'd have.  At first the class is unbelievable because of the seemingly "useless" work to do... but later in the semester when one is swamped with midterms, this class is the only one with a reasonable workload.

don't know what the previous people are talking about. I had never done calc before this class but understood it because of her. do all the assigned homework and practice tests and you have an excellent chance of getting a good grade
She is a very good professor.  Her midterms and finals are not what the book is like, but they will be fine if you do the homework and do the previous final exams to study.
She is a very good professor. I disagree with previous opinions. Once you study hard, you are rewarded. She is polite, generous, and beautiful.
Do not take her class at all costs. Average grades on both mid-terms were failing and more than half the class dropped. If you end up in the class dont take it, wait a semester.
She takes the textbook and puts it on the board. Unforgiving, unhelpful and uninteresting.
Avoid at all costs. At beginning of semester there were about 30 people in the class, everyone dropped except about 7

Prof Skinner is amazing! She is extremely passionate and very knowledgable in her field. Cares about students and provides good feedback. Class is fairly easy. She also makes really good apple sauce cake!
Fabulous professor. She's extremely enthusiastic and cares a lot about her students. Its always fascinating when she talks about her research interests. Take her class!

Profesora Skinner was great, in retrospect. She makes the class really easy and engaging so that non-fluent students can actually learn. However, do not take her if you are a fluent speaker. She has a very noticeable accent when she speaks in spanish. Overall, a great professor!

Spanish 44 was fine. Skinner is a busy prof- she has kids, other classes, and is in charge of the Fulbright scholarship stuff at CMC and 44 seemed pretty low priority to her. She missed a lot of her office hours and could not offer supplementary materials when I needed help. The class is easy to get an A in without doing the reading

Great teacher, you can tell she really loves what she does.  Helps out anyway she can, even proofread your paper before you turn it in, really wants you to do well. Already taken two classes with her and planning to take much more!

I love professor Skinner! I took spanish in high school and it was really hard for me to write essays, but I got an A in my second paper because she just teaches spanish so well! She is also very understanding if you need extra time to write your papers. GREAT CLASS! I would definitely take her again :)

She is a great professor. Learned a lot about Latin American literature and history, plus improved my Spanish writing ability. In class, she is very patient and open to answering questions. Always welcoming during her office hours.
She is awesome! Take a class with her because it's fun and you learn a lot of Spanish. She is a cool person in and out of the classroom also plus the workload is pretty light!

Skinner is an awesome proff. very enthusiastic and friendly.  Will help you a lot! Class was relatively easy if you keep up with readings which aren't very difficult at all.  She offers to proofread and lets you rewrite your paper if you messed up on some.  Overall awesome teacher. Best for Spanish in CMC and all other 5C's

Professor Skinner is one of the best Spanish professors at Claremont McKenna and the 5C's. Her class is well-structured, participation is encouraged, and discussions are laid back. She is very enthusiastic about Latin American literature and open to all ideas in discussion. A fun, educational class with a light workload! :)

There were a number of issues with this class, so I was excited when he asked us to give him tips on how to improve the class. The next class, he read all the ideas (many of which were repeated many times) and dismissed them as silly, or said he couldn't change things because we "aren't a large graduate university." There are better math profs here

I liked him! He teaches the core content of each class right away and then spends the rest of the class on examples, which is an easy way to learn calc. some of the prob sets were hard, but all were manageable and tests arent hard if you study a reasonable amount. gives partial credit. if math isnt your thing, i recommend him for the GE!

His teaching style is very good. During class, he teaches new material and then does a lot of example problems. The homework is really fast and easy, and if you've attended class (although you don't have to) the tests are easy too. I learned a lot, and I would definitely take a class from him again.

German doesn't waste your time. He spends each class using five minutes to teach new material (much clearer than the textbook) and spends the rest of the time on example problems. HW is 1.5 hrs due once a week and mid-terms are five reasonable problems. German will give 1-1 tutoring if you come during office hours.
Stay away, this guy just doesn't care about you.

brand new course at cmc and it's so-so at best. german is a nice guy but explains complicated material as if students are already experts. midterms were very straightforward, but final exam came out of nowhere. students considered giving up on the final altogether part-way through the allotted time because it was that unreasonable.

This Professor is amazing. He is ready to give as much as time as you want will explain you the silliest of things if you have a doubt without a sign of grudge on his face. You should definitely take him if you gte him. I would have liked to take him for my Calc 3 as well. His tests are slightly tough you should get an a with hardwork.

She's a nice person, but was largely unavailable for extra help when needed. Tests are not easy, although the problems are given in class, she doesn't give partial credit, so you can't make ANY errors or you will get a zero on the problem.

Not sure where all the negative comments are coming from, everyone I know in her class loved her, she's funny in class, teaches very interesting material, her grading on tests was a little random, but I thought in the end with her emphasis on homework it all worked out well.  Really works to get to know the students, definitely take her class.

Broussard is undoubtedly the worst professor I have ever had. I waited two semesters to take her Development Econ class because that's what she was hired for but it was a dud. She is completely incompetent, lazy, and a terrible teacher. She doesn't care at all about students, and any coolness factor is completely negated.

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS if you think you'll learn anything. Her class is simple in terms of how she teaches BUT if you are not self-motivated, you will do really bad on her midterms. I admit I didn't try too hard in her class but I really regret taking her class. At least I would have learned something in another Econ class, even if I get a low grade
Doesn't know anything. Young and inexperienced, can't relate to the material.

She used power points everyday but they were useful for the class (clean, legible graphs).  She also used the board to explain questions that came up fairly clearly.  She wants it to be fun for her students and gives plenty of hints and advice as to what to study for the exams.

It is true that Professor Broussard only teaches off of power point, but I don't think that was a hindrance to the class. She holds office hours twice a week and really encourages students to come in. She is funny and engaging and I thought she was a good teacher overall.

This is bar none the worst professor in the economics department. While her work may not be super challenging, she is clearly uninterested in the student and makes it clear by rarely holding office hours or conversing with students on her time. At a school where over 90% of the professors are TEACHERS, she is a RESEARCHER. Skip this one.

I really enjoyed this class. Prof is really cool and she gives you her notes. If you keep up with the reading you'll be a-ok. She also posts previous semester's tests so you know what format the test is in. Much easier than other econ profs.

Prof. Broussard is nice and teaches micro well. She does only use power-points, but she does one group project and two in-class simulations. HW is about one hour online work every two weeks and two hour written work every two weeks. (1.5 hrs hw/week). Midterms are easy if you take notes or read textbook, hard if you don't.
she wasn't a very good teacher because she always used powerpoints and didn't doing many examples or explain them thorougally.

She teaches ONLY from PowerPoint slides, which is incredibly frustrating. She doesn't explain how to do problems, so the tests are kind of shocking- you feel like the questions have come from nowhere.  She is very nice, just not my best teacher.

Really nice. Fair. But you can tell she is a new teacher. She specializes in micro, so when she started teaching macro, she had no idea what she was explaining and just gave out formulas. But she's nice and funny.

By far the worst class I've taken at the Claremont colleges. She couldn't teach a 5 year old how to read. Midterms are difficult, you can get screwed over even if you study. I went to her office hours for clarity, but she's unhelpful. I'm usually an A- student but I struggled to get a C- in this class. Not recommended.

First-year teacher, reads powerpoints every class and cannot answer most questions thoroughly or clearly, often just says look in the book. Tests are much harder than her teaching ability permits (average 23-point curve, sounds like a good thing but isn't). Has long, long HW assignments due on Fridays. Overall the worst teacher I've ever had.

She has a structure to her lessons which is nice but she is subjective and vague about what she wants resulting in a bad grade because she hasn't specified what she wants (very harsh on lab reports--before her I never got below a B). Also, she can be very passive aggressive...and kind of spiteful. Not terribly an enjoyable class. Very stressful.

Horrible class.She doesn't curve at all when the majority of the class is clearly not doing well.For our first exam the average was in the 60's and she gave out F's and sent out low grade reports.Her lectures are very scattered and she was unable to answer any question posed to her by the students.Her exams are very hard & unfair.AVOID at all costs

Scattered lectures, unfairly tough exams. For a class of non science majors, the average for the most recent exam was 71%. Although the labs were often interesting, the abysmal quality of lectures (and 4 hours of them straight) along with her exceedingly difficult exams means you should really think twice before you take her.

She is an absolutely horrible teacher. Questions in class were answered in the most roundabout way possible and her grading simply doesn't make sense. For example, the average on one test was approximately 69, I got a 63, which was graded as an F. I recommend against taking her.

While she is helpful if you go to see her outside of class, she routinely fails to get through her lecture outline within the class time. Her questions on exams are very unclear and many students miss points because they don't understand what she is asking.
She can be very helpful if you ask her direct questions but the lectures are very scattered and taking notes is frustrating.
You learn a lot about the happenings around you as well as whatever he covers from the textbook. Would take him again...

Professor Aksoy is the best Professor I have had at CMC. He is unbelievably knowledgeable on the subject and will apply economic principles to a variety of stories he will tell. Class is not mandatory but its interesting and he is very passionate about teaching. As long as you study for the tests they are straightforward. Highly recommended Prof.

Great Guy! He spends the 1st 10 min of class usually talking about general stuff going on in the world. He then switches to teacher mode and teaches stuff. You probably wont cover the whole book, but whatever bits you do cover, you'll know inside out.
Great guy, reasonable workload, and a fair grader. I loved this class even though he got off subject all the time. Would definitely recommend.

Professor Park is one of the BEST professors I've learned from. Lectures are interesting, even if you're not that interested in Korean history but if you are, you're in for a real treat. Funny and light-hearted professor, super understanding. Lots of reading but learn to skim/get good bits and you're fine. Group projects are engaging and fun.

Professor is very unclear about his grading criteria and what he is looking for in assignments. He has very few assignments that determine a huge part of your grade and was not accessible at all the week before the midterm. His lectures are messy with confusing timeline. His readings are all very random and I barely learned anything in this class.

Prof. Park is one of the best professors I had so far. He is very helpful and his instructions for the papers are very very clear. He presents interesting material but he also blends in a good amount of discussion. He is a good discussion facilitator and while he may seem intimidating at times, don't be!
Dr. Park has an excellent understanding of the topics he teaches.
Super friendly and enthusiastic. Easy A-, tough A. Great diversity of readings. Only two papers.

Professor Park is such a cool guy and really cares about his students learning. The class is basically just lectures and discussion. A 5 pg paper with 3 topics to choose from, an 8-10 pg research paper, and an optional final 5 pg paper. Kinda heavy on the reading but you can skim it and be fine. A 250 word post on sakai each week too. No attendance

He is a great professor very kind easy to understand it is a hard course but if you read the book it's not as hard. The subject is very interesting, lots of notes are required and lots of study time for the final the study guides are long but simple if u just follow the book. The stuff he talks about in class is exactly the same as in the text.

This course is the same section, but taught at Chaffey College. One of the absolute worst Art History teachers I have EVER had. Taught like it was a graduate level course. Told students to "drop" the first week of class. Do not take Asian Art History with Shimkhada.

I would definitely recommend taking a class with Professor Shelton at CMC. Although he may be difficult than other professors, you can really learn a lot if you put in the effort. He is incredibly knowledgeable in the political-economy realm and is easily accessible outside of class. Easily one of the best professors I have had.

Prof Shelton is the most dedicated, kind, helpful professor at CMC, imo. He's notoriously difficult, but you can handle it if you take good notes and put effort into problem sets. Follow his studying instructions and you'll do well on exams. Great in office hours. His students understand Macro on a whole other level compared to others. Must take.

Though Shelton's macro is one of the harder intermediate classes, he will give you deep intuitive understanding on a wide breadth of subjects. Problem sets are hard, and reflect the command he expects his students to have over the material. As a human being, Shelton is personable, caring, responsive to feedback, and flexible with coursework.

196 is a very challenging course but Professor Shelton makes students want to succeed. He will meet with students at all times of the day, and furthermore help teach me some programming skills and gave interview prep for some macroeconomic based questions

As a non econ major, this was tough class, but interesting. Reading the textbook helps, cause lectures go fast. But if you can stay on top of the material, it's awesome class. Shelton is willing to help if you feel  behind. Go to TA's review sessions, they will save your grade. They're both nice to look at during lecture too.
He is a very nice professor and always ready to help but there is a lot of hw and he is a tough grader!

Extremely helpful and nice in class, after class and during office hour. Work as a group for the biweekly assignment and go to the tutor session for help. Rachel is the best tutor ever. Shelton's class is not that hard, but he expects you to understand the theory and use them  for the exam. Only essay questions for the exam, no easy ones.

Econ 196 was the best class I've taken at CMC. Even though the subject matter is extremely difficult, Professor Shelton takes them time to make sure everyone is on the same page. This is an excellent class that gives you the opportunity to understand growth, pricing, the business cycle, and unemployment at a much more advanced level than 102.

Best professor I've had at cmc. His class is really hard, his tests are challenging, but he gives a nice curve. Even with the curve, though, his class is hard.  You will, however, come out knowing more about macro than students in other macro classes. Take this class if you want a challenge AND you want to learn a lot.

Best professor I've had at CMC. He's very clear and straight forward. The exams are meant to be hard but he curves them later so people do well. The textbook isn;t really necessary. Only complaint is that he isn't great at responding to emails but an excellent professor none the less. Also, he's a very funny guy

It's an interesting class however slightly unpredictable, his exams are usually much harder than practice exams. Though he grades blind (and fair). There is no way to guarantee a good grade in this class, just try to understand everything

Best professor ever. It's a tough class, and you need to do a little more work than other 102 classes, but you really get a lot out of the class. Especially if you're interested in Economics/Finance, and even Government or IR. He really achieves one of his main targets, which is to make you able to understand current news. TAKE HIM
Super responsible, very helpful in and after class, charming.

Best professor I have ever had in my life. I would take any class with Shelton even if it were named "2 hours of Prof. Shelton sharing his wisdom." If u take his class you will have to try relatively hard but its more than worth it.

If you are interested in econ, TAKE THIS CLASS. Best econ class ever. You learn a lot about real econ research, and all the new models for unempl, pricing, etc. Most applicable class to econ career except for time series forecasting with Weidenmier. Also, Shelton is very good at teaching/explaining. Spends lots of time answering questions.

Best class/one the best professors I've ever had. Very helpful with HW in office hours. Takes time to answer all questions in detail, going over concepts many times in different ways until they are clear. Cares that students learn more than grades. Very accessible/nice. Can work in groups for HW. Reasonable work load. Understanding about deadlines.
Best Econ teacher ever. He makes every concepts as clear as possible. Great Pro.

Best professor I have had at CMC hands down. Useful lectures and open to questions from students, and he never makes you feel stupid for asking a question. Problem sets and Exams are fairly difficult, but you learn a lot and he is very helpful in office hours. Great guy and great class.

Hughson is a really great and super intelligent man. I would say he's so smart that he forgets that we're students trying to learn the topic and sometimes assumes we just understand what he's saying. Read the class notes he provides and do the practice exams. The labs aren't too bad just give yourself enough time to do them.
Hughson is a super nice guy. Although the lectures are sometimes too fast to follow, the slides he uploaded are really helpful. Study the slides before exams and you will get an A.
Horrible class. Hughson is smart but he just couldn't teach.
Not a great class. Material is delivered in a very boring fashion.

investments is a cool class and hughson's an awesome guy, but he's just not very good at explaining things. he comes to class prepared and he tries his best, but he's pretty confusing and really dry. workload and difficulty are average for an upper level econ/finance course. if you can prove to him that you know what you're doing, you'll be fine.

I came to class every day and agree w/ the poor review. I also went to office hours and he was still unclear. Karpel needs to work on his teaching, and that's that. Just because it's college doesn't mean you can't expect a decent prof, especially after dishing out fortunes of money. Maybe for some that doesn't matter.
People keep saying he doesn't test on what we go over, but just because you might not understand the material doesn't mean his tests are tricks. You need to try harder and wake up, this is college!

Other commenter was right on his lecture was pointless, he would talk the whole time and i would write down everything then none of that was on the test, instead he would have very vague questions that could have multiple answers so you didn't know which one was right. Hated the course...and I'm biology major and have liked every biology class
I had Karpal for lab and he was fantastic! He never spoke more than he needed to, gave clear instructions and was very hands on. He graded easily and I enjoyed his lab a lot!

I disagree with the earlier post. While Prof. Karpel is hard on his exams, if you studied properly and went to office hours, you will see he never tricks you on exams and only tests on stuff he covers. Maybe you should try to come to class more often and seek help when you are struggling?

Exam questions are vague, unclear; tests you on things he never went over. Is trying to trick you on exams which makes your grade worse than it should be. Couldn't answer questions in class. Lectures are messy; notes from them will be useless. I could have done a lot better w/ a different prof. Only in his first years, but still needs to improve.
Very easy course!
um, take two steps back, amir ... way more touchy and flirty than any professor should be, in my opinion ...
Great Prof!  Barnea's understanding of the material is proficient and is very good at explaining concepts that are difficult to understand.  Take this course.

I had seen the material presented in this class previously as an undergraduate. It was presented much more effectively the first time. Barnea only seems to have a very superficial understanding himself, relying as he does so much on other people's publications and not answering questions very convincingly. His fluency in English is very weak.

Jamaica is great to listen to, an amazing woman to hear speak, and provides a learning experience just by being present. My class was very unstructured, but also fascinating, though not primarily academically.

I took a creative writing class with her. She is a wonderful, at times nutty woman.  Her lectures (often meandering stories with value) are wholly worthwhile. If you aren't drawn to writing or intent on developing your own voice, this isn't the class for you.
Keri is a kind, thoughtful, and disarmingly brilliant professor. She genuinely cares about her student?s success and is extremely personable. Highly recommended.
The book selection was great.  However, I did not find this professor very stimulating as a discussion leader.  She also randomly calls on people in class.

She gives a lot of reading but they are intereand for the most part entertaining. Participation is a major grade in her class, so attendence is mandatory. She grades strictly, but if you keep to her ruberic you will generall make a good grade. Noel has a dark sense of humor, but cares for her students. My writing increased a lot with her help.

Noel is an excellent professor.She presented depressing and dark topics through the required reading yet always kept class discussion lively.Her dark sense of humor, if you can call it that, was slightly freaky but nothing short of interesting.Noel truly cares about all her students and wants nothing more than to see them succeed!
Birondo is a funny, quirky prof, but he is crystal clear and very passionate about his subject which makes his classes much more interesting.  If you're into philosophy you'll love him.

One of the best professors at CMC! Lots of reading (typically three 20-page articles daily, 120p/week), but he sends out questions before the class - so you know where to focus and where to skim. Lectures are AMAZING! He demystifies complex concepts and explains the causes behind econ and political trends. Plus, he has a great sense of humor!

Liked to cold call students during lecture so it was almost like a discussion but not really. Sends out study questions the night before so you know what to prepare for class the next day. Lots of reading and important that you actually do all of it. Pei is super friendly, accessible, and accommodating so the difficulty is worth it!

LOVED Professor Pei's Gov 60. One of the best professors I have ever had. I highly recommend this class, but only take it if you are interested in the subject. Otherwise, the readings and lectures will be difficult. I loved all the material and learned so much. Professor Pei is kind and extremely available to help his students. 10/10. MUST TAKE!

Professor Pei is so awesome. He is very clear and an excellent teacher. He has tons of expertise on everything he teaches. I would recommend 10000000%! He is great for Comp Gov, East Asian Political Economy and Chinese Politics.

Prof. Pei's class was absolutely amazing. He definitely expected a lot of reading, but the readings were selected fantastically, and each one was interesting. In class, he started with a discussion and left lecturing to the end to build off of the discussion.

By far one of the best professors at the entire Claremont colleges! I also took his Gov 60 course and loved it but this was by far my favorite class at CMC!  Professor Pei turns you into a great thinker so that you can carefully argue and understand all viewpoints on any issue. I grew more as a learner in his class than any other college class!!!

I was extremely disappointed with Prof Pei's class. He is unquestionably a brilliant scholar, but his teaching style would be a much better fit at a large research institution. Quality discussion during class was non-existent, and he was unable to provide any constructive feedback during office hours. By far my most frustrating class at CMC.
knowledgeable, funny, nice. well-connected with professionals. Only downside: Very pessimistic about China and its future. Can affect one's motivation for improving China's present conditions.

Professor Pei is brilliant, clearly an expert in his field. LOTS of reading, but bulk of class is based on lecture so if you come to class it's not hard to get by without doing the reading. Work load not bad, two short essays and five quizzes. He is super nice guy too and very understanding. Pei is a boss, take this class with him!
A wonderful professor. One of CMC's best investments. Professional, scholarly, kind. Thought provoking lectures. Made everything seem so much clearer to me. Highly recommended!

Very clear and interesting lectures. Very helpful during office hours and easy to talk to. Will help you with whatever he can in and out of the class. He is extremely knowledgable about everything China and gets students very involved in his lectures. You have to read everything he gives out or you'll be stuck in class. Highly recommended!

An amazing professor - asks amazing questions and his lectures are super thought provoking. Loves asking for opinions from students and does it in a way that doesn't put you on the spot. He is a sweet man and knows so much about China and its politics. Definitely take his class if you have the chance.

I had professor Vega-Duran my first semester at CMC and immediately loved her. She moves through interesting material and includes conversation and class participation. She was also very helpful and understanding when I had to take an incomplete in her class.

You don't have to do a lot of work to pass.  44 is not really a literature class... you do a lot of reading, but it's not very difficult analysis.  It's more just a general skill development class.  Very easy fulfillment of the foreign lit requirement, either for CMC or PBK.  Prof is a lovely person, incredibly kind and helpful.
Loved taking this class! You have to put in work, but if you do, you will get a lot out of the class and can easily get an A.

She is a very nice woman who has a lot of pasion for spanish but this class was a pain. SO much busy work and unclear expectations. Had a big group project and essay due right after Thanksgiving with little guidelines until the day before, practically. This class almost turned me off from being a spanish major because it was so boring and vague.

Reading was manageable, with 1-page write-ups every few weeks.  You discuss the reading both as a large group and a small group of two and the profesora will come around to grade discussion.  However... she gets really upset if you're even 1-minute late AND requires that you raise your hand to ask permission to use the bathroom.

Great Prof. Easy to understand. Knows her stuff and conveys it well. Actually teaches you the language. she expects a lot from you in terms of preparation for each class including vocab, exercises, and 1-page writeups but it's manageable. tests are incredibly fair. Im not a spanish major but she made the class interesting and I learned a lot.

Really helped me improve my writing. I was a decent writer going into the class but I felt proud of what I was producing by the end. He is a really nice and sensitive guy and made a rather dull subject (Intro. College Writing) amazingly fun. Enjoyed the theme and genuinely felt getting better paper by paper. Reasonable grader and workload.
Wonderful professor! He was very helpful and I learned a lot about writing and presenting arguments. I loved this class!

A gentleman and a scholar no doubt.  If you do all the readings and are creative and clear in your writing you will get an A. if you do not do the readings but are still intelligent enough to provide a cogent understanding of the material at hand you will receive a B
Very nice teacher! We read a lot of pretty interesting books and he was very helpful with coming up with topics to write about for essays. Not a huge workload and a very fair grader.

Kang is sometimes difficult to understand and makes a lot of awkward but hilarious comments. His class is largely discussion based and he really wants students form their own opinions and be PROVACATIVE. Definitely go talk to him in office hours before you start writing the final paper because the guidelines are pretty ambiguous.

Do not take her. When she talks, it's only about her biography and rarely relevant to anything in class. The work assigned has absolutely nothing to do with what she says and very little to do with the class - be prepared to teach yourself everything. Only write conservatively or you'll get a bad grade. She's either right or you're wrong.

Never has someone conveyed so much information without saying anything. her lectures were basically her talking about how much experience she had in the business world. her expectations were always unclear and graded inconsistently. every class ran at least 5-10 min past the end time. it was a fair amount of work, and i'm not sure what i learned.

I took this class in Spring '10 and just graduated this May. At the time it was a pretty demanding class, but has ended up being one of the most useful and relevant courses that I ended up taking at CMC. The readings and case studies were very interesting and I've continued to reference them even after graduating. Definitely recommend this class
Professor Bonaparte is an amazing professor cares about students and make the class very interesting... i recomend him.. wish he stays at CMC
Nice professor very enthu help student and always available at office hours

If you have never taken Calculus before, do NOT take this class. Professor O'Brien is purely concerned with his own graduate research, and really could care less about how you do in the class. He does not explain things well, and makes things that are easy complicated. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

He trains his students to act as a scholar. Focus on student's ability to handle the lab properly dos and don'ts. He  raise students' ability  to pass level instead of please them by lowering  his standards.

If you have to take General Chem, TAKE KOJIMA! He is great at lectures, keeps things interesting, super fair at grading. He gives you chances for extra credit. He truly cares about your success. If you want to succeed he will make sure you do. He does assign lots of homework but its all very helpful. He is energetic and fun!

Amazing energy! If you need help go to office hrs, he will help even if he is just in the bldg. outside of those hrs. Looked forward to going to lecture every time. Lots of homework. Great online system called Alek's. Take if you need more chem in the future. You will learn a lot. I love Chem now!

He is the best professor I had ever. I like him so much because he is very polite and respectable. He is always available to answer your questions. I would really like to attend his class again. He is gentle professor. Having acgentle professor like him is a chance for me  and will be for you too!
He is a very difficult teacher, no doubt.  However he is an amazingly helpful resource.  He truly cares about how you do; if you try hard in his class he notices and gives you the benefit.

If you are a student that likes to challenge yourself and you are seeking to master  intro-chemistry, Kojima is a great choice.  He is challenging, but teaches very well and wants to push his students to do their best.  If you put the time and effort into his class, it pays off well.

do not take this class. it made me hate chemistry. i put a ton of time and effort into this class and it didn't pay off. class just made the material more confusing and he expected you to know material he didn't teach nor was in the book. worst professor ever. nothing about this class was good.
Don't take it.

Not the best at teaching chem, but if you want to get your science GE out of the way, take Kojima. He is the man. Super cool guy, just wants his students to understand what's going on in class and pass. MasteringChem sucks though -- WebAssign is much better.
online homework is NOT useful at all!!! waste my time!!!

Professor Kojima's class is extremely difficult.  If you don't think you have a good understanding of chemistry prior to this class, don't even bother.  He uses an online homework system that is frustrating and very time consuming.

It's true that he kind of expected you to know AP Chem material. He missed 7 days of class because his mother was sick so things were rushed. His exams are really difficult so there is usually a really big curve which benefits you if you do study. He's available and helpful with office hours and gives good advice for lab. But makes you think.

This man was a visiting professor to this school. He is from UCLA and I will greatly appreciate it if he gets sent back there! He CAN NOT teach. His lectures are ALL powerpoint based, very minimal board work. He speeds through sections and expects you to know AP Chem material. He himself has attendance issues and tests are VERY hard. DO NOT TAKE!

He is a VERY difficult professor. A nice and occasionally funny guy, and you certainly learn a lot in his class. However, he has mini 'quizzes' every day in class and his tests usually have an average of around 70% or lower. Once, it was a 30%. Still, if you are looking to become proficient in chemistry, he's your man.

Very nice woman and class was pretty straightforward. The first test was really challenging (long test, not enough time) but the other two were more fair. I felt sometimes points were taken off tests very arbitrarily although they were answers/definitions straight from notes or the book.

Prof. Woelfel is one of the best professors I've had at CMC so far in any subject. He is so clearly passionate and knowledgable in his field, and gives extensive feedback and advice. He is a tough grader but if you work hard and listen to his advice, you will become a better writer.

he is awesome. took his epic heroes class- great material, teaches it well and in depth, makes it interesting, makes it fun, makes it funny, and not too much work, especially for a writing class. you will truly be missing out if you don't take this class. best class i have taken all year
Very helpful and clear with what he wants. Hard grader, but gives detailed feedback.
One of the best and more terrifying professors I have every had.  I learned more from him than from any other professor.
She is truly amazing scholar, caring person and fair professor. She knows USFP, religion and particularly Islam well.
she writes the best letters of recommendation. I am sad she is no longer at CMC but deeply caring about former students. Well connected
she is extremely patient, very intelligent, has real world knowledge, always there for her students or whoever knocks on her door really. CMC IR lucky to have her.

You might just want to teach yourself chemistry. She doesn't explain well the lectures. All her lectures are based on the books notes and not her own. I hate that she expects everyone to pass and yet she doesn't have office hours whatsoever.

She's really kind and willing to help her students. I truly believe that she is a great person, but not necessarily the best teacher. I scored really poorly on her exams despite knowing the material pretty well because she expected us to know too many practical applications that we never went over. I'm much better at just cranking problems out.
You are better off bringing your textbook to class and reading it for 50 minutes MWF. Her tests are unpredictable and unconventional. If you like teaching chem to yourself, she's the prof for you!
She is so helpful during office hours. She does have a unique way of teaching though that might not be for everybody. She wants nothing more than for her students to excel. She is a great professor.

She is literally the KINDEST professor ever. I accidentally slept through my midterm today and was so distressed! I went to see her about it and she was nothing but understanding. She reassured me that things will be okay and accommodated my schedule so that I could best take the makeup w/o feeling stressed. She's super helpful. She's an angel!

Says she wants people to like chem or at least feel confident in it- did not achieve either with me. Went to her office hours a lot but she was scattered and very unhelpful. Poor job of explaining difficult concepts and often forgot to teach things in class that were then on homework, used in lab or on tests. Good intentions but failed execution.

She is awesome! I was dreading taking chemistry class, and now I am dreading not having her as my teacher.  She is there for the students, and her office hours are fun and helpful.  Take her if you have the chance!!!

He is so kind and really wants students to do well. During the pandemic he was really accessible, offering office hours 9-5 every day except during class. The class is all lectures so take notes. That being said participation is the difference between an A and a B. No joke it will come down to that 1 point so, talk! He grades very tough at the end!

Lots of busy group casework during the pandemic for no reason at all. Very theoretical - you can tell he's not practicing and does not actually use the correct terminology used in the industry. He is nice and accessible outside of class for questions. Typical prof where you can memorize what he teaches and you'll pass. No room for thinking.

Professor Binay is one of the few professors that makes finance interesting at CMC. His class is extremely lecture-heavy, so take good class notes. Exams get progressively harder, with an extremely hard, but doable, final. Make sure your group for the projects is strong and reliable. Do yourself a favor and take a bite into one of Binay's bagels.

Cares about and wants to build a relationship with each and every of his students. Also really cares about fairness between students. Makes the boring topic of corporate finance bearable at his worst, and actually quiet interesting at his best. Gives you a lot of real life advice, too. Makes you work for an A.
Great great professor! Really approachable and the materials are informative and easy to follow.

Take him in a heartbeat: best class at CMC. His lectures are so clear and interesting that you'll intuitively remember everything you learn from dqy 1, and time literally flies during class. Very friendly and has tons of office hours (like 8), and he wants you to succeed. Light HW, easy tests, fun project, and you'll definitely learn a lot.

Professor Binay is my favorite professor at the 5Cs.  It possible to do very well in this class if you work hard and go to EVERY class.  If you put the time and energy in, you will learn A TON from taking his course.  He is a really great guy, very approachable,  and wants his students to learn and succeed.  Highly recommend him for any class.

If you're an Econ Accounting major and are even somewhat interested in Corp Fin, this class is amazing. Its easy to do really well if you pay close attention to the material covered in class, and you end up learning a lot in this class. Professor Binay is really helpful and approachable.
If you work hard, getting an A isn't very difficult since most of his stuff is from online and even so, he always makes time to help you if you ask. He's very understanding and reasonable.

He's a good guy, but he takes his test questions from data banks / previous Wharton Advanced Corp Fin finals. What you're tested on for the final isn't necessarily what he covers in class, since this was an intro class. Also, he was emailing us new concepts up to an hour before the exam.

I like Binay. Helpful guy, and actually kept class interesting. One homework set per week (online, so you can't submit late, can take 30 minutes to like 3 hours, depending on the unit, so start early). Tests are tough, but reasonable. Your grade will reflect how much effort you want to put in, so if you work hard, the A is yours.

Professor Binay has difficulty maintaining control of his class and his lectures are tough to follow. Personally, he is a good guy and very friendly. I did not learn a great deal in this class but the investment projects yielded some interesting insights.

Such an amazing Prof. He is one of the smartest guys, and really challenges you. If he thinks your paper is 'good', he'll give you a check which is a B+. I think this makes you think outside the box and push yourself to really put time into each argument you write for class. Would 100% take him again. Learned so much and each class was so valuable.

Professor Schroeder is admirably masterful in his teaching abilities - he has a knack for laying out complicated ideas clearly and logically. His lessons are challenging yet graspable, and he is well respected by his students. His class improved my abilities to construct logical arguments and have them stress-tested with opposing views.

Take Prof. Schroeder: 1. He is brilliant. Will always give you an insightful response that helps you think in a new way. 2. Knows how to teach. Plans every class masterfully and gives the best feedback. 3. The clearest expectations. 4. Regularly contributes to the literature. 5. Student of Sandel / personally knows most philosophers you will read.

Schroeder is the best philosophy prof. Took him for Political Philosophy and we had interesting lectures, papers, and discussions. He really does know how to properly teach philosophy and interpret really dense material - go to office hours with friends and you'll get the most out of it!

One of the best class I've taken at CMC. He is really smart and challenging and he extorts you with counter-argument and counter-counter-argument within a blink. He explains complex abstract ideas with very interesting examples. The readings and writings are really hard but he gives lots of instructions. Hard grader. But you will learn A LOT.

Basically brilliant. Never biased, super helpful/nice, engaging and clear. Take him and be enlightened by how old, dry texts can turn out interesting/relevant. Tough but fair grading - if you engage with the ideas you will learn so much, although you fly through the readings. Conclusion: invaluable class (even if you don't like phil), awesome prof.

Political Philosophy was an amazing class! I had no prior background in philosophy of any sorts, but just because of this one class, I am now considering adding Philosophy as a major. This course requires you to spend about an hour reading and thinking about the texts before class. In class, you have very stimulating conversation. Tough grading.

The most amazing class I've ever taken. She makes you work for your grade and doesn't seem to really love giving As (A- is a triumph in her class), but her amazing, powerful teaching style will give you more than any A could. LOVE IT and was genuinely sad to see the semester end, only because of this class.

Extremely intelligent and knowledgeable. Great at fostering discussion and really teaches IR theory well while keeping it interesting. You have to work hard to get a grade but it's worth all the effort. Final paper is long but if you meet with her to talk about it you'll do fine.

Prof Fabbe is a great role model for female students. She is very smart and personable. ~6 pop quizzes because she was annoyed that we weren't doing the reading, but not bad. A lot of reading + 25 page term paper. I wasn't a gov. pro like some in the class and I still got a B

Fabbe is great -- and if you are thinking of Middle Eastern studies, taking a class with her is a MUST. The class is mostly centered around security-studies, grounded in IR theory. Classes require a fair amount of preparation and exams require tons of studying. Rewarding nonetheless.

Fabbe is crazy smart and is an expert in Middle Eastern Politics. She's helpful and pretty clear about the course material. We had pop quizzes every now and again, but mainly because we didn't do our reading and she got annoyed with it. Highly recommended.

Worst professor I have ever had. Unless you come into this course with prior knowledge of CS you will fail. Does not teach material at all, anything I learned in this course was self-taught. Poor use of class time (who brings their kids to class??) and very unclear lectures and instructions. Take this class somewhere else or teach yourself online

McGrath is extremely helpful during office hours. His paper topics may seem complex at first, but he helps you talk through ideas and gives plenty of direction. Sometimes class discussions are dry, but the material gets more interesting as the semester goes on. Paying attention to his lectures comes in handy when writing papers. Take notes!

The material is pretty dry I would say and it was difficult for me to engage with some of his ideas. However, it is one of those classes where you will do very well if you give him what he wants. If you take notes on exactly what he says and basically put that in your paper, you are golden. He is very nice and accessible though. Not a hard A.

McGrath knows his stuff, but his American Idealism class can be very frustrating. The class is purely discussion-based with little structure and he assigns a lot of long papers with ridiculous prompts. It's very easy to get a B, but takes a lot of work to get an A. Office hours always result in fascinating conversations!
Sarah is such a sweet person, and passionate about leadership. She takes suggestions about the class seriously, and responds well to participation and the sharing of life experiences.

Leland is a genius and you'll definitely learn a lot from him but make sure to meet with him when writing a paper. He is a completely fair and tough grader which improved my writing ability immensely. He challenges you to think but doesn't assign much homework  just to read whatever book you're discussing and three essays. I highly recommend him.

While I loved this class, I would only take it if you already feel confident in your writing ability. His feedback is sparse and he's sometimes hard to access outside of class. His grading criteria is unclear and the prompts are open ended which can be difficult. However, he's a genius, and some of the books we read changed my whole view on writing

Leland (previously a Harvard Prof.) is one of the most intelligent professors I have ever had. The class changed the way I look at the world. Discussions are sophisticated and insightful. Students must submit a half page on their thoughts on the reading, for every class. Lowest grade (B) I received last semester, but easily most enlightening.

Take this class if you want to think deeply and become a better reader/writer. The readings for this class were powerful, and I found myself going to office hours very often just to have long conversations with Leland (and to pet Bear, his dog). Leland is REALLY smart and interesting, and his attention to detail is far above that of mere mortals.

Oddly enough he's one of the most charismatic lecturers around. You'll know what I mean when you witness him in action. Pretty much everyone is in love with him (and his dog, Bear). TAKE HIS CLASS! You'll learn lots and you'll be inspired to pursue literature.

Leland comes off as a pretentious prep boy, but once you get past that, he's one of the smartest, most intelligent people you'll ever meet. Give him time to grow on you because he will. Papers are tough because he doesn't give you a straight topic, but he will definitely help you through them.

I understand why Leland has gotten average ratings, as he is a very difficult grader and expects a lot from his students. However, as a Lit major, he has inspired me to be a better writer and look for art in everything I see; what more can you ask of a professor?

Leland is extremely insightful. He does not dumb down his insights. Those who have only been casually exposed to literature & literary analysis in high school will naturally find him challenging.
