If you are deeply fascinated by literature, take his class. His commentaries are substantial and his perspective eye-opening.

Very intelligent but poor teacher. Class lectures were great but was really divergent, never knew what he was trying to do in class. Completely unhelpful outside class, hard to make appointments beyond office hour. The amount of writing was fair  but paper topics were vague and he grades harsh. Love his dog though.

Great lecturer but he tends to say a lot of wonderful, flowery words without really saying anything at all. When you ask him to clarify things he tends to do the same and is thus completely unhelpful. Assigns a lot of reading but its really really good stuff. Leland does not assign to many papers but he can be a harsh grader.

a brilliant lecturer and a kind professor. picks excellent material. his Nabokov class is one of the best i've ever taken, and i recommend him highly to any student. he can be hard to track down/get a hold of and classes run late so be prepared for that.
Very intelligent professor. He is a hard grader on essays, but if you go to his office hours before then you will be fine on papers. Midterms are hard, but he knows his stuff. Recommended.
Inspiring lectures. Supportive teacher. Knowledgeable. Smart. Caring and helpful.

Professor Yang swears a lot and gives entertaining lectures. That being said, he is not an easy grader  though. The class itself is very organized and I benefited a lot from discussions. Would take again

Very clear regarding the material and his expectations.  The argumentative paper is a bit difficult, but he is more than willing to talk to you about it.  Paper aside, the class is easy, but you will learn a lot.  He made the material interesting.
Prof Yang is awesome! He's super knowledgeable, clear, and fair. I highly recommend him for an intro to phil class. We discussed abortion, existence of God, personal identity, etc.

Super, super easy class. Very clear about his expectations and very helpful. Discussion based class which was really helpful. That said, the topic itself was really annoying because he didn't give us a chance to put our opinion in there. Just told us what was fact and what was not and that was it.

He is a great teacher, and one of the best for an intro class. Tests are super easy as he gives questions to you beforehand. Super helpful in office hours, and always willing to help. Must take his class

Very chill class. We just had to read an assigned reading (which ranged anywhere from 10-50 pages ) but they were always really interesting and fast reads. He grades super leniently and gives great feedback. We only have 3 essays this semester (the last one being our final). there is a participation grade, but discussion is usually pretty chill!

At first he'll give you a reading list of 10 books but honestly we only read 1-3 chapters in each book. Don't buy the books. They're easily accessible online. No midterms or finals, only midterm/final papers. He's a chill fun guy
He's a nice and quirky guy. The class isn't hard at all. Just 3 papers out which the 3rd one can be an expansion of the second. Just participate occasionally.
Professor Kindley is a good FWS professor. He assigns a very reasonable amount of work and gives pretty good feedback on essays. The class was relatively easy and had some interesting books.
Nice professor. Helps if you go to office hours.
Helpful professor.
good course
Kindley led interesting class discussions and I liked the readings. The papers were hard, but he is available during office hours and seemed interested in helping.
He is nice. Lecture is a little bored. He knows more than he talks.
bad class ever
bad instructor
the worst prof I ve had at cmc

His class is very easy and we cover interesting material. He has a pretty laid back and does not lecture. You have to go to class willing to participate, which isn't hard because he has you read passages from the book then discuss it in class. Don't buy the text books, get them from the library andor share.

Professor Kindley is awesome! He was always available for papers and chose novels that were actually interesting. If you are like me and you hate reading, this class will make you think twice. I am now more inspired to read. He grades fairly so just read, participate, and go to the writing center. Best class ever!

Professor Kindley really values participation, and leads a great discussion. Although it's hard to get into a freshman seminar class, he made it as interesting as he could. His own work is also pretty good. Rumor has it he writes for Pitchfork.
Great teacher!!! And super sharp editor.
Kindley was helpful and provided good insights. I enjoyed the reading and think the assignments improved my writing.

This class does not improve your writing at all. I learned more in my 45 minute sessions at the writing center than I learned in his class all semester. He's a boring teacher and unhelpful at his office hours.

Drop this class if at all possible. Why? Kindley expects you to give ridiculous interpretations of the novels read in class and gives no insight whatsoever. There is no reason to attend this class at all because all he does is ask students what they thought and stupidly comments "interesting" every time. His grading style is also ridiculous.

Workload and tests are fair, lectures are straightforward and the notes are legible. Krumm's class was manageable, and he is very helpful during office hours, and even held review sessions before the midterms. I could tell that he cared about his students. Had a positive experience in his class. It's a pity that he's only a visiting assistant prof.

Really cool guy for Linear Algebra. I wouldn't recommend him for Calc. He's a young prof who doesn't have much experience, but his courses have gotten better (read: funnier, easier to succeed, more enjoyable classes) every semester he's taught. His lectures are pretty clear, it's hard to get lost during them.
His classes are very structured. He's very clear in his teaching, and makes sure to take his time to explain things. He's very helpful in office hours, and he's pretty funny. Great teacher

I have took three of his courses including Math303160. The lecture is well-structured and the notes are clear and really help you prepare for the exams. If you don't want to spend too much time on these courses, take him.

In 3 yrs he might be a decent teacher, but this semester he was painfully inexperienced, and the students who actually cared to put a lot of work into the course, paid the price. His tests were unpredictable, making it difficult to know what focus on for studying. His course is much harder than other MATH030s. Not too helpful in office hours either

Don't blame the professor. The only problem in the class is many students do not realize that they are now in a college. They assume that all material in class is enough for exams. You need to do work by yourself. Professor Krumm prepares well for his classes and gives clear explanations.

This professor is the worst professor at CMC. He doesn't teach the material properly, won't respond to questions that he deems "too simple" and his exams are too difficult and testing you on topics he hasn't even taught in class but expects you to know on your own. Prepare to teach yourself all the material and still expect a D in his class.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. HE WROTE THE FIRST REVIEW. HE SAYS THE PROBLEM IS STUDENTS. THE PROBLEM IS HIM. He does not teach the material and then gives very difficult exams.
Not a good professor. He wants you to understand, but his teaching style isn't good. His midterms are hard and he doesn't curve the class, so no only is it hard, but its also tough to do well in.
I don't know anyone who likes his class. He's not accommodating at all. .

I have a feeling people will give him a poor review this semester, but take those reviews with a grain of salt.  He's new and still learning how to teach.  But he's also brilliant and is VERY helpful in office hours.  Just beware of 8am maths at CMC.  The problem isn't the prof, but the students.  Krumm works very hard to teach this class.

Took history of human health and disease with Prof. Venit-Shelton and really learned a lot! Assigned a variety of projects rather than typical papers or tests based on readings which I loved and was very clear about grading. She is creative, enthusiastic, and SUPER kind to her students! She curated this topic so well and cared what we had to say.

Her FHS Nature and society class was super interesting and engaging in my opinion (discussions about native land, and colonialism). There were only 3 essays over the course of the semester plus a group project. It is a super manageable class and not hard to get a good grade if you write about the message she wants you to get out of the readings.

Do not take her FHS class unless you are majoring in environment!!! Her grading policy is unclear and she sets her standard impossibly high. Her essay prompts are really confusing. You have to write what she wants just to get an okay grade. She asks a lot of difficult questions during class discussion and gets mad when nobody can answer them.

This class changed my life. She is SO focussed and helpful, and has a clear direction when it comes to how she wants the semester to progress, with a really good balance of discussions, lectures, papers and a three-class simulation at the end of the semester that replaces the final paper. Class is challenging but worth it. Highly recommend her.

We had to play this ridiculous and grueling role-playing history game to pass this class, which pretty much sums it up. Just skip this professor. As stated, grading is very arbitrary. Do not take unless history major and are very very committed to the field. Strange college class, but CMC is very strange.

I took this class as a GE hoping it would be easy. It wasn't nearly as easy as I hoped it would be, so if that's your reason for taking the class then there are probably better options. Other than that she's pretty cool and is willing to meet outside of class to help with essays. You have to read a lot but I think that's standard for history.

Do yourself a favor and don't take this class. I took it because I heard great things about her (great prof and reasonable grader), but after she received tenure, she's gotten so much harder. Unclear with guidelines, arbitrary grading, lots of reading. One of my least favorite classes I've taken at CMC.

Such a great prof!! So kind and very accessible and willing to help during office hours. She gave interesting lectures and I enjoyed the assignments. She appreciates participation in class and does a good job of guiding the discussion, which I loved! If you have the opportunity to take a class of hers, do it!!

LOVE HER!! She is always willing to help and is very very clear during in-class lectures. She'e not a harsh grader, but I definitely felt like I got a lot out of her feedback on my essays. She also didn't assign too many essays, which was nice. I highly recommend her.

What a TERRIFIC professor! She is extremely helpful, fun, and overall, just a wonderful person. Her lectures and discussions were engaging and the readings and papers were definitely manageable. One of the BEST profs I've had in college!

SUCH A GREAT PROF!!! Everyone should take a class from this wonderful woman. The readings were light but super rewarding. Class discussions were great, and the papers were very reasonable. She's funny, willing to help, and open to different ideas. Even with a large class (~25) she still manages to create a community. This is how college should be.

AMAZING professor and person! She has the best personality. She is the sweetest and kindest professor I have ever had. Her class is interesting and the books aren't too difficult (or expensive). reading requirements are relatively light and her papers aren't too difficult to handle. She makes sure you get the material so writing a paper is easier.

In a subject as difficult as OChem, Iafe is awesome. This is my 2nd semester with him, and he is so understanding and relatable to students. Really just an amazing OChem professor. Would HIGHLY recommend.

Professor Iafe is such a great professor. He dedicates so much time to his students and truly wants everyone to succeed. He provides the best review sessions and even organizes reaction sheets and charts just to make it easier on students. His practice tests are essentially the exact same format as tests and he's very fair with partial credit!
The Best professor I have ever had in my entire life.  Clear, funny, and extremely helpful.  Young guy so he gets us as students.  Simply THE BEST

Worth getting to know her during office hours -- she's super helpful and knowledgeable, especially about technical things in econometrics/Stata/Tableau. A bit of a dry sense of humor, very caring, and talk to her about her research!
Easy A, it's a lot easier if you have calc 3 before/know how to do math. She doesn't give you much time on tests, but curves hard on midterms.
Not an easy pass, but she's pretty straightforward and very willing to help outside of class!

She's by far the worst prof I've had here.  As somebody who is really interested in econ, i've been able to power through but i have multiple friends who have dropped econ as part of their dual major after taking this class.

Prof. T is extremely caring. Two mid-terms and one final - and one of them will be extremely tough. But she curves the class at the end, and even gives students the option of adding more weight to their final if they do well. She's very organized, but sticks only to the notes w/o real-life examples. I'd recommend - very straightforward.

Be warned; tests often have types of problems you have never seen before in homework or even the textbook. She's caring and will help you, though. Homework is easy enough, and note-taking is easy because she gives you blank versions of her lecture slides to fill in.

I love Professor Tocoian. She's super helpful during office hours and will review things in class if you're confused about something. Work hard and you'll be rewarded. Lectures are pretty straight forward since she prints out the notes for class and you just fill them in. Would definitely recommend!
You really have to work to even get a B in the class. She throws stuff on the exam that no one has ever seen before that is really difficult and doesn't curve it. Would not recommend to anyone.

boring - literally talked half the class to sleep every time. made me sad except when she brought candy to class. homework was ok, midterms were insanely difficult and unrelated to what we covered in class. no word in English language to describe what final made me feel

She's a really sweet woman, but it extremely tough! Another professor teaching from the same textbook and same course required the students to study lesser chapters and his tests were much easier! She's funny, but don't take her class if you want to learn and want an easy grade.
Super nice woman and a decent professor. Doesn't use enough examples in class. Between homework and midterms it's not too difficult.

Prof Ngo was always helpful in office hours and he clearly wanted his students to learn biochemistry. The tests were fairly similar to the practice exams and the homeworks. The ridiculously expensive textbook really wasn't used for the class. I really enjoyed taking biochem with him though.

If I had the opportunity to go back, I would have taken the alternate Biochemistry class at Pomona with a lab...  This guy is a joke.  Lectures seem to be intuitive, along with the book, but expect to be far more detailed than reasonable on the exams.  WE ARE NOT PhD STUDENTS.  I love this subject, but this instructor really hampered that for me.
He is not helpful. He clearly has a huge ego and assesses students based on whether or not they suck up to him.

Tests are hard -- but he will go over anything you need help on and genuinely wants students to succeed! The class got painstakingly boring towards the end, but I will credit that to the material, not to him.
Tests are  a bit difficult but lectures are clear. Always willing to go over the test with you

Probably one of the best out of all the chemistry professors at the intro level. His lectures are helpful and easy to understand most of the time, but if you're not getting it then just ask and he'll explain it again. Very helpful in office hours and really cares about all of his students. He will go over your test with you. His tests are difficult

Bad for a GE but great if you actually want to get to know the material. He is a very difficult test grader but it's only because he wants you to truly appreciate what is being taught. Very helpful in and out of class and definitely willing to help if your grades have fallen in a hole.

Tests are similar to practice exams, office hours are helpful. He is a lovely chap in general but I dislike his teaching style. There is hardly any note taking in class and lectures are not worth going to because they don't cover the necessary material. Prepare to teach yourself. Your textbook will be your best friend in this class.

He is hilarious in that he makes these awkward not funny chemistry jokes that are just plain cute. He is a good chemistry professor i think and he really tries hard for his students to succeed in his class. Prepare yourself for weekend exams!

He was awesome!!! The class went into a lot of detail and if you put in the work, it will pay off. He is super nice and he is willing to do whatever he needs to do in order to help his students. DEFINITELY TAKE HIM FOR CHEM!!!!!

I really likes this professor. It's his first year teaching, so he still has to figure out what kind of teaching style is most effective for him. He tends to take things slowly, which can be detrimental if you already understand the material and just want to speed through, but it can also be a great thing when you don't understand a certain topic.
She is terribly unclear.  Her lectures are fumbling.  Even worse she is very very bad and understanding questions.  I really expected more.

One of the best math profs I've ever had. Her lectures are crystal clear--you can copy what she writes into your notes and understand it all. P-sets are just the right level of challenging. She always replies to emails, and she's patient and straightforward in office hours.
very good professor

Wasn't the biggest fan.  Math dept @ CMC is definitely weak.  Seems to care significantly more about her research than helping students.  Not very helpful with questions b/c she assumes you know what you're talking about (which is clearly not the case if I'm asking a question).  Was disappointed to find a teacher like this at CMC.
Best Math prof I've had at CMC. Super clear lectures, 10/10 would recommend. Homework is sometimes hard but tutoring hours are really useful.

She is not very clear at all.  I wish her lectures were more organized.  She fumbles with ideas a lot, and she gets confused by questions easily.  She was not terrible, but I would not take her again.
Lectures are super clear because she writes every important stuff down on the blackboard. Easy class with minimal homework and fairly easy tests.

She's pretty goofy in general e.g. we take a break in the middle of a 75 min class to look at a math comic/video that a student shares to earn a dropped HW. Her class is pretty slow-going and she let's you have one page of notes per midterm (easy), 3 pages of notes for the final (harder). Slow class, but Needell is funny and sweet.

She is brilliant. However she is fairly new at teaching. She goes very slowly in content and starts back in a comprehensive algebra review. I know for myself this was very helpful. She is a great teacher but could still use a few more years under her belt first.

His class did not help me learn the material well and when I asked for help he did not care to provide it. He is not an easy professor because he does not teach the subject well and then tests you on it with a test he does not even read himself. Please do not take his class!
The best way to put it is, only take him if you need to take accounting this semester and he is the only teacher left. Avoid him unless absolutely necessary. Great guy, terrible teacher.

He is easily the worst teacher I have ever had. There is absolutely no structure to his 'lectures' and he often either loses his train of though or ventures down unnecessary and irrelevant tangents. Furthermore, his 'study guides' are pitiful and are of no help in preparing for exams. There is no upside to taking this class.

His lectures don't contribute to the tested material at all. He likes to talk about accounting and its uses, but rarely teaches the fundamentals and expects you to be able to complete the homework by learning the material yourself. For someone not familiar with accounting, this was a very difficult and frustrating class.
A visiting lecturer with absolutely no background in teaching. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Weekly homework. Two tests. Great person. Really cares that the students learn basic CS. There for you if you need him. Take his class!
Wonderful professor with a geeky sense of humor. Great at explaining concepts, very understanding of his students, and made me fall in love with CS again.
He was very clear during lecture, although at times it was a bit boring. He was very fair and the class overall wasn't too hard.

Great intro class. He doesn't try to make his lectures super exciting, but if you're interested in the material like I was it should be pretty interesting. At the very least his lectures are very informative and easy to follow. He's incredibly helpful and will always try to answer any questions you have.
Great introduction to java. The class was alot of work but be prepared to put in effort, especially if this is your first programming class. Professor Sun was super helpful.

Although at first he built up a lot of excitement about the course, his lectures became very dry and useless to go to. He gave a pop "quiz" every now and then for attendance purposes, but you could get away with not going a few times. He is an incredibly nice and knowledgeable guy when you meet with him, but it is hard to stay alert in lectures.

The class wasn't very enlightening and it was confusing at times. However, the workload was reasonable and the tests pushed you to think, which was good. While Yoon wasn't the best at explaining things, he was really nice and helpful.

Professor Yoon is a tough professor, but pretty manageable once you learn what to expect from him. If you study the homework and class examples closely, you shouldn't have a problem with any of the quizzes or tests. He is not very engaging, and it is easy to get distracted because every desk has a computer. Helpful in office hours.

His econometrics course was harder than his stats course, but he still was able to give homework and quiz problems that reflected what was on the exams.  Continues to teach R as well.  Not a bad class.
Very nice and approachable. Office hours are super helpful. Willing to listen to students' feedback and make amendments. Might give some tricky questions in exams but fair overall.
Very clear presentation notes.  Worksheets and homework were good preparation for tests.  Not a lot of busy work and very willing to help students during office hours.

I'm in my second class with Ghenwa and she's amazing! She really encourages you to be your best and makes a difficult language fun and accessible. She is also very accommodating and really can make the class what you want it to be. Take her classes and take Arabic!!

Fantastic professor. Her class can certainly be daunting, but she also definitely means well. She is very friendly and willing to help. I have taken two classes with her so far and both have been very challenging but equally helpful. Study hard, ya shabab. You need to understand   what she's teaching in order to succeed. I recommend office hours.

Nice lady, terrible prof. Never responds to email and rarely shows at meetings. Talks too fast and doesn't explain her processes clearlycarefully. Expects you to show up to all problem sessions though optional.  Wish she was more helpful.

As a lab prof, I would make appointments with her to ask questions and get help on reports. She would flat-out not show up to appointments and made no effort to help. I had to rely on coincidentally meeting other Ochem professors in her office.

Misleading bec seems like teaches everything to solve ?s but leaves important element out. Did not like how she decided to make a ? all or nothing to make the grade discretion large (Likes a 90% vs 70% gap btw students). There are ?s on test didn't learned in class. Told me a C+ (that's with curve) is a good grade and shouldn't worry. (yeah right!)

Stanton is a nice lady - she is willing to help if you ask and come to office hours, and she has her problem solving sessions which are very helpful for the exams. However, she can go very quickly in her lectures and I had to watch supplementary videos just to catch up to the material. Study the practice exam!!

I had Prof. Stanton the first semester she taught at the Claremont Colleges and prior to that as a class T.A. She is a wonderful professor who tries to ensure that her students do well with helpful office hours. She may rush at times with pwpt lectures, but her board lectures are clear. Overall, I highly recommend her.

Her class was the best I've taken at college.  She knows a *lot* and the class was consistently taught at a high level.  She also struck an excellent balance in class discussion.  Her feedback always brought up new ideas I hadn't considered.  Would 100% recommend if you are passionate about the subject, but if you aren't give it a miss.

I appreciated Stergiopoulos' class.  Stimulating, rewarding, helpful during office hours.  She strikes the perfect balance b/w allowing students freedom and shutting down BS.   Discussion in class was very organic and supplemented by her extensive preparation.   Only thing: I sometimes felt my grade was predetermined.
Personally found her to be very boring. Lectures are dull and feel long. If you are enthusiastic about the material maybe it won't be so bad.
This is my first review ever, and I have to do it because Professor Stergiopoulos is an inspiration!!! She is SO smart and lovely.  Could not recommend her enough.  So knowledgable in her field.
Lots of work. Not helpful. Felt like a waste of time. She is well intentioned though.

I adore Prof Stergiopoulos. She is one of the most passionate and insightful professors I have ever had. The poets that she selected were consistently interesting and her thoughtful feedback on essays definitely improved my writing. The workload was appropriately challenging yet reasonable. I always looked forward to this class. Highly recommended!
She knows her subject but she is not an engaging professor. Much better in office hours than in class. I personally would nit recommend taking her.

Very smart and insightful, expects students to read as in depth as she does. Lectures drag on as they are mostly comprised of her analyzing the poems and stories listed under the syllabus. A lot of reading expected.

She is passionate and (maybe too) intelligent and gives incredibly insightful analyses of the poems read in class. She is sometimes unclear and makes minor changes to the syllabus often. We got through few of the poems assigned because the class was so discussion-based- more guidance may have been good. Hard grader, great feedback. Would recommend.

She is somewhat new to teaching. She apparently thought it was a great idea to test us on 15 chapters with no study guide. She was nice enough to curve the exam but the curve was set by 1 of the 3 grad students in a class of 25. Her lectures were very vague and studying for the 2 exams was difficult because the students were not given any direction

Dr. Sterling's main strength is that she is very easy to relate to. She makes her lectures interesting and relevant, and keeps the class organized. She's also very receptive to student feedback and understanding of what it is like to be a college student.

I'd like to note that Giulio remains the best professor I've ever had. Not only is Giulio personable and incredibly supportive, he is brilliant!. His notes and suggestions on papers are the most thorough I've ever seen. I wish he was still here because his classes were inspirational and the highlight of my educational experience.

Papers assigned are as difficult as you make them out to be, depending on the prompt chosen. You benefit the most from his class if youre already a good writer & want to challenge yourself to gain clarity in flow & originality in your ideas. I personally enjoyed the philosophical readings that supplemented the literature aspect of this class.

Pertile is an approachable, reasonable, and truly caring professor who really knows how to engage you with literature. He gives great feedbacks to you if you need help with the essays, and will gladly make as many appointments as you'd like to get help. He is a hard grader, though, particularly in this high-level literature class.

He's amazingly intelligent and can give you a new insight toward poems and literature even though you used to not have a particular interest. He might not be a type of person who can give you a good impression in the first day of his class and might give you a feeling that he's kind of an awkward guy. But be patient; HIS CLASS IS DANG WORTH IT

Giulio expects a lot from you, but he is a great professor. His FWS class was interesting yet demanding. He kind of hammered everyone on the first assignment, but don't get frustrated. Go talk to him during office hours - it will help your paper a lot!

Giulio (as we call him (not to his face) because we don't know how to pronounce his last name) is REALLY smart, but not such a charismatic lecturer. He loves to talk in office hours, and the assigned readings are super interesting. His personality is kinda funny and odd, but he's a good professor. No textbook but LOTS of novels

Professor Bergevin is a very kind and encouraging professor, but he doesn't seem that enthusiastic about the subject material. He is an easy grader and doesn't assign much work, but you will still learn som important concepts from his class if you practice on your own.

A very different kind of class that focuses on theoretical ideas rather than typical accounting problems. Some of the material is really out there, but Pete loves the stuff and it shows. The main part of the class involves him calling on 2 people per class to answer questions, which can be pretty scary, but he's super nice and grades so generously.

While the class was a little dry at times his lectures were very illuminating and crystal-clear - some of the most clear ones I've listened to. Exams were very fair and easy if you studied. A really jolly and completely unpretentious man - take accounting with him for sure!
Very clear lectures. Thoroughly explains everything. No curveballs on tests. Overall a really nice guy.

Prof Rose is incredibly organized, knowledgeable and engaging. Her classes are well structured and she prints off the slides for you. There are no midterms, but rather pop quizzes on important topics. She is a fair grader. As long as you work hard and show that you are engaged, Gov20 is extremely worthwhile to take with Rose.

Prof Rose is great! Extremely smart, gives good feedback and is very accessible outside of class. The fact that she made Stata and Econ pretty easy and very accessible for someone like myself, who hadn't taken econ or done coding/used data analysis software before, shows how great of a prof she is. highly recommend!

Prof Rose is amazing. Class was reading-heavy, but there were only two 7 page papers and no midterms. Definitely go to her office hours to talk about your paper. She does give pop quizzes but you can very easily predict when they're going to be. She gives printouts of lecture slides, which makes note-taking very easy.
I would definitely recommend this professor! She is very nice and helpful!

Professor Rose is a great professor. Her lectures are very clear and conversation based. As with any GOV 020 class, there is a fair bit of reading, but she does her best to male sure we understand and analyze it. Great intro gov professor.

She is an amazing professor. She keeps the course current and relevant. Participation definitely matters and she will challenge you to contribute, to think and to improve your writing skills. She gives excellent feedback on your research papers and the reading responses are definitely better than a midterm.

Prof. Rose is one of the most talented teachers I have had.  Will definitely challenge you  to contribute, to think, and to improve your writing skills.  Really keeps the course current and relevant,  which breathes life into course work.

Homework was a bit tough for me since I wasn't very skilled with programming in matlab before taking his course, but he provides many resources and is very helpful in office hours (usually walks you through it). Lots of review in the first week(s) so everyone is caught up. Test content is gone over clearly in class (1 question on x, 1 on y, etc.)
Tests are very clear cut and is very lenient on grading them too!

He's a really good guy and sometimes he gets a little tripped up in his lecture notes, but his homework and tests are very manageable! He gives a clear outline of what his tests look like and posts many sample exams that are very similar to his actual test. Overall just very kind and reasonable.

Professor Hunter is among the sweetest, most caring, and supportive professors I have ever had. Though he has tough tests and quizzes, his homework assignments are reasonable. His lectures oftentimes cover too many things in such a short time that it may be overwhelming, but if you work hard and come in and see him, you will be able to do just fine
This is such a boring class. The worst Math class I have ever taken. This professor is new and does not know yet how to teach an interesting class.
There is a lot of homework but his tests are fair exams.  I would highly recommend his linear algebra class!

Professor Hopper's class was demanding but equally rewarding. He has very high expectations for his students, most obviously shown in the way he grades. But his discussions never failed to be engaging and thought-provoking. Would definitely take his class again.

Professor Hopper is one of the best professors at CMC. He cares deeply about his students, war simulations, and makes history engaging. Taking 2 of his classes has made me consider switching my major to history. What you put into this class is what you get out of it. Only people highly engaged will receive As. I've never learned more about history.

Professor Hopper structured this class with the WWI simulation at the center. The simulation is a great experience, students have a lot of flexibility, and he is always available to give feedback. Most course readings are concentrated in the first month of the semester, and not dry at all. The overall workload is lighter than the average class.

IMPORTANT: We did not receive a single assignment or grade back this entire semester. Although Professor Hopper is extremely articulate, he is extremely condescending (which discourages participation). It is also impossible to participate if you are not one of Hopper's few favorites. Do yourself a favor find a more professional professor. BE WARNED

This class is unlike any other at CMC. The war simulation is so elaborate that many non-majors were drawn in. Professor Hopper is super devoted to the simulation and went out of his way to make it the best experience. Class discussion often leads to thought-provoking moral debates. His grading is not as tough as students may think it is at first.

Professor Hopper's teaching is rewarding and innovative. He puts aside a lot of time to talk with students, and those sessions are truly inspirational. There is less reading than the average History class at CMC. The fluid grading system can be unsettling, but most students do better than they expect. I would definitely recommend his classes.

Professor Hopper is clearly the expert on the subject matter that he teaches. Discussion was always lively.  I had him for Logic of War, and the simulation at the end (effectively replacing a final examination) was one of the most fun experiences I've ever had in a classroom. Though there are no tests, he is not an easy grader on papers.

Hopper's class was engaging and challenging. He grades essays harshly but is very willing to help if you go in to talk to him. He seems excited about the subject matter and will talk about it. A lot of the assignments are rather open ended, but, like I said, he is happy to explain. I would definitely take a class from him.

I went through liking, hating, then loving Hopper. He is young and quite funny, but a little condescending with the subject. This is his territory and he's very proud of his knowledge. However, he is SO available to help. Which is good, since he is an extremely tough essay grader. It's a lot of work, it was a pain at times, but I ended up loving it

Professor Rinaldi is one of the kindest professors. She does a great job at being available, and is very flexible with office hours if you make an effort to email her. Weekly homework that takes about an hour (sapling), and class participation (REEF). There are 3 midterms and a final. The book (and outlining) is ESSENTIAL. Class slides are helpful.
Really helpful, and made chemistry fun !!!! Best chemistry teacher I have had to date.
Terrible Professor, unreasonable person, doesnt want you to do well in her class

O chem will be challenging no matter who you have, but Neeraja is great at teaching it! Her lectures are very informative, she holds extra problem sessions weekly, and she is helpful in office hours. Because she doesn't collect any homework, you have to be diligent with keeping up on the studying though.

Professor Dashaputre is the teacher you want for Organic Chemistry. She is helpful and open to spending time with you individually if you are struggling in any way, however, that being said the class is difficult as you would expect and the tests (while similar to the practice exams) are about 4x as hard.

Neeraja is so sweet and a great scientist. She is pretty rushed in her lectures. Her tests are exactly like her practice exams but 10x the intensity. You will see things that you didn't go over once in awhile, but they are reasoning questions not mechanisms you didn't cover. She is a great person to talk to about life. Definitely recommend her.

I absolutely loved Neeraja!  She was very helpful and extremely available for extra help and would clarify something for you as many times as it would take you to understand it (very helpful for ochem).  You can tell that she genuinely cared about everyone of her students as students and as people.  Her exams were difficult but doable.

She's absolutely wonderful. My favorite professor! She's so kind to students and is ALWAYS available in office hours and usually by email. She goes out of her way to help her students because she GENUINELY CARES. Her lectures are clear and she makes good analogies to help you understand difficult concepts. Made Ochem my favorite class!!!
Excellent
Really awesome and helpful. Highly recommended !!!
Great guy, easy class.

Dr. Warachka restored my faith in Academia. He is really nice and helpful, down to earth, and available to students. You can tell he really cares about students and wants them to understand the material and succeed in the course (This is more rare than people think). Lectures are very informative and interesting.  I would definitely take him again
He's awesome

I thoroughly enjoyed taking GOVT70 with Professor Saltzman. He kept class interesting and you could tell he was very passionate about the course material. He does cold call on students sometimes, but if you are taking notes or keep up with the reading, you shouldn't be taken off guard. Would definitely take a class with him again.

There are daily quizzes, which means you can't miss a single class. He really wants his students to succeed and is open with questions + OHs. Generally clear lectures, but I wish he had gone more in-depth and did more calculations because I felt the exams didn't always reflect what was learned in class. Overall, solid choice for chem 14/15!

I've had better chemistry professors. Unless you do really well, it's difficult to get your grade up because there is no extra credit or test revisions. He does meet in office hours, which can be helpful. The textbook was awful so I relied on him to teach me everything. Therefore, I wish we were given more examples for how to do calculations. Meh

He only requires you to know the most basic information, yet still takes forever explaining easy concepts in a really unclear way. He also leaves out a lot of key information that would be helpful when solving problems or understanding concepts. Lectures are agony but tests are pretty easy if you study.

He gives daily class quizzes so you can't really skip a class.  He's really approachable and loves when people ask questions. He is open for  extra scheduled office hours which is helpful if your schedule does not permit you to attend his set hours. Super nice. Tests are general, definitely study as you learn type of class.

This was a difficult class and Prof Cohen made us really work for the A but he is a great professor. He is clear about his expectations and he genuinely wants us to do well. He tries to accommodate us for office hours so he is very accessible. He explained concepts really well and I would take class with him again if he hadn't left!

Professor Cohen is extremely dedicated and his course is very challenging. He's friendly, open, and readily available for help at any time. His lectures are engaging and entertaining, while at the same time informative, clear, and accessible. Grading criterion is specific, and grading is very fair.

One of my favorite professors ever. The class was definitely challenging, but I feel as though I really learned the material. Prof Cohen expects a lot of his students and in return dedicates a lot of time to them through extensive office hours and engaging lectures. I highly recommend taking one of his classes if you are willing to put in the work

Such a fun class but I had to work really hard for the A. Definitely pushes you and is a very tough professor. But he brings out the best in you. He's a very caring professor and wants all of you to succeed so don't be afraid to ask him for help if you're struggling in his class.

Professor Cohen was by far the most helpful and caring teacher Ive experienced in my college career. He is available at all hours of the day to answer any questions you might have and you can tell he really wants you to succeed in his class. It was also one of the most challenging classes I have taken and expect to work hard if you want to do well

Professor Cohen is far and away the best professor I have ever had. He was also likely the most difficult professor I have ever had.  I learned more in this class than I have in any of my other classes in my 3 and a half college years, and left the classroom after the final knowing that I would always have a mentor and friend in professor Cohen.

One of the most inspirational teachers I have had here at the Claremont Colleges. Prof Cohen makes you work for it so be ready to ask questions and see him if you have any questions (he's more than willing to meet with his flexible and extensive office hours). You will not only learn a lot about the course material but also how much you can achieve

This class was the hardest class I have ever taken. It almost broke me and made me loose all hope in my development has a scientist. I came into this class with very little experience in science but it was my passion. Now I am taking upper division classes and they seem easy in comparison. Keep going if you are in his class, it will work out :)
Great professor
He is amazing! Learned a ton in his class. He has high expectations but they can be met as long as you put in the effort.

Take his class. You won't regret it. He honestly wants you to do well and if you don't understand go to his office hours and he will make it simple to understand. He is by far one of the best prof. at keck.

I had Professor Cohen for both lab and lecture and in both sections he was incredibly helpful and direct.  While his style of teaching does not work for everyone, it made a huge impact on me, and made me much more open and engaged with the material than I would have been otherwise.  He truly values the feedback and participation of his students.

I just had him for lab and he gave very detailed lectures at the beginning of each lab (which would make lab take a long time). He cares a lot about his students though, and as long as you are trying and ask for help, you'll do  really well.
He's there for you and will give you the help you need, but expect to work hard in class.
He's awesome.

If you love biology, you will definitely learn a TON from Dr. Cohen. That said, if you want even a moderately easy class, don't take him. He loves his students and is an amazing teacher but expects a lot and you won't get an A without a LOT of studying. Harder than a lot of upper div classes.

Professor Cohen did a great job at teaching lab. He was very thorough and made sure everyone understood the content. If students couldn't attend office hours he would make time for them.  Overall he was very helpful and understanding. He was tough on grading but he did it to make us better.

To say the least, Prof Cohen has a very interesting teaching style. He drastically changed his course based on student feedback so the class went from being very difficult to manageable. Prof Cohen is very passionate about biology and always willing to help students who seek it. Also very understanding.

Prof Cohen is a knowledgable teacher who is passionate about his field and dedicated to his students.  He is always available for his students and spends a lot of time and effort preparing for lectures, assignments and exams.  He is demanding and sets a high bar with challenging tests and assignments and but  works with students to get there.

After the first exam didn't go well, he was extremely receptive to the troubles of his students.  He adjusted the class to be more doable from our perspective without dumbing down the class.  He is very helpful in office hours and truly cares about seeing you succeed.

Prof Vossmeyer is the best tbh. Very nice and explains topics very well. If you pay attention in class and go to office hours (if needed) you should get at least a B+. I was scared of metrics before the class but it ended up being a breeze. Super chill class and you learn a lot
Online lecture videos were fantastic

Took her for econometrics. We take a lot of notes , but she engages with the class to us to understand the material. She is accessible and helpful outside of class. Material is difficult, but she is thorough with her explanations and expectations for the exam. Take metrics from her. But beware, her classes are always full!

She's super knowledgable in econometrics and data analysis (and loves it). We covered a lot of material, but she explains things in a way that is easy to grasp. Lectures are fun - half are computer exercises. Highly recommend this class and Prof. Vossmeyer.

Very nice professor: funny and super chill. Not a fan of the teaching style (She writes notes on the board, you copy them down, rinse and repeat.)  Material can seem arcane, but exams were extremely easy. (Memorization rather than understanding is rewarded). Overall not the most invigorating class.

Very charming (!) professor and extremely friendly during office hours. Lectures are organized and her jokes are great. As long as you take good class notes, tests and HW should be straightforward. Definitely take metrics with her if you can.

Vossmeyer is probably the best professor to take metrics from. She's super smart and will help you if you seek her out, but she also legitimately loves metrics so she'll teach you as much as you're willing to learn. She's reasonable about the work and she wants you to do well. She's also pretty hot.

She is very clear and organized. We take lots of notes during the class. But if you can memorize the notes and review the hw, there will be no surprises for you on the exams since everything is from notes and hw. Very nice prof. Easy A. Definitely would take again.
She is the best econ professor I've had. Very clear, helpful, funny. Take her for any class you can.
Extremely straightforward and helpful both during lecture and office hours. Study the notes and you'll do well. She's a new prof but she knows her stuff. Highly recommend the class! Love her.
Vossmeyer is tough. Had her for both Econometrics and Intermediate Micro. Would not recommend if you want your GPA to survive

He came from a large school (UCSB) and his attitude toward us showed it. Was very condescending. There were little to no mentions of biology in a PHYSICS FOR LIFE SCIENCES class - maybe he has never taken biology. He is enthusiastic, which helped, but it was not enough to make this class bearable. This is the worst class I've ever taken at the 5Cs.

Fun person, but needs some time to improve as a professor. The test questions can be vague, so if you are confused, you should ask him to clear it up. Sometimes important info can be missing. Definitely do the homework well to prepare for the tests. Grading is strange, but very detailed oriented. Include units on everything, even scratch work.

Professor Moore is a new teacher and has a long way to go before he can truly become an amazing teacher. Although enthusiastic about teaching the material when asked about questions he seemed to be annoyed and even came off as condescending more than once. His grading is very detail oriented and exact and slight mistakes cost you greatly.

Prof Lower knows her stuff, and she is super caring. It's a really interesting class, and just has a lot of weekly readings. The one thing I don't like is that it is kind of disorganized at times, but besides that really is quite an enjoyable class. For a seminar class, time goes by fast! Would def take again. Overall, Lower is great and do take.

Professor Lower is so knowledgable about her field, and all semester I found myself leaving class having learned way more than I thought possible. Her lectures are super interesting, especially when she shares her own research experiences. There's a lot of reading and a super long paper, so if you're not a history major, tread carefully.

It IS lecture heavy but participation matters too! I loved Professor Lower's course on the Holocaust. I actually learned the most about a historical event I ever have. I highly suggest going to her office hours and reaching out to her, this is where you will see how much of a genius she is and how strongly she cares for all her students.

Prof. Lower is one of those professors who, if you show that you care, come to class, and seek her feedback in office hours, you will have made a lifelong relationship with an inspirational mentor. She is highly knowledgeable and provides opportunities for students to attend talks and events outside which are always WELL WORTH the time! Love her!

Professor Lower seems like she would be a good researcher, but did not run her class very well. She was not clear of her expectations for assignments, assigned massive amounts of reading that was never discussed, and was not consistent or clear in grading assignments.
Lower was an incredible professor and introduced me to the discipline of genocide studies.
Nicest professor I have ever had, totally worth taking his class.

This is the second course that I have taken with Professor Cooper. This class was very similar to my experience with the last class: A WONDERFUL PROFESSOR. Professor Cooper has such a passion for what he teaches that it is actually challenging to not enjoy what he is teaching. He is the most caring professor I have ever had. G-Coops is the MAN.

FANTASTIC professor! Lectures were thorough and he clearly knows his stuff. Really cares about his students toowilling to help out during office hours and gives excellent guidance, and is very accommodating about illnesses. If you show up, getting the A is easy, but that doesn't detract from the learning at all. Highly recommend for FHS & History!

Professor Cooper is sincerely my favorite professor that I have ever taken. He is the most caring and understanding educator that I have ever had the opportunity to learn beneath. If you put in the effort, you will get an A in this class. He is wonderful during office hours and truly has a passion for what he is teaching. TAKE THIS CLASS!!

This man was a little scatter-brained at times and the class was more lecture-based than most FHS classes, but we definitely read some interesting stuff and he is so knowledgeable. Take him if you're looking for an easy A--most lenient grader ever. He's also willing to help on papers. Definitely going to take another class with him!
Amazing Professor.  Knows 16 languages (fluently!!) Extremely accommodating and understanding - would take again!!!

He's new so he comes off as a pushover and doesn't really know how to lead a discussion yet, but really really helpful at office hours. He genuinely WANTS you to do well in the class so lets you rewrite all 3 of your papers. Loves when you participate so do it! It doesn't count for your grade but it'll make the class go faster!

Very unprofessional and mediocre, (she most likely erased more of the negative reviews). Don't rely on her help or she will intimidate you by replying that you didn't pay close enough attention etc, instead of just answering the simple question. She looses focus in classes and goes off topic, shes rude online and in person. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Rinaldi makes sure to explain the basis of every concept and really helped me feel more confident about Chemistry. She's got a great sense of humor and is very relatable. Outstanding chemistry teacher!
She's in good in office hours but rushes fast through the material. It's easy to fall off if you mess up on any section of the course (i.e homework, exams, presentation)

Very specific on answers, she's not very generous on partial credit, you either know it all the way or you don't. If she's the only option and you're  chem major or biochem major you'll do fine, if you're like me and need it for major requirement, make some friends in the class

Straightforward lectures, reasonable tests, and easy homework (which can be done with 100% as long as you do it and not give up). Lectures have REEF polls which will require you to stick around in the lecture room; otherwise, you will lose 10% for participation. Rinaldi is very reasonable and accessible, though her office is a bit hard to find.

Great professor! Expects a lot of her students but you should be fine if you engage in the lectures and take good notes. Helpful during office hours and very accommodating of students with illnesses. Taking her class again next semester :)

Low expectations mean it's up to the students to take initiative in learning material by reading and writing outside of class. A grammar-heavy curriculum can be frustrating. That said, I haven't encountered a more caring, friendly, and self-reflective professor at CMC. He's a gem. His classes are easy but don't expect to master Arabic anytime soon.

Prof. Hurlocker is awesome. Her o chem classes are tough, like probably the hardest class I've ever taken. But she is the best lecturer I have ever had, and she gives you all the tools to succeed, you just need to work for it. Super accessible in office hours, and if you are confused on anything and ask her to explain it, she does it perfectly.
Prof Hurlocker is great, we truly aren't worthy. So helpful, and a very cool person. Seems intimidating at first but she's really great

Professor Hurlocker was one of my favorite professors. I took both semesters of Intro Chem with her and they definitely required hard work but she was organized and did a good job going through material. Her office hours are amazing, she is so sweet, really knows how to explain specific concepts to you, and will work with you until you understand.

Professor Hurlocker is by far my favorite professor. She has an energy that radiates throughout the class and deeply cares about her students and their understanding of chemistry. Her lectures are typically a summary of the textbook, which can get boring at times, but she does problems in front of the class that really help to cement understanding.

Prof. Hurlocker is hard (but she's been getting easier) but SO worth it. Yes, she follows the textbook, but personally dont think that's bad at all. Her energy is infectious and she's super accommodating, approachable, and caring about her students' out-of-class wellbeing. Fav science teacher by far!

Her lectures restated what was in the book, which I found helpful. She is very organized & one of the only OChem profs who stuck to the syllabus. Her tests are tricky and hard, the averages were normally in the 65-75s. It was very hard to do well bc she expects you to know everything. She is a good lab prof but has VERY specific lab quizzes.

She is so cool and I really enjoyed HER, however her lectures were regurgitating the book and her expectations were not clear. I studied soo hard and always did meh on exams, which were difficult. She is great in office hours, but it was so hard to get a read on what to do for this class. She is a fun and helpful lab prof, but not great for lecture

Pears is the perfect Gov professor to take if you are an international student or don't know anything about American Politics. Her classes are mostly lecture and discussion based, but will sometimes throw in a cool activity. She is a normal grader- leaning more towards tough than lenient. There is a lot of reading so be prepared for that.

Prof Pears made a (somewhat) dry subject so interesting and fun. She's a great prof and a master at facilitating discussion. Really tough grader on papers, but also gives the most feedback on them that I've ever gotten. One of the best profs I've had in Claremont!

I loved Professor Pears' class. She is such an intelligent and inspiring professor. There is a lot of reading and you're expected to participate. She is very understanding, however, and helpful when writing papers. Her class was my favorite and extremely interesting. I highly recommend taking any of her courses.

I loved my government class with Professor Pears so much that I switched my major. Although she assigned a ton of reading, her class was so interesting and worth it. There are pop quizzes throughout the semester but she gives partial credit and is very lenient with grades as long as you do the reading and participate in class.

Professor Pears is really great! Super down to earth, really smart and nice. She really good at ensuring that class is always interesting, and wants to see you succeed in her class. I wish she taught more gov elective classes so I could take another class with her!

Professor Pears is a fantastic instructor. She makes her GOV20 class interesting by having it by discussion based, that way we really get to know what government is like rather than just learning a few definitions. She's super sweet and intelligent. The work is very manageable, as there's only 5 things in the gradebook. Overall, 100% recommend.

Literally my favorite class this semester. If you actually participate it can be hilarious, inspirational and awesome. Pretty good guy, but tough grader so just go meet with him. Would 100% take again.

Professor Antill was a great FHS teacher. Class was Faith and Reason and he really knew how to analyze religious arguments. Class was very thought provoking and interesting. No textbook only online readings too! Only criticism is he grades papers pretty tough and they are 90% of your grade and his grading scale isn't totally clear.

Truly one of the nicest profs you will ever have. Super understanding and is willing to retell you the material countless times until you really understand it. He is not really strict with attendance so feel free to miss some classes as long as you do the reading and contribute when you are in class. Will grant you extensions and grades generously

Some confusing and difficult readings for class, but he goes over them thoroughly and is very understanding and caring. Structure of his classes are discussion based and it helps to go over the homework in class for the midterms (2) and final (1 paper).

Terrible professor. Great person. I would invite him to my wedding, but I would not take his class again in my life. Discussions are not engaging in the slightest. Average 20 pages of reading a week with a reading response. If you can sit there, don't pay attention, then not feel bad, take this class. You'll be screwed for midterms and final.

Great professor! Would totally recommend for philosophy GE, especially for science majors/other non-majors. He doesn't give a crazy workload as-is, and he readily grants extensions without penalty. He is really easy to reach outside of class for help, but you probably won't find yourself needing it.
Don't plan on getting an A. This class goes well beyond the scope of an introductory biology course.

Tested vague concepts, often too difficult for the scope of an intro class (ex: had to memorize all the amino acid structures and groups). Focused only on specific topics rather than important concepts of Biology. Condescending and unapproachable outside of class. Terrible lecturer and often couldn't answer questions asked by students in class.

Unreasonable pacing with class material, easily 3 chapters ahead of other classes. Talked to Biochem prof and they didn't know why he was teaching some of things he did. Slides not nearly enough for review. Take only if you have time to invest.

Holt was a great lab professor, and a decent lecturer. He genuinely cares for his students and I found his office hours very helpful. However, I felt his slide content was insufficient to prepare for exams despite him saying so, and needed to refer to the textbook to fully understand the course, although I know other student who disagree with me.

The class was overall very interesting, however, she was not very good at explaining things in class and her tests were extremely hard. She gives a ton of homework outside of class and expects you to turn in grad student level work. Would not reccomend.

Prof. Chen is one of the most genuinely kind and caring professors at Keck! She starts off the semester trying her best to learn everyone's style of learning and often goes out of her way to cater to each unique learning style. She's intelligent and honest, and challenges her students in the best ways possible. Definitely loved her and her classes!

Class was pretty straight forward since a lot of non-science majors are in it. He's very caring and understanding, will know everyone's name. Heard he's a little tough with grading labs, but I did 't find that to be true for my group. Tests are pretty straightforward and information is taken from lectures.

Professor Shaar is fantastic. He is one of the most caring and inspirational professors at the school. He is clearly passionate about what he teaches, and his enthusiasm is easily transferred to the students. You can tell that Shaar really cares about everyone in the class, and he really wants everyone to succeed. Couldn't recommend him more.
Such an amazing professor! Loved the material and how he taught it. Such a nice professor, and extremely knowledgeable on the subject. Great class and would definitely take him again!

Shaar is one of the worst professors that I've had in the Claremont Colleges. The material he taught was not bad, but he could not teach it for his life. Also takes off unnecessary points and doesn't have a clear grading criteria. Final makes up your grade.

One of my favorite professors at CMC. Necessary to go to every class and pay attention because he gives detailed lectures, but he lets the class out early almost every time. He can be unorganized at times so make sure to ask for the printed lecture notes. He is very responsive to students, caring, and straight forward about test material

I have mixed feelings about Professor Shaar. While he is nice and he did get better throughout the semester, it was clear to me that to him teaching did not come first. There we classes where he would spend the entire class period trying to solve one example. On tests, he will take off around 2% of your final grade for one trivial mistake.

Professor Shaar is super nice and really want to help you out. He is not the best at explaining topics in class but if you go to office hours everything is explained very well. The midterms are straight forward, they are not to difficult and you know exactly what material will be tested.

Straightforward midterms and final. Tough grading especially for partial credit. Midterms and final questions have long and very tedious solutions so use a calculator, manage your time efficiently, doublecheck your calculations and go to office hours before exams.

Professor Shaar is nice and caring. He is accessible outside of class and clearly states some of the topics he will test you on. He always asks for students' input in an effort to be a better teacher. However, his grading is very detail oriented, so be extra careful with your calculations. Don't miss class, go to office hours and you will do well.

Prof Shaar really cares about his students and is always open to discussing the material at the end of class or in office hours. Even though a couple 20 point tests and a 40 point final make up majority of your grade, he shares the question topics prior to the test. He also even offered an extra credit opportunity to get a couple test points back.

In the words of a classmate: "Shaar is an innovator in how to badly teach a class." He just CAN'T teach. He can't explain topics well & blames it on students, he's forgetful and disorganized, and midterms can nuke your grade if you forget to study even one thing. I've never seen someone take an easy class and make it ridiculously hard.

Prof Shaar is nice, but he simply can't teach. He spends a huge amount of time showing us trivial calculations (and confuses himself while doing so), but spends no time on the actually important concepts. His classes are disorganized and the grading criteria is very unclear. Don't bother going to class, Google has taught me more than he has.

Just avoid him. Lectures never make sense. Huge calculation on exams with unfair grading. He uses his body to cover the broad when he explains problems. The whole class are constantly confused and he is arrogant if you ask him too many questions. It's a pity that a liberal art college has class like that.

Shaar is a nice guy, but he's not particularly good at explaining things and sometimes blames the class when his students don't understand the lecture. He also takes huge amounts off points of for small errors on tests. His class is frustrating, and I would not be surviving it if I didn't have a strong study group to work with.

Gave a 1 because the system doesn't allow for 0. Absolutely horrible as a professor: doesn't know her stuff, easily loses track of her teaching in class (multiple times over a semester), does zero prep for classes and let the students self-study and teach, no clear grading guidelines and very defensive when asked about her comments. Never take her!

Sara is wonderful. she's funny, knows the material so well, and is really understanding. Class is seminar, but she breaks for ath tea and over half of class time is activities so it doesn't feel long. Big on group work, even though there's only 1 group project. Very easy workload with short readings. Would recommend! I actually learned a lot
This professor was vague about grading and spent too much time talking about horses!
Horrible Professor. Avoid at all cost if you want to learn.

I think Prof Nagel is not a good communicator of science; I had a hard time understanding her vague examples and her lectures are mostly her reading the powerpoint slides. I don't recommend her but if you want an easy B without learning the material you might get away with her.
Bio 43 with Prof Nagel was really great. I 100% recommend you take her class if you are ready to work hard. She's so funny and is really smart. I learned so many fun facts in her class.

Prof Nagel was so excited to teach Bio of Cancer and really brought this enthusiasm to the classroom. She is super sweet and funny and makes hard topics much more approachable. She's also very down to earth and a great lecturer!

You can tell she has spent hundreds of hours setting up the structure of the class, making it very stressful on our end. We spend a lot of hours each week writing and working on reading responses. If you are just trying to get a GE fulfilled DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. There is a more than 40 double spaces written throughout the semester...for a GE

Very slow, boring lectures. The midterm was difficult and we were expected to remember small details from previous in class conversations, so if you missed a class you were at a serious disadvantage. The midterm essay prompt was also very poor. She is a nice person, but she does not inspire or teach at the level I expected.
Professor Wang is brilliant, young, and exciting. Refreshing at CMC. She's very open and gives specific and clear help. Classes entertained interesting ideas.

I learned a lot from Prof Wang; she is extremely knowledgeable about what she teaches. As an intro course, the grading was pretty formulaic. If you do the reading, you can easily do well. Her lectures were very informative and interesting enough to keep me engaged. She always came off as nervous when lecturing, but I think that's just how she is.

Chelsea is very good at facilitating discussion and all discussions are dependent on the readings. You can get by without reading however participation matters and she looks out for it, a lot. She grades your papers harshly, but if you make effort to improve she will recognize it.

I would highly recommend taking a class with Chelsea Wang! She is very accessible outside of class, extremely knowledgeable, cares about her students doing well, and values what everyone has to say. But note that her main focus in teaching history is on politics, treaties, and quotidian lifestyle and not on artistic/ cultural movements.

She'd make a phenomenal professor a few years from now. The effort she put into every class was obvious and she loved the material despite not being an expert. That said, her grading criteria was pretty hard to ace and were graded ridiculously harshly. It was impossible to score below a B and above an A-, no matter what you did.

Her pseudohistory class is phenomenal considering she only just got her pHD last year. She's good at facilitating discussions and making you think. The class touches a lot on methodology and its real world implications. She awards consistent effort, as there is hw due every week, but they're fairly simple and straightforward. It's easy to get an A.

I've learned more from him than any other professor in college. He makes you work, but you will feel like you actually learned something useful. He teaches you skills you will never forget. Mans is so smart. You won't regret his class.

He knows A LOT about his subject, and he is always willing to share more after class. Because his assignments aren't graded harshly, you can really focus on the material. If you do the readings and notes, there is a lot of homework, but most students learn to be pro-skim readers. But honestly, to make the most of the class, you have to read it all.

Professor Gilbert is a pretty chill individual. Her lectures might be a bit dense but nothing you can't handle. There is literally no homework but the exams are pretty though so if you study enough, this class should be a breeze

Personally I enjoyed her class. She was really helpful outside of class and would always go the extra way to help you understand a concept you didn't understand. Plus there's tons on extra credit literally like 10% of your final grade because she accepts tests corrections for partial credit. I would take her again.

Gilbert teaches at a turtle's pace; she doesn't seem to be able to answer any questions without consulting an answer key or lab manual. She gives no written feedback on lab reports, despite taking FOREVER to grade things. She is very nice, but that only gets you so far. Maybe she just needs more teaching experience, but for now, don't take her.

People often joke about easy professors who don't do anything, but this is taken to an entire other level. Gilbert's lectures don't properly cover the material at all. Class is easy, but you won't learn anything. I don't fear for my grade based on her performance, but because of her sheer incompetence in corrections, entering grades etc. Total joke

Gilbert cares a lot about her students, and you can tell. But she seems pretty disorganized and wasn't very clear about what she expects from us (which makes the tests difficult). However, she seems to be trying to improve the class, so hopefully next year she will have a better idea of how to teach.
her lectures are super confusing and expects students to retain a ridiculous amount of information for exams

Taking this class has been the worst decision of my college experience. prof gilbert doesn't lecture clearly, nothing makes sense when she talks. class is often spent doing absolutely nothing. there have been at least 7 times where i have sat in class for the full hour and 15 minutes and we go over absolutely nothing. don't take this class.

Extremely difficult class. He's new and it seems he was hired for research, not for teaching, because he does not know how to lecture. You will self teach yourself everything, and it will most likely not be enough, because his exams are all questions you have never seen before. Unless you love pain and suffering stay away from this class.
I don't recommend, he's not great. He's a new teacher and can be confusing to follow.
not great.

She's so mean! Racicot is not friendly or helpful in or outside of class. She contradicts herself all the time, and her grading isn't clear. She is vague, and seems really unconfident in her field. All this combined with her poor attitude doesn't make for a very good experience.

Easily the worst professor I've had at the 5Cs. Her tests are hard and she expects students to know a lot despite giving terrible lectures. Her grading criteria is unclear and she is not helpful in office hours. She generally is not a friendly professor. Do not take classes with her.

Professor Gillen's ECON125 was a hard class but he made it bearable, his tests are hard but he averages them out and wants to make sure you actually learn the material. Don't worry about the grade that much as he curves most his tests to a B+/A- average. The median grade from my year was an A- I believe.
Live Love Gillen. He made Metrics easy to understand. Lectures were a bit boring, but he tries. Go to his office hours and he's super helpful too. Super generous with grading, and he's hilarious!

Professor Gillen is so so smart, and genuinely cares about his students. Although he does use a lot of math and theory behind his econometrics, he also splits up class time to work tangibly on problems. He will also take time to answer any question during and outside of class.

Love Ben Gillen. This man is so funny (dressed up once to match his bitmoji), and the class grading criteria is pretty relaxed. More than anything he just wants you to learn, and won't make condescending remarks if you don't get something like some other profs. Such an awesome teacher. Lets you have a notes sheet to bring for the midterms too.

Gillen is knowledgeable in his field but is ineffective in teaching the class. He fails to explain econometrics outside of complex mathematical terms. His grading is forgivable and he gives a ton of credit for showing up and doing the work. I would have much rather been in a class that makes me work harder so that I understand the material.
Professor Wyman was kind and very understanding. The course was easy but interesting if you're like reading or creative writing. I would highly recommend taking her FWS class.

The readings were always interesting and discussions in class were very engaging. She responded to everyones comments about the readings and everyone was able to get a deeper understanding of every reading we talked about.

Open discussion classes, very reasonable paper lengths and prompts, lovely stories assigned. Prof. Wyman has an excellent understanding and knowledge of significance and context behind each story we read. Classes encouraged freedom of expression because Prof. W. listened, considered your idea, prompted class to respond and discuss before lecturing.

I enjoyed Prof. Naumov's game theory course, though the topics were a little scattered. He was helpful during office hours wrt the homework. However, exams were definitely much harder than the homework assigned and problems discussed in class. He usually made up for this by providing opportunities for extra credit. Overall, a good professor.

He is nitpicky and doesn't care about students. He can never wait to end classes early. Butchered students' names for an entire semester and didn't bother to ask them how to pronounce it. Flat out refuses to give points back when disputing grades even when the student is right. Refuses to bump a letter grade up when you're literally 0.1 away.

Literally the worst professor and class I've ever had. Lectures and notes are messy and confusing, and he can't explain the simplest of concepts. You learn nothing since the materials are actually middle school level easy (he taught us how to take standard deviations for 2 weeks). Did I mention he also gives zero care about students' well-beings?

Horrible professor! Professor Sarzynski doesn't know how to teach. Her grading isn't straight forward nor does she teach anything of use. Also, the amount of work assigned is absurd. STAY AWAY!!!! She seems like a great professor at first, but she slowly turns into a monster.

Prof. Sarzynski is an incredibly knowledgeable historian. The assignments are creative and well structured. She is always available and willing to help with the writing process during her office hours. You need to do your work. I enjoyed the class discussions.

Extremely unique and creative class where I really learned a lot! Sarah is very personable and caring! Readings aren't too heavy and movies are fun to watch! No pop quizzes, less than 10 forum posts, 2 average-sized papers, and one video final which was hard work but very fun and rewarding! Highly recommend for new way of thinking!

Prof. Wong is the BEST! She makes me want to major in math. She was always accessible and willing to help outside of class.
