Worst teacher that I have ever had. You can get a good grade, but he is incredibly unclear, and his lectures are horrible.

Although lectures were cryptic and I was honestly confused so many times throughout the semester, he was incredibly helpful. The exams are really easy and test only surface-level stuff; if you study his notes before them, you can do very well even if you generally don't attend class. If you want to properly hear his lectures, try to sit in front.

Lectures were relatively hard to follow, but he posts his lecture notes online so it's easy to pick up the material at your own pace. Tests were easy but homework sets were somewhat challenging. He is also very soft-spoken, so his lectures are hard to hear if you don't sit near the front. A great prof if you don't rely on lectures to learn

Great teacher as long as you go in with an open mind.  His lectures are very wordy but it helps a lot when looking over your notes. Its easy to get a B in this class but hard to get an A. Overall great teacher, he will even let you text him questions about the home work.

Professor Nelson's grading system makes it pretty easy to get a decent grade in his class. He basically whispers though so you need to sit in the very front to hear. He is very open to helping out during office hours.
He is a boss. Super nice, never needed to use textbook, didn't have to go to class, didn't pay attention just study for midterms and quizzes and do the little homework there is. Take his class!

Prof Nelson lectures quietly, and when he's sure of what he's talking about, lectures are interesting. He seems an extremely intelligent mathematician, but often makes mistakes in his lectures, and gets flustered, which can be  confusing if the mistake is not as simple or apparent to the students. Very helpful in office hours. Take Discrete Math.

LINEAR ALGEBRA-I very rarely went to class. I did all the homework. I showed up for the tests and put one night of studying in before each test. And I received a flat B. He reads off is lecture notes in class and then posts them online which is very helpful, but that makes it really hard to go to class. Moderately Easy plus lax attendance policy :)

Prof Sam is a great guy but his Calc II class is a lot harder than these ratings would have you believe.  HW and Quizzes were fine but exams were hard - mostly because you run out of time due to tedious algebra.  Sam also likes to give really easy example problems (like integrate x^2) and really difficult test problems, not cool.

Having a quiz every Friday was a bummer, but only one homework assignment is due each week, and if you paid attention at all, you can tell exactly what the one-question quiz will be.  Extremely helpful prof and a generous grading system.

Definitely one of the best professors I've had. His lectures may not make sense at first as he is fairly abstract, but utilizes enough examples to get one familiar with abstractions in math. Incredibly helpful and has been a resource beyond my enrollment in his class. Don't pass up a chance to take one of his classes.

Prof Nelson is the best math instructor I have ever had, bar none. I was not planning on studying math beyond Calc 2, but Professor Nelson's course was so interesting that I would now major in math if I could still change majors. He teaches math as an art rather than emphasize rote memorization. Take at least one class from him before graduation.

very nice and friendly guy! math has always been my least fav subject but he was super helpful in office hours. Drops you lowest grades on hw and quizzes, and the midterm/final are practically the same as the practice ones he provides. he's really enthusiastic abt his subject and i would def recommend taking his class
Overall a good class. Easy workload. I would recommend taking him.

Good professor, a little eclectic but super nice and caring guy. Tends to ramble but appreciates participation. If you're interested & want to put in the work, you'll get a lot out of it. if you don't want to, you'll probably still get a decent grade.

Only had two 20 page papers for semester. Long papers but if you read the articles on his list and ask for feedback before turning it in, he will read your paper and tell you what grade you would get.

Prof Lynch is good for Gov20. 3 midterms (45% total) and 2 papers (45%, 3rd paper is optional) and 10% for participation. He's a fair grader, and gives you feedback on papers if you send them to him before the deadline. Midterms are open-book, so you have to do the reading properly. Class can get repetitive but he takes attendance!

I took this class as a prerequisite for law classes, and this professor is great. I knew nothing about politics or government going into the class, but he truly helped everyone get on the same page. He lets you send him rough drafts of your papers before they are due and he gives great feedback. Tests are open book and open note on the computer.

I took Org. Health Care/Public Policy with Prof Lynch which was one of my favorite courses by far at CMC. Amazing guest speakers, fun class lectures, interesting discussion videos and open-minded discussions. Reasonable homework, only two papers throughout the course with clear grading criteria. Take this class and you won't regret it!

Professor Lynch was one of the best professors I have had at CMC in the GOV department. Very thoughtful and prompt feedback on papers and very accessible outside of class during office hours. Great class debates, discussions and reasonable work loads. Put in the work and you'll do great!
Don't take this class!

Be ready to have 3 midterms (45% total) and write a final paper (45%), besides contributing in class for a 10% participation grade. Lynch lectures heavily, so seize every opportunity you have to answer questions (which are typically on the reading materials due that day). Lynch's open-note midterms are hard, but he is available to help.

Juvenile delinquency is an interesting topic, but this course taught me nothing. It was mostly logic and people telling irrelevant personal stories. Grade is based only on two (annoying and long). It's an easy A and a seminar, but your time is better spent in other classes.

He talks for the entire 2.5 hours of each class (or sometimes shows dated documentaries). He throws ~300 readings at you at the beginning of class and isn't really clear about when/what to read. Your grade consists of 2 papers, one of which is supplemented by a debate, with an optional 3rd interview paper. Would not recommend.

Lectures during class, no need to pay attention or participate. Only assignments are two 20 page papers (but he actually wants 30+pgs- he cares about length and # of citations not quality) and 1 debate (on paper topic). No need to read, but helps with papers. Class could be much better, but hes an old guy stuck in his ways

He's a really accomplished figure in the political commentary world- multiple published books and appearances on TV shows. He will remind you of that a lot! But yes, listening to him lecture for 3 hours gets tedious, and the 20 page papers are daunting. The whole class is centered around 2 papers and a debate, and there's not too much participation

I've heard from some of the other students that they love the class, but I feel very differently. Professor can be very funny and interesting at times... but hearing him talk for 3 hours gets dull. Or even worse, him talking for 1 hour and then putting on a video with a "guest speaker" for the rest of class. I can watch CSPAN in my dorm room!

Prof Lynch is a baller! Class is really interesting, but the papers are killer. If you put in the time, though, you should do fine. Don't take this class if you procrastinate unless you are really good at cranking out 20 pagers.
Not difficult, but very interesting and enthusiastic. Always encites good discussion on important, real world topics.

Requires minimal reading and little class participation. The class is structured around Lynch talking for 3 hours. Grade is determined by 3 10 page papers - which are graded easily. Interesting class, but not particularly challenging.

Requires an average amount of reading, lectures are helpful but boring. However, they are interspersed with lots of movies! Class is all about the papers. All you have to do in the papers is hit every single point he wants and you get an A. It's quantity way over quality here.

While very smart - he fails to understand why students do not understand the material. He frequently says "it's easy, isn't it" when it is not easy at all. Students are lost in class and have to scramble for exams. He is a nice man but gives tough lectures.
Smart, but doesn't know how to teach. Asking questions in class or office hours didn't help me and I had to teach myself the whole class

This prof is so familiar of the complex topics that I feel he doesn't know how to explain these concepts to novices. In a class as technical as this one, it would have been helpful to understand the intuition behind things, or have more opportunities for exposure to problems outside of the exam and few textbook problems he recommends.
Good experiences! Three non cumulative test, with case and participation

The class was fast paced, dense, and very quantitative; he breezes over mathematical calculations perhaps bc he was a physics major but I had a really hard time with the math. Prof Yu is super nice and honestly a god when it comes to partial credit. I'd recommend his electives only to quant folks, though corp fin should be fine for anyone.

Took Corp Fin with him. The class is made up of case studies and exams. There is little guidance on the case studies as he wants you to sort off figure it yourself and then go over it. I found that while annoying, it was a good way to learn. Tests are challenging but if you do the practice problems you will be fine.
Fan Yu is a really nice person. Lectures were boring. Grade is based on tests and case studies. Tests and case studies were hard, much more difficult than the problems from lectures. Nice grader
Good lecturer and reasonable work load.

Prof. Martinez is the worst professor that I have had during my time at CMC and sent me into an existential crisis on multiple occasions. She taught less than half of the class (electing to call the CWPD consultant or guest speakers to talk to us or just playing a video). She does not teach and does not even understand her own schedule.

I love Professor Martinez. She is the nicest instructor I have had during my time in college. The topic of FWS was interesting, and she is clearly very passionate about the subject. She cares so much about her individual students. Class is difficult because she is a tough grader (she works in the CWPD), but you will learn a lot.

Evans is your best choice for Econ50. She's brilliant at teaching the concepts but needs to work on clarifying the applications of the material. 3 tests made up 60% of the grade - they were fast and difficult. Her class will set you up well if you want to major in econ. Attendance isn't taken but you need to go to do well. Go to her office hours!!

Professor Evans' classes are so engaging; she is the only prof I've ever had who could keep me awake for 7:30am classes. She is also really accommodating and caring. Her exams are hard and you need to study a lot to do well, but there are lots of opportunities to meet with her outside of class.

Econ 50 was a tough class, especially when it came to tests. However, Prof Evans was always very clear with her explanations and made herself very accessible outside of class (office hours). She is very nice and approachable. You have to work hard for a good grade but you definitely learn a lot.

Professor Evans really cares about her students. She is super accessible outside of class and a great person to just chat with or get econ help from. Her tests are definitely challenging, but she is fairly generous with practice problems. If you attend tutoring, you are basically guaranteed 100% on the homework. Assigns weekly pre-class quizzes.

Marie Evans is a very intelligent Professor and most her classes are lecture based (bearing in mind the large number of students in the class), however she will occasionally use Moblab to make class more interesting. She is really good at teaching, but her tests are really difficult so you have to really prepare well for them.

Professor Evans is definitely the #1 Econ 50 prof at the college for econ majors. She is detailed and rigorous, but manageable enough to work for it and pull a good grade. She is super kind and accessible in office hours, and works to make sure her students succeed. I really enjoyed my time with her.

Very difficult to get an straight A in. Some things on tests were harder or different than the homework problems and lecture notes. Class average going into final was a B- and 2nd test average was a 71% with no curve. Definitely need to study and do lots of practice problems for success.

Prof. Evans is AMAZING for Econ50. She explains the intuition behind concepts with a lot of clarity. Homework and practice problems support your learning. Tests are not easy but shes always willing to help in office hours and she gives you past exams to use for practice. Would definitely take a class with her again!

Mary is difficult but the BEST option for a freshman that wants to major in econ. Granted, other professors might be rumored to give you an easy A, but Mary will prepare you so well for a future in econ. Lectures are straightforward and organized and I struggled but I learned so much. Take this class if possible!

Prof Evans is a god! Prior to econ 50, I had never taken econ before. Her class was well-structured, entertaining, and engaging. Her homeworks can be tough because a lot of her notes is theory and not application, but the tutoring sessions are incredibly helpful. She is very approachable and helpful during office hours as well.

Prof Evans is AMAZING. ECON50 with her was always interesting and well structured. The class is very well organized and Prof Evans is quite accessible outside class. Tests were easy, but that isn't to say that you don't need to study. ECON50 was one of those interesting, enjoyable classes that I would definitely take again.

A lecture heavy course, but I think all Econ 50 courses are. I would say she is right down the middle in terms of difficulty. She teaches the material pretty well, and you will learn all the things you need to know out of Econ 50. Homework assignments are easy and a good chunk of your grade. Not an easy A, but not extremely difficul to  either.

Evan's Environmental Econ class is more economic math and theory based that I would have initially thought. Be prepared to use a good deal of micro and do homeworks that are fairly challenging. There are assigned readings but if you can BS the participation on them you should be okay. Tests aren't particularly hard but aren't easy.
The worst professor, or teacher for that matter, that I've ever had. Bust of a semester.

evans is definitely the bestlectures are super clear and hmexams are easy to handle if you review the lecture slides. Definitely take her as your intro prof. Can't even understand why there is someone thinking she is a bad prof...
First semester I took Econ 50 with Prof. Evans. She knows everything regarding the material. And she is always there for you.
She makes the boring textbook materials easy and interesting

Professor Evans is an extremely good professor. Her lecture notes are crystal clear and posted everyday before class, she is very organized. The homework assignments are totally reasonable and spaced out well. It is very easy to predict which questions will be on the midterms and she gives you ample materials to prepare for them. LOVE her
Her grading scale is a bit absurd, and the homework is poorly administered. Not a very helpful teacher at all. But overall, class could have been worse.
Amazing Prof. Her lectures are very clear and she follows the syllabus completely. Really good if you've never taken econ before. Extremely organized.
Really great prof for intro

Evans is THE professor for intro econ. Her lectures build on the book and are clear. Assessments(2 midterms, final, and occasional written and online homework) are more than reasonable. The textbook is online; lots of online practice. She's really sweet and approachable too.  Real-world application. If you try, you should at least get a B.

An absolutely amazing professor. She is super concise and crystal clear in classes, great use of powerpoint presentations, and homework sets really help you in unerstanding whats up in class. A great professor to take for intro, especially at this school where it seems everyone is an econ major and those who aren't are expected to catch up - fast.
Very nice tacher. Uses applia online for homeworks, slideshows for class, and tests aren't too hard if study what was said in class. Good teacher overall
Had her for econ 50. The nicest teacher I've ever had. She cares about her students and wants you to learn and enjoy the subject. I would absolutely recommend her.

Professor Evans is great! She is so helpful and really cares about the students. The class was fine, not particularly engaging, but I think it is the best econ 50 class available. I would definitely recommend taking her. She teaches using all powerpoint and class attendance is completely optional as well. Work load is reasonable.

I would recommend Prof. Evans for any class because of how clear, organized and helpful she is, but especially for environmental econ because of the optional (really) extra materials and readings she provided in an attempt to make the subject relevant. After four years, she is one of the most helpful, accessible and relevant profs I had. A JOY!
She's very organized and teaches very well.

One of the nicest profs I've had so far. Teaches lecture-style with powerpoint slides you can access on Sakai. Makes an effort to meet with students outside of class and make econ more relevant to life. I still hate econ, but love this prof.

Professor Ferguson is so accommodating, supportive and understanding. She wants all of her students to do well and it is not easy but if you put in the work and do homework you will succeed in her class. She is really accessible outside of class and encourages class participation.

Love love love Prof F!! My favorite freshman year professor! Honors history is a lot of reading and a long class period but she made the class go by fast! She cares so much about her students and makes everything relevant and exciting! Very important class for understanding modern day issues and stereotypes. Highly recommend any of her classes!

Shes really sweet and understanding. I loved having her as a professor. Her honors course has a lot of reading, but you only meet once a week so that was really nice. Her class is definitely one to take if you want to learn more about the topic she is teaching because in every class you reflect and think about things in ways you didnt before.

The most caring, kind, and considerate professor ever. I had a mid-semester crisis as a freshman, went to see her to discuss dropping the honors class, she gave me an extension on the paper and was very understanding and reassuring. She is knowledgeable & leads great discussions; her class gave me many new perspectives. However, be ready to READ!!!
Professional. Thorough. Good into to MENA studies course. One of the most genuine professors I ever had.

I cannot say enough good things about Prof Ferguson she is so knowledgable, kind, and poised.  I learned so much from her lectures which are content heavy but well focused and so interesting. I highly recommend going to talk with her for  papers. She is great at recommending sources and giving feedback. Overall a wonderful person. Take her class!!!

Ferguson is universally liked for a reason.  Not the BEST!!!!! teacher I've had, but good.  She plans the course to teach you things, not to give you a grade.  Easy to get an A or a B/B+.. she says so at the beginning.  Lots of readings.  A class where you get what you want out of it (get out what you put in).  Go to office hours for papers.

One of the best professors I've had in college. She's deeply passionate about her material and really wants to share it with you. Cares about her student's well being in and outside of class. I appreciate that she allows for students to work though ideas in the class together with her instead of a top down approach. Brilliant and wonderful. TAKE!!

Easily the most underrated professor at CMC. Brilliant, invested in her students' learning, understands how to ask questions and teach students without telling them. Class discussions could perhaps use a bit more intervention from her, so students expect greater rigor and think harder about the reading before showing up
Most talented history professor at CMC and nicest person on campus

Took her class completely on a whim because Islam/History has nothing to do with my major. I loved it! And I know that I loved it because she is so passionate about the subject matter which she teaches. She assigns a lot of reading but its worth it because the class is discussion based. She's a great professor and I highly recommend her

I had Professor Faldyn for lab so I'm not sure what he's like in lecture, but he was amazing for the Bio 44 lab - he was super helpful and friendly in class and always excited to listen to our presentations and give us feedback. He was also super flexible about deadlines and just created a warm, friendly environment.

I love prof faldyn! I had no experience coding in R before this class, but I never felt overwhelmed from unfamiliar material. He's very passionate and is a clear lecturer. His class was well-structured over zoom, with bi-weekly open note assessments and weekly coding problem sets in R. Though he gives a lot of work, it's not hard at all to do well!

Professor Faldyn is such a great bio stats professor and he really cares about helping his students be successful at what they are doing. He is very accessible outside of class and is happy to answer questions. His demonstrations in R are also super helpful. His class made me think about doing more in biostats
Prof Faldyn is so nice! He really loves biostats and wants his students to understand it and like it too! Very helpful with coding in R and gives great feedback for tests and projects.

Dr. Faldyn is a great knowledge professor and I really enjoyed the spring Science and The Environment course. The lectures are straight forward and study guides are provided before each test. Be prepared for quizzes but for my class we did many in class activities which counted as a quiz instead. Highly recommend any class with him!!

Dr Faldyn is one of the best Keck professors. He is extremely knowledgable, passionate, and accessible outside of class. He makes a strong effort to help his students thrive in his class. Lectures were extremely clear and interesting. I thought he provided great test prep material, as he uploads a detailed study guide before every test.
Prof Faldyn is young and energetic and brings that energy to the classroom. His quizzes are pretty straight forward but he doesn't provide very good test prep materials.

Take a class taught by Dr. B NEOW!!! She is such an amazing professor and will push you to think in new and different ways. Class discussions were always so insightful and overall, the class is very organized. You get so much out of the material! Dr. B is super accessible and cares about seeing her students improve & succeed.

Dr. B is a great professor. Her lectures are engaging and she will really push you to think in new ways. Pretty tough grading on papers and a lot of dense reading, but the content is interesting and very applicable to everyday life. She is also very approachable and willing to help you during office hours.
AWESOME intro class. Loved it so much. Inspired me to look into more philosophy.

This was my first philosophy class ever and I'm so thankful it was with Dr. B. You can tell she cares about her students' success and puts in so much effort into making her lectures fun, relatable and entertaining to help her students understand more difficult philosophical concepts. She is a phenomenal professor!! PS. Go to office hours!!
Such an amazing professor! She gives fun lectures and useful essay feedback. Levels can be tricky, so you should go to her office hours if you want to do well in her class.

Professor Toole (Dr. B) had an engaging, energizing, and fun class. There were readings due every class although many people got away without reading them. She offers lots of extra help during office hours which greatly helped me get a good grade. There were no tests/exams, but just writing. She also offers extra credit!

TAKE AS MANY CLASSES WITH GOULD AS YOU POSSIBLY CAN. I really thought that I didn't have what it takes to be an engineer because my grades were always bad, but Professor Gould literally was there for me every step of the way. Scot Gould is the GOAT. And you're gonna learn to use Maple for everything. Every class he teaches is lit.
Prof Gould is amazing!! You should take any class you can with him! He's fair and puts in a lot of time and energy for all his classes.
Prof Gould is the best!!! Would recommend taking any class he offers.

Professor Gould is straight up, 100%, the most amazing professor/teacher I have ever had. If you do not take his class you are missing out! After 3 classes from him and have gone from needing office hours everyday, to being able to do any homework problem on my own. His classes are difficult but he is there to help every step of of the way.
Prof Gould is an amazing teacher. His lectures are clear and he is always there to help. However, office hours are essential!! Problem sets and quizzes are tough but he will make sure you learn!
Really helpful during office hours

Professor Gould is very helpful, particularly when it comes to scheduling office hours and helping with homework and computer programming issues. However, he does tend to have his own little language which can be confusing. But he is easygoing and very willing to clear things up for students.

One of the best professors/teachers I've ever had - ever. He gives positive reinforcement and recognition where deserved, encouragement where needed, and has a sense of humor that keeps class and office hours entertaining. He's the best.
Fine

Best teacher I've had at CMC so far...really good instructor and great guy to get to know.  I didn't think Physics could be so fun, but I actually learned to enjoy it after my experience.  Professor Gould is a hard teacher with hard tests, but I don't think you can ask for an easy Physics test??

He grades on his own curve.  Although it is discouraging to see such low scores on the test, it's ok because his grading scale is so wacked.  It's really not as bad as it seems, and the take home, open-everything, test is a plus.

Professor Ferree is a super caring teacher and is passionate about biology. My only note would be he can be inconsistent/unclear in terms of his grading criteria. Overall great professor that made me love genetics.

He is a really nice man. Generally not the hardest class but it was often confusing as to what was expected. The class was a large lecture and sometimes it was hard to determine what was actually important to take notes on. He is what I see as the stereotypical college professor. Often the textbook was too hard / too in-depth and was not helpful.

Prof Ferree is very nice, but that doesn't mean he's a good prof. His lectures are very disorganized and his grading style is that he doesn't give feedback. He also doesn't believe in practice tests because he wants to be able to change up his style of assessment. He is unpredictable and can put students to sleep with his monotone voice.

I absolutely loved Professor Ferree!  He is the most genuine and caring professor I've ever had.  He loves getting feedback from students and is very accessible to help on any assignment or moral dilemma.  He gives take homes which eat up your entire weekend but he really makes you think and respects your ideas.  I would recommend him to anyone.
Dr. Ferree is an outstanding professor and is very well-respected. Expect to work hard but tests are fair.

Love this guy! Hands down my favorite professor here. I've taken three classes with him (intro bio, genetics and advanced genetics) and I'm really bummed  I can't take developmental bio with him. He is super clear, a great lecturer, gives amazing chalk talk, and his tests are really fair (fair, not easy!)
Really amazing professor. If you have a chance to take a class with him, do. Probably one of the best lecturers I've ever met, let alone at Keck.

Prof Ferree was awesome. He is the nicest guy ever and is always willing to help no matter what. Hes never condescending and is very easily approachable unlike many other science profs Ive had. He has take home exams that are challenging, but as long as you've put a lot of thought and details into them, you should be good. Take good lecture notes!

Doctor Ferree got some hate in the past...that was solely because he was a new teacher and not used to teaching. I have had him for 3 years and seen his progression in his teaching style.  This year he was the frickin bomb, take him!

He is super nice. He is very interested in his students doing well and will look at your grades specifically to give you what you deserve. He only tests you on what he talks about in class. I only read the book when I didn't understand something. He lecture are fairly clear, but his powerpoints are pointless. Helpful in office hours.

Prof Ferree is dedicated to his work- which is so nice as a student. You have to work hard in his class for it to go smoothly- but he puts in a lot of hard work too. Class was interesting and interactive and although it was pretty tough, I really enjoyed it.

Ferree is so interested in making sure that his students are enjoying the class and understanding the material. The material is hard, of course, but he really tries to make it better. Class discussions really helped me actually understand the material. He was more than prepared and could answer any question posed to him.
Lectures are dry, you need to read the textbook for the tests, but he takes attendance. Tests are very detail oriented. Not very helpful in office hours, but he is a nice guy. Not recommended.

Bana creates a great environment to learn French; she is super encouraging & makes everyone speak; lots of breakout rooms but I enjoyed getting to know my classmates. The homework is an online platform called Cengage, sometimes she'd assign SO MUCH... so get ready to spend forever on that. Nonetheless, she is everything you need in a language prof

oooof. ya no. I mean did I learn french? Sure! was it mentally exhausting, tear inducing, frustrating, and unmotivating but sure. After looking at these other reviews im thinking that this was just a zoom experience but wow. She was my least accessible, flexible, and helpful professor. A lot of this had to do with special covid circumstances but

I'm surprised Bana has so many good reviews. Maybe it's just Zoom, but she was very disorganized (repeatedly forgot about tests and rescheduled them to weeks we had other projects in her class due, didn't reply to messages, forgot to tell us about homework). She also has a "guess what I'm thinking" teaching style, which was annoying & unproductive.

Professor Dahi is undoubtedly one of the best teachers I've ever had. She creates a fantastic learning environment and encourages mistakes as learning opportunities rather than punishing students for them. I can't recommend her enough.

Exceptional professor. Even when we went on zoom, she still made huge efforts to keep the classroom experience alive, having us do engaging conversation questions with one another. Grammar is very important with her. You'll learn so much!
She assigned too much busywork and there were too many tests, but she's also the first French professor who I've had who has made her class interesting. I also learned a lot.
goat

Prof Dahi is a great professor who pushes her students to their limits. She cares a lot about her student and is willing to put in the time to help them out. Her lectures interesting and full of information. she does expect you to put in a good amount of effort in your work as she only wants you to understand french.

INSPIRING. Brilliant mind if you want to learn about classic liberalism. BUT... this guy has, for a lack of a better term, turned into ab bit of an "edge lord" recently. Be careful about bringing up center-to-left view point(s). Look him up on Facebook + his research and you'll understand.

Didn't enjoy this class v much... he complained about Chodosh & talked politics an unnecessarily annoying amount for a class where it wasn't super relevant; he either yell-lectured at the camera or we read aloud in class which made it pretty boring. Didn't follow the syllabus. I can see how he may be some peoples' vibe, but to each their own.
Extremely passionate about the subject which makes the class discussions interesting. Expects you to be engaged with the readings.

Well-respected prof at CMC. His classes are all lecture/discussion-based. He is very clear about each important topic and will go into extreme detail about them. He is very accessible outside of class and just wants the best for his students. Only complaint is that he tends to not stick to the agenda he gives to his students in the syllabus.
He is a smart guy and a great professional. Definitely recommended. Has vast knowledge about the subject, will aid you understand the notebook. Good feedback.

Awesome Professor with reasonable reading requirements and inspiring lectures. He is sometimes disorganized but is a very lenient and understanding grader. Reveals insights in books that you would have never found on your own. Take him if you have the chance.

Really smart and passionate about government but his class is the same (lecture) every day. Why have a class of 10 students if it's just a lecture? Tough grader and there are like 2 assignments the entire term other than reading, so it's hard to do well.

His ideas were absolutely very deep and interesting and he wants you to repeat them to him in exams.  He is chill and friendly , but might be a bit intimidating and even condescending when you argue with him.  Lectures can be a bit unorganized since he wants to tell you everything on his mind.  Piqued my interest in Government as a major.

A very intense teacher who is passionate about the subject and expects a lot from his students. Different from other GOV20's, involves a lot of reading/similar to political phil. Great teacher and class.
GREAT teacher! Always willing to help. Gives a fresh perspective to a gov class. Knows the material extremely well. Awesome teacher!

Incredible professor -- ridiculously smart and hilarious too. Gives almost all the help you'd ever need on papers or preparing for tests if you go to his office. Not a hard class in terms of workload or difficulty as long as you can keep up with his ideas. Undoubtedly would like to take more of his courses.
Prof. Areshidze is hilarious and the class (Religion and Humanity in the West) was really interesting without being too much work.
I loved the FHS I took with Prof Areshidze, Religion and Humanity in the West. He made me think about things I never considered. Our discussions in class were exciting and his lectures were engaging.

This is my second class with Areshedze. Very insightful lecturer, passionate about politics, young and energetic. During class he offers brilliant insight to the readings. One of the best profs I have had and will continue taking every class he offers. Midterms based off of class reading and a few short papers. Have learned a lot. Love his class

This class is a combination of stress and relaxation. The midterm and final were demanding (studying required) but we only had one short paper on top of the tests for the entire semester. Class readings are not too hard but you have to be ready for cold calls in class.

If you want an introduction to government his class is not ideal. However, if you have an interest in closely examining government from a fresh and illuminating perspective his class is unparallelled. There is a decent amount of reading but it is necessary to succeed in class. He asks a lot of students but his grading is also completely fair.
Take his class if you enjoy gov and are interested in seeing it in a different way. he's a really chill guy, which makes class more fun and easy to participate in

Lots of reading; it's not graded but it will help you a lot with the essays. Graded on two big essays,a final that is basically an essay, and participation/miscellaneous things. Michon is enthusiastic about the subject; classes were mainly him lecturing on whatever the topic was, sometimes derailing to answer a question. Low-stress, recommended.

Though I didn't find the FHS Religion & Modernity interesting, Michon is a brilliant professor and imparts you with a lot of knowledge in class. His readings are difficult and he's a tough grader, but he takes the time to meet with his students in pairs of 2 before essays. If you're interested in the course material, Michon is an excellent choice

Prof. Michon is an extremely kind and dedicated professor. Every class is a lecture because he has a very specific argument he wants you to understand. Also, he is extremely dedicated: he carefully formats readings for you. My only gripe is his grading scale: he argues grade inflation is a serious issue, so an A- is what an A is for other profs.
Best class I have taken so far. Will take one with him again for sure.

Looking back at my college career, this class was probably the most unrewarding class I've ever taken. I would suggest to look at different FHS courses; Michon is unreasonable with his grading (doesn't make any sense) because he is a name grader. His midterm exam was difficult as well, and his assignments are redundant and a waste of time.

His religion and modernity class is very interesting. He is very knowledgeable and dedicated. There is quite a lot of essays and readings but he helps you through it, and he always does one on one consultation before any essays are due. Overall, I recomend.

Michon teaches everything in Sanskrit so you have to learn another language while learning the material. he is super passionate about the material but does not teach it in an interesting or clear way at all. He's a nice guy but he makes learning about religion way more complicated & boring than it needs to be.

Professor Michon is a professor that you can just listen to talk for hours and hours without getting bored. he's so invested in what he's teaching and makes you want to go to class. He's not an easy grader but if you put in effort and go to his office hours, you arguments become better and you will do well. Take his class!!

I'm personally confused as to why Michon has a 2.8 in terms of difficulty. FHS010 was one of the most unrewarding classes I took because he essentially lectured the whole time and shut down anyone who had opposing opinions and thoughts. I thought the readings and content of the class was enjoyable, but keep in mind that he is a name-based grader.

At first I struggled A LOT in the class. But Prof. Michon is an AMAZING professor and each class it is just so interesting everything he teaches us & he makes it interesting. He is super nice, accommodating, & approachable. It is a decent amount of work for the class, but trust me, you get used to it quickly and grow so much from this class.

I took Religion and Modernity FHS. Michon is a great professor that really cares about his students. Going to his office hours really helps because if you get to know him he will really help you out. Doesn't make you buy any textbooks which is really nice. I am probably going to take another class from him.

Prof. Michon is such a great person. His knowledge about and passion for Hinduism is contagious, and he can make any lecture engaging and interesting. Class discussions are stimulating, grading is very fair, and it's clear that he cares a great deal about his students. So much respect for this man. Highly recommend!

Though not as prominent academically as some other religious studies teachers at CMC, Michon's passion and knowledge of the coursework made every class interesting and engaging. Was clear, open and honest in expectations from students and a fair, committed grader. Definitely take a Michon class for engaging discussions and a personalized experience

Best professor at the claremont colleges! Taught me more about a subject that I could have ever imagined. His class is organized perfectly and his lectures come together and connect in the most amazing way. Super passionate about what he teaches, and the class is very reasonable: substantial work, and if you do it well you'll get a good grade
Excellent and dedicated teacher. A fair grader and rewards students who work hard. Definitely take his class, I learned a lot in his class. His exams were fair too.
Prof. Michon is absolutely wonderful. Definitely take his class if you are interested in Hinduism or India in general...plus he teaches some sanskrit in his Hinduism class

Prof Michon is very enthusiastic about his subject, but the class commonly felt really long. Before every class we had to read around 40 pages and write a 300 word forum post. Other than that, there were only two papers and an essay.
No Comments
He really knows what he's talking about and works hard to help the students understand the material. The material covered was very interesting. Not too many assignments, some reading, and two tests.
The lectures are pretty boring but there isn't much homework or reading. Overall, its a very easy class. The labs are annoying but usually end early.

Prof is amazing. You can tell he is so passionate about his class and the subject he teaches which is awesome! The class is not content heavy and the exams were take home which was great. He may be picky grader at times but overall his grading is easier than most professor. It is hard to get into his class because he is a gem. Makes tome for you.

This prof is kind and genuinely cares about his students' education and what is in their best interest. The workload is very doable, and he is very receptive to feedback on his class and always allows for extensions. I learned a lot from this class, and the tests and quizzes were very fair. Class time was not stressful and was even fun at times.

Lars is such an incredible person and teacher. While exams are on the trickier side, he cares deeply about his student's success. He is so passionate and makes you love bio as much as him. He also does really awesome research that you will get to learn about.

One of the best profs at Keck! His lectures are really fun- you can tell how much he loves the subjects he teaches, and is really knowledgeable. The midterms are pretty memorization based. His lectures are the primary source of exam material with textbook for reference only. Definitely want to take more upper level courses with him teaching.

TAKE SENSORY EVOLUTION WITH THIS MAN. Best class I have ever taken. The class is basically an expansion of what he does his research on, so he's super into teaching it and offers a wealth of knowledge. No midterms - only take-home quizzes and a final paper for this class (not for all his others unfortunately) but great prof for ANY class!!!

We were graded on three papers, participation, and homework completion. The homework was very time-consuming with readings and hard to comprehend. I would take Kalb as a teacher again, but I would not take the South Asia topic of the class again because it was very confusing. I didn't learn much but I improved my writing.

Professor Kalb's Global South Asia class was the HIGHLIGHT of my semester. She really cares about your success and is very creative in her class structure (lots of in-class discussion and groupwork which helped in creating sense of community in an online class). Lots of reading, but it's def worth it! Can't wait to take another class with her soon!

Prof Kalb was the highlight of my semester, she's the best! She's extremely kind and you can tell she really cares for her students and the content she's teaching. Her class created the most amazing sense of community during the online semester and her readings always showed a unique perspective. Her essays can be tough but worth it!

Professor Koch is my favorite prof so far at CMC. Her lectures are engaging and interesting - really sparked my interest in foreign policy. Definitely need to work for a good grade, but it pays off well and she's super nice and gives great feedback

Professor Koch is an AMAZING teacher. There were many prerecorded lectures, but they were interesting and weren't too long like other professors. She assigned 6 papers of which we had to choose 4 which I thought was really considerate. I think that she truly cares about our wellbeing and wants students to get a good grasp of basic concepts.

A great professor and an even better person. AMAZING at facilitating discussion (even online!). She explains theory very clearly and uses lots of varied examples. She is explicit about her grading criteria and gives you specific, actionable feedback. Many components/assignments so there are lots of opportunities to improve your grade. Take her!

By far, the best teacher I have had at the 5Cs. Very knowledgeable, kind, and understanding. She is an excellent discussion facilitator and lecturer. Assignment expectations are clear and relate directly to course concepts. She is adept when it comes to virtual learning and makes an online class 100% worthwhile. Take a class with Prof. Koch.

Prof. Koch is the best professor I've had so far. Her lectures flow smoothly between students and teacher, and she strives to consider everyone's background/perspective on the material. There are no tests, and she's very clear with her rubric for the 2-3 pg papers. She assures us we only have to read the important bits of the readings. Love her!

Koch is incredibly intelligent. She's great at running class discussion and pulls the best out of students. I felt like I was part of the learning experience more than in any other class. Expectations for the papers are really clear and helped me reflect on the readings and the discussion to connect everything together. One of the best profs at CMC

Prof Koch has been my favorite prof I've had in college. She's so incredibly smart and passionate, but so willing to break down concepts for the class. She tends to structure her class mainly around class discussion, but when she lectures it's still amazing. Approachable & accessible during office hours and very clear about grading criteria

Professor Koch is not just a great teacher but also a great human being. My final semester in college went rough due to various personal reasons. At one point it seemed like I might not graduate on time. But Professor Koch taught me how to turn to brightest side even in the darkest of the days. When I will grow up, I want to be like Professor Koch!

Professor Koch is honestly one of the best professors I have ever had the privilege of taking in my life. She is incredibly knowledgeable, and makes her lectures extremely interesting. I had no complaints whatsoever with this class.

Intelligent. Seriously cares about her students. Fair grader and is very clear in terms of grading and expectations for her students. Super helpful during office hours! Also this sounds odd but I just can't help but envision her as this loving and motherly figure- simply the best! Would definitely take another class with her.

Easily one of the best professors I have had at CMC. Clear expectations, fair grader, and loves meeting with students in office hours. Just so understanding and really cares about her students. Asks good questions which foster great discussions.

I thought the class was fine overall. It was very lecture-heavy and not very engaging. The class also had a ton of reading and much of it was dry. Professor Appel is very nice and smart but I wouldn't recommend the class unless you're passionate about the material.

I love prof appel. She is so knowledgeable and a wonderful professor. You will learn so much in her class. Probs the most interesting intro level class for ir. Participation matters, tests and papers are graded very fairly
Solid teacher, not super engaging but not boring, and not very difficult, but requires effort.

Professor Appel is the best professor I've had at CMC. She is extremely passionate about political economy. Her class is not an easy class, and as a result, it is challenging, engaging, rewarding, and inspiring. If you want to actually learn a lot, take class with her, really any class. The work is manageable and none of it is busy work.
Awesome professor and she's very passionate about teaching!

Great lecturer. For the most part, mediocre discussion. If i could do it again, I'd take her Russian politics class (her passion and specialty) and take Gov 60 with someone else. That said, she was extremely fair and a very nice person.

Very disappointed in the class. Like an AP Comp Gov class. Couldn't answer basic questions. Frequently hadn't thought about issues raised by students. Tests were nitpicky and didn't test broad comprehension.

I did not enjoy her Gov 60 class. The class was discussion based and she had too much tolerance for mediocrity. She lets students ramble on and on who obviously haven't done the reading and are also off-topic. She didn't seem that knowledgeable herself about the topics we covered either. Decent class, not great.

One of my favorite professors at cmc- her lectures are so incredibly interesting and she is so nice!  She is a very smart woman and personally, a great role model.  She is fair, professional, intelligent, and passionate about what she teaches.  Her class was taught in lecture/discussion format, which kept the class interesting. Highly recommended!!

Don't let my ratings fool you; I thought she was a great prof. She wasn't a pushover like many of the profs here. Her assignments, reading, and grading were reasonable and interesting. Beware if you don't read: she calls on people that don't talk. She really nice and incredibly smart, though. Highly recommended!

Good lecturer. Clear on what you need to know. Was pregnant this semester and even showed up for last day even though she was already on maternity leave. Kudos. Earnest. I didn't like the choice of countries we studied though.

Probably the best lectures i've had on campus. She is incredibly sharp and on-point for every single class and doesn't waste student's time. She has no cult of personality like Pitney because her lectures are professional and she doesn't exactly ooze approachability. But she's entirely worth the effort of starting a cult, once you get to know her.
Great prof, knowledgeable, helpful, reasonable workload but fairly high expectations.
No Comments
Interesting material if you're into the poli-sci thing.
Great professor - I learned more from her class than almost any other.  Classes are interesting and engaging and the work load is reasonable.

Appel is great - one of the best profs I've had at CMC. The material is intersting, the class is rigorous and challenging, yet very rewarding. She is undeniably knowledgable and very intelligent. Her class is clearly structured and always informative.
Appel is a great prof.  Her lectures were very clear and interesting, and the class discussions were great.  Take her class.
she's demanding, methodical and uses her class time well. i recommend using her office hours to get the most out of the material and the class.

Hard class in terms of material and reading covered on exams. Alternating lectures and discussions, webct component, no long research papers. In writing, have an argument! Warmer as you get to know her better. Very brilliant, perky, but a bit intimidating at first. You'll learn, be prepared to work.

I found Professor Courser to be unreasonable. The grading criteria in the class were confusing and it felt like we were constantly held to different standards. The class was a ton of work and very stressful. I would not recommend.

Honestly, he can be an ass at times but he's a pretty good prof. Accessible, pretty fair in terms of grading, good at lecturing. His public policy class is a must take for those interested in policy--once you take it you'll know if you want to go into a policy career or not

You will like Prof. Courser if you like lectures and are more of an audio learner. I am a visual learner and have trouble taking notes & following what he is saying without graphics or words on the board so it is hard to follow and I feel like I want to fall asleep. The HW is reading for each class, we have big papers & a midterm & a final.

Professor Courser is quite knowledgeable about government and policy, making his class fun for any novice to amateur level political junky. The amount of reading assigned per class is fairly large, but it's also pretty easy to BS your way through with sparknotes or other summaries of the texts.

I have never had a bad experience with a CMC professor, but Courser was definitely an exception. Courser's lecture were incredibly dry and often revolved around him showing off about his education and experience. He also makes simple topics extremely intense. You will not get above a B on paper unless you agree 100% with his opinion.
A great choice for Gov 20. Covered U.S. politics historically as well as current political happenings. The classes are a good mix of lecture and discussion.
He is s good professor to take for GOV20. Not a bad grader.
he's kind of arrogant but if you go to class and deal with it you will do well. i didn't read anything but went to class and took good notes and pulled a B no problem

I have overall enjoyed almost everyone govt prof I have had. Courser is the exceptional. He managed to take a relatively interesting and simple topic and make it mind-numbing and more complex than necessary.He assumes that everyone has taken stats, when most of us had not. And using the stats was completely useless. WORST PROF EVER!!!!

He knows the topic amazingly well.  It's a tough class, but you will learn a lot and the readings alone are reason enough to take the course.  He is not very friendly, a tough grader, and it seems like he tries to make students feel inferior.  He's smug and arrogant and not that helpful if you don't get it right away, but he does know his stuff.
No Comments

A good teacher but he oozes grad school smugness and arrogance. Wants you to learn the material and is helpful but is inconsistent with grading papers. Not a bad intro class if you're reasonably intelligent

very knowledgeable. he assigns a lot of reading and he relies greatly on class participation, but will rarely call on students who don't volunteer. he may seem pompous at first, but warms-up through the semester. overall, if you pay attention you'll learn a lot.

(Really for Theoretical Mechanics) Assigned the entire issue of "Scientific American" in 2018 for space, time and what to do with them in anthropology for the gold/black issue, which they chose at my suggestion for colors TKO-ing the topic for planet earth. Also suggested the entire feminist issue following, + "Abraham Accords" with Trump. LLeight

I took his astronomy class and he gave very clear and funny lectures. He knows so much me and my friends called him God. He does grade based on tests so get ready to memorize facts. No math needed and he is very helpful during office hours.

Easily the most enjoyable class I've taken so far in college. Really funny and interesting guy (man-bun, what's up?). Though I would avoid him if you're not interested in physics as the class is tough and he may come across as being condescending. Gives a fair amount of easily graded homework, three midterms and one final.
I asked him what I could do to improve in his class and all he said was "do better on the next exam". Really? I thought I had to do worse to get a better grade.

Physics is hard. ...But Naftilan made it so much better than I imagined. He explains concepts clearly, has great stories, and is always there to help (plus, because it's such a tough class he's a pretty lenient grader so long as you're trying/turning in hw/improving). I could not recommend a physics prof more highly- TAKE HIS CLASS! :)
He was the bomb. Loved his class. Always helpful and clear and funny. Great Class

Tests consisted solely of material covered in class.  Took COPIOUS notes, but found the tests difficult (got low B's on both).  Thanks to labs, I ended up with an A.  He was genuinely interested in the material and helpful in office hours, but very hard to pin down a meeting time with.  Overall, he was an OK prof.

Intro astronomy is hard for a GE-exams are very curved. Really interesting though, and prof. naftilan is a riot. Lots is covered. even though attendance is not taken, I would go to class since I have missed it when what was discussed was an essay question.
Such a great professor. I had him for the Civ/Philosophy class and he blew us away. A really great lecturer.

He's awesome!  He makes class interesting with all sorts of random, funny stories about the various crazy scientists he's met in his lifetime.  He's also a great lecturer who knows his stuff and can explain it with all sorts of examples we, as non-scientists, can relate to.  His tests can be hard, b
Really funny guy...  :)
Prof. Naftilan = a mass of negative energy

Homeworks are hard, tedious, and weekly. What made the homeworks somewhat manageable was office hours and working on them with other students. But office hours were filled with more than half the class at times! Be prepared to spend 10-15 hours a week on his class. No easy A's until the final project which can boost your grade a bit.

Amazing Probability Theory prof. Super clear and approachable, was really helpful in office hours. Homework was not overwhelming and exams were fair. Did an excellent job of doing the course online (had the official textbook and a supplemental one made just for us -- all free). Highly recommended!

Professor did an amazing job adapting his class to an online format while classes were forced to be remote because of the pandemic. He even went so far as to build a website for the class that includes the important pieces of material from a textbook that he wrote on probability! I recommend that you take a math class with him before graduating.
Huber is the gem of the CMC math department. Its clear that he is very knowledgeable on all the subjects he teaches and has provides a ton of examples so you can understand the material.

Prof. Huber is an awesome DS prof! He introduced me to CS, and I wouldn't have wanted any other prof. It's a difficult class by all means, but he guides you through and ensures that you learn the material properly. He's always available for extra help, and he's hilarious too!

Great Prof & not an easy class for me. The test really DEPENDS on students, WORTH to try!!!! I did not do well in the class but if you are choosing a course among professors you don't know, take him!!!

I had difficulty understanding the material at times but eventually did after putting in the work. His lectures were pretty much the same as his lecture notes, so what I would do was try to absorb as much as possible during lecture, carefully read the lecture notes, then go to office hours to ask questions. This worked well for me.

The class is really difficult if you don't intuitively understand the material, because he understands it very well and assumes you do too. You have to really work to stay on top of the material covered in lecture or else you will get lost very fast. He's also not the most helpful guy in his office hours.

Mark Huber is a great prof if you know all the material already. If you don't, DO NOT TAKE HIM. He's a great guy outside of class, but he's an awful professor. His class convinced me that I don't want to do a math major. I used to be good at math before I took his class. He made me hate it.

Huber rounded a 92.9% down to an A-, really not fair. He also doesent include participation points. He makes blatant errors in the lecture notes, so I am sure he graded the finals slopely and cheated some students out of points.

Awesome dude. Really wants to help his students learn the material and has a true passion for mathematics. Extremely helpful during office hours - make sure to take advantage. Tests were very manageable. Go to class, do the homework, and study for tests and you will get the grade you want. By far the best math professor I've ever had.

Very clear lectures. Problem solving and technique focus rather than theory focus- he often glosses or omits proofs of the algorithms he teaches you. This prepares students well for the actuarial exams or other tests, but those looking for purer math might want more. Never uses the text book.

HUBER IS AMAZING. LOVE THIS MAN. Incredibly helpful and approachable at office hours - take advantage of it for homework. Super smart, will explain things until you get it, the tests are very manageable - he lets you bring in equation/example sheets. He also adds a very generous curve at the end. Favorite class this semester - Huber is the best!!!

Great professor. Lectures are interesting and concepts explained well. Problem sets are difficult but he will walk you through every problem in office hours. One of the best Professors I've had at CMC

Excellent Prof  I took two courses from him and learned lots, but as often happens, the relationship and care are what I remember most fondly. That said, I did learn a huge amounthe selects cutting-edge texts but it still feels canonical. Cant recommend enough!

Professor Morrison gives great writing advice and guidance. His film choices for the class are engaging and the workload is reasonable. However, he loves to monologue. Class is usually extremely boring and unengaging. If you like to participate in class discussions and learn from your classmates, chose a different class.

Professor Morrison knows so much about film and is clearly so passionate. He's really great at moderating discussion and gives really insightful, timely feedback. He's just a joy to be around and every class feels really productive and fun. One of my favorite professors I've had!

How can you not love this man? He cracks up at horror movies that most people think are really scary. He also is always smiling and his energy is infectious. Oh, and he's super knowledgable about all things film and does a great job of balancing his own views with student insights and class discussion. Highly recommend him.

Such a sweet man! Made film theory interesting and accessible in his Intro to Film summer class. Because it was summer, it was a small evening class and relatively quiet. I imagine in the regular semester his classes are more lively. Would recommend!

Prof. Morrison is a ray of sunshine. Always giggling and very understanding/helpful. While lectures could feel long, the information was always relevant and helpful. Got a B+ on my first paper, followed all of his advice/suggestions and got an A on my second. 1 movie a week, 3 short responses and 3 longer essays. Super manageable and fun!!

Prof Morrison is such a lovely guy, he is organized, funny, and clearly passionate about film theory. I am a CS major and am considering switching to media studies because I've enjoyed learning about film so much. He will read your drafts and give you feedback and makes paper prompts very open ended.

Jim Morrison is the man! Very kind, funny, entertaining, and class material is interesting with great film choices. Discussion is great, esp. because the man is so giggly and joyous that he makes himself laugh during lecture. He's a joy-- doesn't grade tough much and I can't recommend enough.

I LOVE HIM. Bio major, but had him for my FWS and took him again for my Lit GE (U.S. Gay & Lesbian Film) because he is so amazing. Nicest guy, knows a lot about both film and literature, and will read entire draft(s) of your essays to give feedback before you hand them in. Almost switched my major after taking his classes, I loved them so much.

Professor Morrison is awesome and one of the best professors I have had at CMC. His lectures are interesting and cover material that many students have not read/watched. He encourages you to express your opinion and think outside the box. The essays are not too bad and honestly your writing will improve so much.

Professor Morrison was my FWS professor and he was absolutely AWESOME. I loved his class. It was the first class at CMC where the time flew by. There was not a lot of reading and some of the films we watched were really interesting. Not a difficult class, would definitely recommend.

Prof Morrison is one of the worst professors I have ever taken at CMC. His lectures are brutally boring and he talks too much. I didn't learn anything new from his FWS class. Although I did comparatively well in the class, his grading standards are absurd and you don't know why you diddidn't do well. Avoid at all cost.

FWS 10: Literature and Film:I loved this class! The course material was super interesting--we got to see and write essays on the Shawshank Redemption, and if you follow his guidelines, you will DEFINITELY GET AN A! Im not a lit major, but I am taking another class with him some time soon!
This Professor won't actually listen to what you are saying. He'll want to control your decisions and will not respect your opinion. Do not take him.

Professor Morrison is fantastic. He expects well written papers but he practically spells out the information you need in class and on his prompt sheets. His classes will improve your writing abilities and deeply improve your knowledge of film and literature. Do the reading, take good notes and you'll be fine.

He is a great professor, and definitely knows a lot about film history. He is a hard grader, but only because he wants you to learn about the topics in depth. The films are great, and doesn't matter what major you are, take his class! However, there is a lot of reading but it's worth it in the end.

worst class ever.he only cared about his teaching his writing style and only graded papers based on if they followed his rules, he didnt care about content at all.he lectures all class and is a pushover with obvious favorites.good books but not worth his useless lectures and painful grading
Nice guy, helpful during office hrs. Though, fairly tough grader and graded only on how you wrote things, not what you said. (which I and others didn't like)

Really interesting and helpful professor who helped me a lot with my writing skills. I would definitely take another class with him. He is laid back within reason, but he is not a particularly easy essay grader. His office hours were very helpful for me.
Very nice guy and really knows his stuff. Such an interesting class! Quite a lot of reading and not very easy a grader, but Morrison is well worth taking.

Don't think online was Terril's forte. He's nice but a bit bumbling. Disorganized with time lines (which was tough in a journalism class where deadlines are usually emphasized). Tries to help: good feedback on papers (not very timely though) and flexible with circumstances. Great intro to journalism; don't be intimated if you have no experience.
He's the nicest guy you'll ever meet. You can ask him for advice about anything, and he'll try his best to help you. He'll always make time for students no matter when!

Such a great guy. Please take his class, get to know him, and be grateful for how dedicated he is to his students. He's had decades of field experience, and has great stories to tell. Inspiring, intelligent, and a wealth of knowledge.

Terril is the most hands-on teacher I've ever had. Classes are full of anecdotes from his 20+ years of experience as a journalist, amazing guest lecturers and the AP Stylebook. I've never met someone so committed to helping his students succeed and grow. If CMC does not hire him on in full capacity it will be a great loss for all students.

Terril is one of the best teachers (refuses to be called a professor) I've had in my educational career. He's truly willing to go above and beyond for his students. International Journalism with him was both informative and a great deal of fun. CMC needs to get on hiring him in a permanent way. Everyone needs the Terril experience.
just don't forget your thumbdrive!

I cannot possibly put into words how fantastic a professor that Bassam is. My favorite professor of ALL TIME and not even an Arabic major The only caveat is that he has very high expectations of all his students. But if you are passionate, the man has seemingly infinite time, capacity, and desire to guide you in learning this awesome language.
this man is truly everything. one of the nicest people out there who actually cares and all that. he wants to see you succeed!!!!!!!!!

Bassam is the best professor to learn Arabic from. He really wants his students to learn Arabic and enjoy learning it. Being a difficult language, Arabic requires a lot of work outside of class, but it is truly worth it!

So amazing so fun. He loves teaching, loves students. Laugh with him, make him feel like you value learning Arabic which you for sure should if you're taking it. I adore him. Yeah obviously it's kinda hard, it's learning a language with a diff alphabet from scratch. But so rewarding!!!! There is no one I would rather see 5 times a week and MORE!!!!
Simply the greatest teacher of all time

Bassam, as we call him, is a phenomenal professor, and I feel so lucky to have had the chance to learn from him. He is a true scholar of Arabic, and even wrote the textbook that we use in class. He is so kind and funny, and is a constant source of support and encouragement for his students. Definitely a lot of work, but I learned so much!

Bassam made me feel like our class is really a family. He's one of the funniest, kindest, and sweetest teachers I've ever had, though his class can be a little chaotic or confusing at times. Arabic is a really challenging language, but nobody loves the subject more than him. Be sure to take advantage of the tutoring hours outside of class.
Bassam is a fantastic professor. Arabic is hard, and he tells you this right off the bat, but if you are dedicated, you will learn a ton in this class and succeed.

What a professor Bassam is. I challenge anyone to someone better anywhere. He's the most passionate guy around and he genuinely (seriously!) cares about his students.  And he's a brilliant and respected scholar too. The course is pretty hard but courses like this are honestly why you even come to college.
Amazing professor. Loves the language more than anyone I've ever met, and will bend over backward to make you love it too!

Great Professor! He is makes the language accessible by presenting culture as well as vocab and grammar. I def recommend this course to all CMCers! He is an amazing prof with tons of connections. He def knows how to take care of his students.

FWS American Dreams with Prof Crockett was very manageable, though she did say that she was more lenient since it was an online class during Covid. We had 3 straightforward essays, a fun website project, and some easy homework assignments. Prof C is very caring and makes the class interesting, so I highly recommend her! Workload is not bad at all.

Professor Crockett is very caring and understanding, on top of being extremely helpful and passionate about helping her students learn and grow. She is a tough grader but she makes her expectations very clear and offers to give you feedback on drafts before submitting the final draft. Her feedback is very useful. Truly an amazing prof.

PHENOMENAL!!! Professor Crockett is so encouraging and truly believes everyone is a writer. Helped me overcome my writing insecurities and facilitated class discussions excellently. Some of her insights opened my eyes to the world. Grading criteria is fair and reasonable. Loved every minute I was in class - I'd retake it over and over if I could.
I could not run out of nice things to say about Christine Crockett. I am a student with disabilities, and she did a fantastic job of pushing me to do my best.

She really grew on me throughout the year. Her feedback on essays is so, so helpful and she good at running class discussions/helping them along. Each time I went into office hours she was willing to sit down with me and try to help me as best as she could. She expects a fair amount from her students, but in a refreshing way.

Professor Crockett tells you exactly what she wants. If you're not willing to follow her rules exactly as she defines them, then you will not succeed in her class. If you do everything she asks (the workload is demanding, but manageable) then she will adore you and you will have no problems with the class.

Adored Professor Crockett. She chose interesting readings, and I looked forward to the class everyday (even though it was at 8:30 AM!) I have rarely had a professor so invested in my learning. She made me feel confident about my writing, was extremely helpful in and out of class, and was very encouraging. Highly recommend her!

FWS - The American Dream. Love her. Very interested in getting students engaged. Assigns very interesting texts. Three papers in the semester, she's a tough grader but it is a writing seminar after all.

Professor Crockett is a wonderful professor. She is the head of the Center for Writing and greatly works to improve writing and analytical skills. The texts she chooses are very interesting. She individually sits down with you to go over papers and truly cares about how her students do in the class. STRONGLY RECOMMENDED.

Prof. Olfati is probably the best professor I have had in College. She teaches almost entirely through lectures that are well developed, easy to understand, and are structured in a way that is easy to take notes. There are VERY easy tests every week that she warns you exactly what will be on all test, midterms and finals. Best econ proffesor!

Love Professor Olfati - she's very nice. I have heard she has gotten more difficult lately. I found her tests and problem sets to be difficult, but I do not believe that was due to an issue with her teaching. The class is very lecture heavy - zoning out for a minute or two can be fatal. What she requires is reasonable. Econ at CMC is generally hard

This class was fairly straightforward, but since 3 non-cumulative exams were each 30% of your grade, messing up on an exam would cost you a lot. Like in Econ 50, Olfati tells you exactly what questions will be on the exams, so as long as you know how to do those, you will do very well. There are literally zero curveballs. She is also funny!

I found her class pretty easy. We had lectures, a very thorough review session before each exam (she tells you what short answer questions will be on the exam & the numbers are different but the question is exactly the same), and some really easy quizzes over definitions. Although the class was very easy, I learned a lot and would recommend her!

Professor Olfati is great, you can tell she is a mom because she is very caring. She is understanding and accommodating but her Econ 101 tests were very difficult (it was hard to finish all of the questions under the time constraint). She explains exam content really well and prepares you well for exams. I would definitely take her class again.

Very easy intro economics class. Not a lot of work and the tests are really straightforward, basically just the problem sets she gave but with different numbers. Prof. Olfati is also unintentionally funny but she does lecture in a monotonal voice. Easy A for econ GE

This class was by no means an easy Ayou have to work pretty hard and seeking extra support. Tutoring sessions made it easy to complete the homework, but the midterm and final felt pretty different from the theory-heavy lectures and homework problems. If you're an econ major looking to build fundamentals for future classes, definitely avoid.

This class was definitely challenging. In order to do well, you need to do the reading, attend tutoring, and visit office hours. If you put in the work you will succeed, but don't take this as an easy A. Professor Olfati was helpful and wants her students to do well. The class was very test-heavy, which did not match well with my learning style.
Funny lectures, super sweet and accessible during office hours, really wants her students to do well. Spells out the exam questions before each midterm and final.

Extremely straightforward quizzes and tests. Do the suggested questions and you're guaranteed a 100 in every quiz. Midterms are easy enough if you study exactly what she tells you to and go by the checklist provided. Good class for a solid A and a good ECON50 foundation.

Saman is the best econ teacher- she very clearly details exactly what will be on the exams. The only other grading criteria are quizzes. She tells you which questions from the book might be on them so you just have to make sure you know how to do those same exact problems (to get the answers you have to go to tutoring but there are only 6 or so).

Very interesting class from which I learned a lot especially because I didn't have an Econ background. Olfati is funny and makes the material as interesting as possible but it is Econ and you can expect a few long boring problem sets in lectures. Very difficult to get an A because she insists only 95%+ receive A's and not 93%+. Quizzes are a breeze

Professor Olfati is a great professor and person! She is extremely helpful and taught the subject very thoroughly. Going in, I had no prior background in economics, but she really gave me a great overview. I got an A, but was on top of all the assignments, read ahead, and went to office hours. The midterms and final are a HUGE part of the grade.

Didn't take her own subject too seriously, made the workload easy to handle, gave quizzes instead of homework, very clear about what was expected, tests were fair, she's quite funny during lecture. Doesn't really inspire you to want to take econ unless you're already headed that way, so good for STEM majors just looking to fulfil a GE.
Reteaches you out of assigned textbook reading. If you learn well like that, great. If not, you're going to be teaching yourself the material.

Great prof! His class was one of the toughest I had to take for my major, but he made himself available outside of class for office hours and even set up additional workshops where we could do problems together/ask questions about the HW. Tests were tough, but cheat sheets were allowed.

I think Wells had a rough start to teaching and rubbed people the wrong way. I also think that people don't like physics and take it out on him. I honestly believe he was one of the best professors in the department. He gives lots of homework, but you end up really understanding physics out of it. I highly recommend him. He's a very good teacher.

Very challenging class and requires a lot of outside class time. The lectures in class are very hard to follow and I spent most of the classes just waiting for the two hours to be over.
