Locke is phenomenal. I took his Honors Philosophy class as a GE and loved it! Readings are short, and the class is almost completely discussion based after the first 2 weeks. You will LEARN how to write. If you go to office hours for your papers and learn from your mistakes, you will do well.

He is so wonderful! The class is a lot of very interesting discussion and he is willing to explain things until they make sense to everyone. The essays are tough but if you go to office hours and ask questions he is more than willing to help. By far my favorite professor.

Being in Locke's class was great. Class is heavily discussion based. The course is tough but Professor Locke is always available during office hours and there is often a long line waiting. He gives useful feedback and great guidance on how to write your papers

Locke is one of my favorite teachers at CMC. He tried out a funky grading style on our class which required a lot of work, but my writing has improved exponentially as a result. He'll talk you through the entire paper if you're having trouble writing it too.  He's great in class too, he's funny and brilliant. Highly recommend!

The man is extraordinarily intelligent.  He is clear, concise, and demands the same from his students.  He is arrogant, which is off-putting at the start, but becomes a unique addition that makes him memorable.  Great teacher, if you wish to learn how to write, take him and go to office hours religiously to work on your papers

Professor Locke is an EXCELLENT professor - one of the best I've had at CMC. His classes are certainly difficult but worthwhile. He grades you hard throughout the semester to push you, but his final grades are very generous. If you actually want to learn something and improve, take his class.

Prof. Locke is great. He is a terrific philosophy teacher -- he really cares that you learn and that you understand what's going on. His "coach" attitude towards philosophy is helpful for non-majors. He's funny and acerbic, which makes classes fun. No, he's not that easy, but if you were looking to coast thru college, you would have gone to Pomona.

As a Government major w/ only 2 prior Phil classes (Intro and Logic), I found Locke's class incredibly accessible, interesting and worthwhile. Locke is one of the best professors I've ever had when it comes to explaining complicated arguments and responding to student objections. Take his classes if you want to excercise your mind.

Professor Locke is an amazing Professor.  It is true that he has high expectations but his goal is not to weed people out of his class.  He genuinely loos for the best in his students and helps you to understand your strengths as well.  He is also really entertaining.  I never missed class once because I would rather be there than not.

I actually really enjoyed this class. I thought the discussions topics were extremely interesting and challenging. He is definitely a hard grader though but very willing to help during office hours. I took this class as a GE and I don't regret it at all.

Before taking his class I was considering majoring in PPE. After experiencing this class for 3 weeks, I was really turned off of Philosophy. His grading style is unreasonable, and he expects you to be top rate philosophers in everyday class discussion.

Professor Locke is way too focused on weeding out the non philosophy majors. And because of this, he makes his class extremely difficult, nearly impossible, to do well in.Expectations are way too high! He can be interesting from time to time though, but DO NOT take him to fulfill a GE. BE CAUTIOUS.

Locke is the worst professor I've ever had at CMC.  He doesn't like to help students, and he will kick you out of office hours if he's sick of helping you.  The only reason I attended class was because 30% of the grade was based on participation... and because he's attractive.  Even still, I don't recommend his class to anyone.

Professor Locke has unreasonable expectations.  This class is intentionally designed to weed out non-Philosophy majors, and it discourages those who are considering.  Most of the readings are interesting but his "I'm always right" attitude and unwillingness to help students understand makes the class miserable.  Don't take his class as a GE.

Locke is a difficult professor but totally worth it. He is really dedicated to his students and really good in office hours. He expects a lot, but if you're interested in Philosophy he's awesome. Also, extremely clear when you see him during office hours.

Locke is super hard. The class moves very fast and he thinks that everyone is keeping up when in reality only a few are. Can be condescending and slightly rude. Absences result in a lowered grade. Hard grader, high expectations, do not recommend unless you're a philosophy major or are very interested in philosophy.
Cool guy, but relies too heavily on philisophical theories and less on inspire though which makes the essays hard.

Class is easy, with very little homework. She does not teach one bit though. Basically, has us read over a new topic at night, we do the homework, and she tells us if our answers are correct or not. Doesn't explain or teach it at all which is very tough at times. Also said the class never did good on tests but never had a curve.

This was my 6th year of Spanish and Professor Altamirano was the best Spanish teacher I've ever had by a lot. She's super chill and is really clear about what will be on exams. Can't recommend her enough!

Learning is done ONLY for homework and is barely reviewed in class which is not only not accessible for a lot of students, but also leaves every student in a different spot. Most of the time, when she handed back exams she would casually mention that a good percentage of the class got a C or D but would not curve.

Prof Altamirano is the best professor I've had at the 5Cs. I learned so much about Spanish and the workload was pretty light. Her classes are so fun and she is an absolute joy to talk to (not just about Spanish but anything). I can't recommend her enough!

This class helped strengthen my grammar skills, and I'm glad that we also learned more about Spain + Latin American culture. At times, she went a little quickly over the material, but she was accessible after class and during office hours if you had questions. She thoughtfully listened to each student during discussions, and was understanding.

I loved Altamirano's class. She is so funny and knowledgeable. You can tell she cares about her students a lot. And she is great at explaining grammar concepts and making it accessible to every student. Plus, her study guides are comprehensive and prepare you well for tests. Definitely take her classes!

I enjoyed taking Professor Altamirano's Spanish 44 class. It wasn't a difficult or stressful course, but I saw my Spanish significantly improve. I am now a more confident speaker, and my grammar is much better.

Great readings from different Spanish-speaking cultures. Shares such insightful thoughts! Speaks only in Spanish and is easy to understand. The class was way easier than my AP class and I didn't feel like I gained knowledge of the language. Tests aren't easy tho she makes sure u really got the readings, but fair-only answer 5/7 Qs. We watch movies!

I adore Altamirano. Her class is so fun and she talks a lot about life, the campuses, and real world events. 44 had great readings that were actually educational AND interesting. Lots of movies in class and a field trip. Very light on grammar hw/in class, but is on tests. Very easy/manageable

Altamirano is a fair grader who really cares about her students. She's clear about her expectations for each assignment/test, and she always encourages students to meet with her or ask questions if they're having trouble understanding a concept. She's a wealth of info about the 5Cs & always tells hilarious stories about previous students. Take her!

Professor Altamirano is really nice and class is always engaging. We do a lot of fun activities and have many interesting conversations. She is a lenient grader and her tests are fair. She wants students to do well and she is good at breaking down grammar rules to help us learn them better.

I love her! The hw was pretty easy & light, class was always interesting interactive activities, and she has hilarious anecdotes for everything. 1 project per semester, 3 essays, 2 tests, & a final. Grades nicely. You can do office hours anytime over the phone. She's a very lively person who conveys grammar well and with fun methods. 10/10
Prof Altamirano is awesome! I never thought I would enjoy a spanish class. The conversation questions are fun and she really relates to students. Take 33 with Altamirano!!!
Professor Altamirano is fine. The class isn't difficult but make sure to talk. She loves it when students participate.

Let me just say, I loved Altamirano's 44 class. She's an awesome (young) professor who can really relate to students. She knows what she's doing and is definitely there for you if you go into office hours. Altamirano makes the class fun and interesting for the students. Made me want to be a Spanish dualno one else can compare! Love her!
Great teacher makes subject material very interesting not a walk in the park though definitely need to put in the work to get the grade but her expectations are very clear.

Spanish 44 is my favorite and easiest class. The HW is soooo minimal (basically a few shortinteresting articles and a tiny grammar exercise). She makes you speak a lot but it's chill; we do fun stuff like go get tacos and watch documentaries. She is HILARIOUS and simply awesome. Take 44 with Alta-babe and you won't regret it!!

She is awesome! Very helpful, assigns a reasonable amount of work, and spends a lot of time on actual skills such as speaking and listening. Take her Spanish 33 class, you learn a to without it being too hard.
The topics we discussed and readings were always super interesting but we spent barely any time on grammar and I felt like my skills slipped a lot this semester.
Great!

Altamirano is AWESOME. She is very interested in the topic. She takes class feedback really seriously and is always improving her syllabus. She lets you pick your own due dates for papers and she's always ready to help you. Lots of discussion in her classes.
Great professor, not too hard.

Super nice, tries to pick interesting readings-semester is split up into short works, poetry, then plays. Homework is basically mandatory-she collects it. Class follows the same schedule mostly of discussing the reading, getting questions she wants us to go over, then discussing. Really wants you learn, makes you feel comfortable askng questions.

Great prof! I've been taking Spanish for 7 years and none of my professors compare to her. Integrates movies, music, art, and other things with the literature so its not all just reading. She encourages students to talk in Spanish casually in class which really helps you learn. Shes also young and in touch with college kids which makes class  great

Altamirano is such a kind and interesting professor. The workload was always reasonable and we wrote fewer essays than the other 44 sections.  She is great at facilitating class discussion and the articles we read were always great for discussion.  TAKE ALTAMIRANO!
She has some unusual views on things, but she is a very good teacher and she looks amazing every day in class.
i second what the last person said (especially the part about her being super hot).  she is, hands down, the best professor i've ever had.

She is great. Class is so much fun and really unintimidating even if you are terrible at spanish. She incorporates a lot of spanish music and movies which makes class entertaining. Class discussions are interesting and best of all she is a fair grader. I highly recomend her class.
Professor Altamirano is a solid teacher. Her politics are pretty out there and her tests can be hard but her class is worth it. She really tries to help you speak well.

i took nicole altamirano's spanish civilization class @ long beach state, and it was my favorite class all semester. she uses lots of interesting media and films and input from students. the class was like a big discussion section of spanish culture and everyone got to talk. 2 tests, presentation, and final. amazing!
No Comments

Altamirano's class is somewhat repetitive-- read a story/poem/play, write a summary, analyze it in class--but the readings are interesting, and at the end of the semester, she takes her classes out to dinner. Very nice professor who caters to all levels of spanish ability.

Professor Pitney was an incredible Government Professor, a great guy, and an engaging lecturer. The workload is manageable, and he has clear expectations for papers (be sure to read Strunk and White). Professor Pitney is constantly making references to CMC alumni, which makes the class especially interesting and relevant.

Very knowledgeable, animated, and intimidating (scary, especially during online office hours.) Lots of reading and writing. He is especially straightforward with his feedback- he tells you exactly what you did wrong and what you need to improve upon (can be a breath of fresh air or harsh.) Overall, great professor.

Prof Pitney is the best!! During the online semester he was considerate of our time while still ensuring we understood the content. His essays can be intimidating but as long as you revise, you're good! He'll support you every step of the way and his lectures were entertaining, even over zoom. Take his class!

If you are passionate about government and politics, definitely take this class. I had a fantastic experience and learned so much about the inner workings of U.S. politics and felt that I left the course with an extremely nuanced perspective. Your writing, opinions, and confidence will grow through this course - it's worth the challenge!

Pitney's online class was the highlight of my week. He is funny but highly educative. He has a vast knowledge of Gov and would recommend anyone to take any of his classes. The only thing you gotta know is you have to write like Strunk & White, he is very upfront about that.

Professor Pitney is amazing. If you have any interest in politics, you must take a class with him. His lectures are engaging, and he leaves ample time for student questions. His essay topics are clear and sometimes personalized, which shows how much he cares about his students. I learned so much in his GOV020H course. Work hard and you'll do well.
love him
fav professor

I took Professor Pitney's class as a freshmen over 20 years ago. I had no interest at all in government at the time and have since become a doctor. However, he taught me so many things in that one class that I remember to this day.  Looking back at my college experience, he was the most inspiring professor I met! Thank you for the memories.
Professor Pitney is awesome in class- beyond intelligent, humorous, and genuinely wants participation. No tests, only papers. Very specific in what style of writing he wants.
Best sense of humor I've ever seen in a professor. Personalized essay prompts actually make writing essays fun!

Professor Pitney is easily one of the most qualified people on the planet to teach. His humor, knowledge, and challenging questions made class lively. I always learned something new in class, and looked forward to it every day.  Beware the cold calls. This class is challenging, but definitely worth it. I would take him again in a heartbeat.

Pitney is amazing. He will connect with you on a personal level, and genuinely cares about his students. Incredibly knowledgeable and can answer almost any question about politics you throw at him. Does great presidential impressions. Amazingly helpful and thorough grader. His class will be the highlight of your day.

Gov101, 115, and thesis: You either love Pitney and share his passions, or you're blah about it. If you're the latter you're probably better off taking another class, but he is a great educator and such an excellent resource outside of the classroom too. Really learned how to write thanks to him! Sometimes he babies us a bit, but all in all LOVE.

One of the most helpful teachers I have had, always willing to help and give guidance. Keeps course relevant to modern society and challenges students to improve their analytical and argumentative skills.

As far as Government professors goes, I would venture to say Pitney could very well be the best in the nation. It is a fact that he is "the most quoted political science professor in the nation."  If you ever listen to NPR news, he will most likely be quoted in it. Beyond that his teaching is amazing; he spends an absurd amount of time on students

Professor Pitney is a great guy. The class was the most intimidating I've had at the beginning, especially first semester freshman year. Competitive/Arrogant students can get annoying, but Pitney is annoyed with them to. Not as hard of a grader as advertised, and the feedback you get makes it so worth it.

This guy is absolutely amazing. I've never been so excited about going to class before. This class gave me a much better understanding of how America works. Although he grades the papers hard, he gives you an incredible amount of feedback on each one, really giving you the opportunity to improve your writing. TAKE THIS PROF BEFORE YOU GRADUATE!!!!

Great prof!  Extremely engaging lecturer, one of the best.  Picky on writing, you really have to do exactly what he wants, but you'll learn a lot from doing it.  Don't graduate from CMC without taking one of his classes!

He is extremely knowledgable and I learned TONS from the class. Biggest bonos: for such an intelligent, successful person, he doesn't have a huge ego. As a liberal I never felt he counted your political beliefs against you. Hard, but not impossible and well worth the effort. I will def. take him again (hopefully more than once) before I graduate.

Class was a bit intimidating at first since he calls on you randomly, but you get accustomed to it after a while.  He knows a lot about Congress and US Politics, and I found the class interesting and informative.  I liked how he incorporated online videos in his lectures.  However, he didn't talk about the readings as much as I would have like him

Like Prof Massoud, Prof. Pitney is one of the institutions that make CMC what it is. If you are a Gov major, you must take his class. US Congress is one of the most fun classes, and will teach you the nuts and bolts of how politics works. He may seem stiff one-on-one the first time you meet, but he warms up and would do anything for his students

I am not interested in American Gov per se, but I liked gov 20. The strunk and white approach is too fundamentalist for me, but go to the writing ctr and you will be ok. does excellent imitations-his lectures were almost theatrical. Fair grader, and tries and largely succeeds to be fair politically even though he is definitely conservative.

If you're not interested in gov, don't take this class. It's hard and time-consuming (lots of reading and papers). However, if you like Gov, you will probably love this class. Pitney is very engaging and knows his subject backwards and forwards. He can be a bit intimidating, but he's a lot of fun if you're interested in government.

He is a very intelligent man with experience in the world of politics. As such, he often teaches by metaphor, so it might be hard to understand the points  he's making unless you think hrd about what he is saying.
Congress is BY FAR the BEST CLASS at CMC.  Take it, sweat it, live it, and learn from it.  You'll never regret the time and effort.

Prof. Pitney is a good professor, but be prepared to work hard and do all the reading. He normally won't give anything below a B on papers and anything above an A- on papers. He is great in class, but not as good in office hours.

You will sweat, get frusterated, and work your ass off at times. But you will learn so much. If you're looking for a teacher to let you sleep through class, don't pick pitney. If you want an engaging class and an experienced teacher- he's your guy. But remember, you have to keep up with all the reading and stay on top of things...
He is a really hard grader on papers (as in it is really hard to get an A) and a lot of it is personal style preferences, which is frustrating. But he has a very engaging teaching style.

Congress is the best class at CMC.  Not only is Pitney a fun and good profossor, I highly recommend getting to know him outside of class.  He is an amazing and interesting person (with a lot of connections).  If you take a class with him- make Strunk and White you closest friend.

Pitney is an incredible teacher.  Classroom discussions and lectures are engaging.  He challenges you in a positive way and is one of the best professors at CMC.  If you have any interest in government, I highly reccomend you take his class.  He has high standards for his papers, but grades are reasonable and fair.  An extremely rewarding class.
pretty good class - recommended
I didn't think that Prof. Pitney was the most helpful outside of class.

Pitney is the greatest guy ever.  He is brilliant and he will teach you a ton about government and writing and you better believe he will challenge you.  he is the hardest paper grader I will ever had.  He is also great about giving advice on all kinds of things like research, internships, study abroad, and grad school.  i still talk to him.

Pitney is definitely one of the most-loved Profs at CMC, but be a little wary.  Felt like he catered to those who talked a lot in class just to show off random bits of knowledge (regardless of the quality or relevance of their questions/comments) and papers are graded on style more than content.  I still learned a lot, but wouldn't do it again.

It's a nice feeling when you're driving to work and you hear Professor Pitney's "soundbite" on KFWB that he taught in his course on the Politics of Journalism.  I took his class 3 times. Best prof at CMC bar none. One time, I overslept for his class and he e-mailed me why I wasn't there an hour later - that's some dedication to his students!

The simulation is awesome, but the three hour late night seminar isn't so great.  Don't get me wrong: Pitney is still a GREAT professor, just think twice before taking the gov 101 because the late monday night seminar is always a bit much, even with one of the more interesting profs in the country...

Pitney is a great professor. He helps you a ton with your writing, and his classes are generally really interesting. You do have to work a lot, but its usually worthwhile. And if you take his class, you will begin to notice how often his name shows up in newspapers. Great prof, highly recommended.
I found the class extremely interesting. Pitney has such knowledge on the subject. He also is extremely helpful in improving student writing, and will find any mistake.
No Comments
No Comments

Pitney is a jerk and hates students who vote the liberal left. He insists on knowing your political beliefs, then mocks you the entire course if you don't follow his ideology. I switched out of a Gov major due to his intolerance for independent thinking.

He's one of the most quoted Gov professors in the country for a reason- he knows more than the internet. I didnt get an A, but I would repeat his class in a heartbeat. Pretty hot  too if you're into mustaches...and men.

Pitney is the man.  I don't think that this is his best class, but you will still learn a lot.  He has to know something about journalism...after all, he is the most quoted prof. we've got.  You have to know how to write his papers.  But he will read drafts ahead and tell you what to do to get an A.
Overrated.  He knows his stuff, but he's more fond of hearing himself talk than anything else.

Pitney is amazing. Worth every bit of the hype. Fascinating class lectures. Fair amount of reading, but no midterm, only 3 short papers and a final. Doesn't grade as hard as you hear. He is SO HELPFUL in email and office hours. Only prof who can keep me focused for the 1hr15min. Take his class!
Pitney is just awesome... period

There's a reason the school flaunts this guy.  He deserves every bit of attention he gets.  I know SO much about the American government now.  If you're a gov major and haven't taken this guy, it's a sin.

A lot of writting, but he doesnt grade the papers as hard as he tells you he will, class discussions are interesting, though Im not so sure how helpfull they really are for the final , a lot of reading.

By far the most overrated prof at CMC.  Pitney is all vague talk.  He didn't actually teach gov, we just discussed books.  He's actually pretty easy because he only gives B's on papers, even after telling us 500 times how he will mark our papers to hell.People just say he's great because it's trendy
Pitney rocks
Best professor here at cmc
He is by far the most amazing professor. Take him! If you don't like to write, then stay away though.
Bar none, the best Pol. Sci. professor in the West Coast -- perhaps in all of the United States... a wealth of knowledge and absolutely dedicated to politics and more importantly to students

Pitney is the best at CMC.  He is quick at responding to emails and makes lectures fun.  He expects a lot on papers, but his topics are interesting and he is more than willing to help students make revisions.  I will take him again.
He is so hard. So hard. But you learn so much. You can hate it while you're in it, but towards the end of the semester, you realize why you took his class. You will learn a lot and reach new levels.

Best prof ever. The ultimate teacher-scholar. Assigns stimulating and practical work, and though a tough grader, is very fair. The type of guy you want on your side: He gives great recommendations and has plenty of connections.

Amazing professor that makes class a blast to attend each class meeting. Sticks to Strunk and White RELIGIOUSLY but the concise writing style has helped me overall. Make sure to PROOFREAD PROOFREAD PROOFREAD all your essays. Tough but worth it!

I never had his class but I really want to have an opportunity to take his class before I graduate.  I heard his name on radio, TV, and newspapers almost EVERY DAY!!!   Very talented and knowledgeable professor, and a great asset to the school.
awesome class.  Kinda slighted on final grade, but I would take a Pitney class again.
Best prof and class I've ever taken.  He requires concise writing, which is useful in non-academic settings.
Tough grader, but you can't fully get the CMC experience without taking a class with him.
Best prof I've ever had (and I'm a senior)
No Comments
Pitney is a great professor. He makes you work, but it's so worth it.

Professor Aksoy is a solid math professor. Her lectures are fairly easy to follow, but be sure to take notes on everything she writes down. Her grading is not harsh, and be sure to do all of the homework for easy points. Professor Aksoy is also a kind and funny person. She had tea with me and gave me one of her old books.

MATH032H with Prof. Aksoy is difficult but manageable. Lectures are very content-heavy and the homework assignments are long and challenging. However, Prof. Aksoy is very caring and grades nicely. The exam questions also heavily reflect the review problems which is a plus.

Do not take. She is a very nice person but not a good teacher. All these reviews are saying her lectures are unclear but that's ok? A professor is supposed to give good lectures!! In Office hours she reads off the solution and cannot explain the material clearly. Tests are complete regurgitation + time pressure, odd for a Real Analysis course.
Answers questions by repeating what she already said. Gives horrible lectures and her technique for teaching is literally just telling you it is "not that hard". Horrible teacher.

Professor Aksoy is one of the sweetest professors at the college. I took her intro calc after having already taken Calc I and II in high school, so naturally it was very easy for me. That being said, her lectures were sometimes confusing and I wouldn't have followed if I hadn't already taken the class. If you've had calc, her class is really easy!

She is nice and knows the material well. Her lectures may not be super clear but if you take notes you'll be fine. The problems sets are challenging and exams are reasonable. I'm glad I took Analysis with her.

MATH32H with Prof. Aksoy was a very difficult class for me. Lots of homework and generally quite difficult. The in-class notes are LONG. You can easily fill up more than a few pages with notes during a typical class. However, Prof Aksoy is accessible outside class and the tests are fair, albeit difficult. If you put in the effort, you will be fine.

MATH60 with Aksoy is the best math class ever! Similar to her other classes, this class is proof-heavy and has a lot of homework. Linear algebra is an incredibly fascinating subject, and Aksoy does a fine job of showing us the concepts and how linear algebra ties in together with everything in math. (Note: This class is only offered in spring.)

Love professor Aksoy! She is by far my favorite math teacher ever, as she really inspires me to love math. She cares about you as a student and as a person, and is always there for you. She teaches everything carefully and in details. If you want extra credits, type your homework in LaTeX. Also, the class is heavy on proofs.

Asuman is a great professor that really cares about your learning. The class is just so hard because the material is so dense and boring. She will help you if you seek her out but she moves fast so keeping up can be an issue late in the semester. Required for most people but if you like theoretical math you should take her anyways.
Great professor! A lot of homework but I learned a lot. Her exams are difficult but very fair. She provides great examples in class to help with the homework. She truly cares about her students!
She is really bad at explaining the material. Her lectures are painful to sit through. But, she is the nicest person in the world.
Wonderful teacher! Can get too involved into her proofs which might make things confusing but definitely a class worth taking if you are interested in math at all!

Professor Aksoy's Linear Algebra can be challenging but she makes her available for office hours and is extremely clear in her lecture. She is very humorous and friendly around campus. One of the best math professors I have had!

Analysis is a hard class, and Aksoy is not an easy prof.  Her exams are difficult, as are her quizzes, and her problem sets take a lot of time (15 hrs/week average).  I did not do well in her class. That being said, she does care about her students and their success.  When I came in for help she did everything she could to be accommodating.

analysis is known to be one of the harder math classes and rightly so, as the material is dense and far-fetched. unless you're a hardcore theoretical math person, the material in this class seems useless and the class is painful. aksoy is a theoretical mathematician so she loves this stuff. the class is hard, but aksoy tries her best to help.

Im 17, have major senoritis, scored only modestly on the AP exam, and got an A in professor Aksoy?s class without much stress. And people whine about difficulty? I never had a teacher who agonized as much over her students welfare, taught as methodically and clearly, or projected as much passion for the subject. Aksoy makes a hard subject easy.

I used to be in love with math. Aksoy ruined it all for me. She is so hard to understand, and she assigns a ridiculous amount of work. I wish she understood that her students had lives and didn't want math to take over every minute of everyday. Thanks for ruining my interest in math Aksoy!
Terrible.
She is wonderful!
She is very hard but an excellent teacher. She assigns a lot of homework and you can't fall behind. She is always available for help and is also very nice.

aksoy is hard but fair. she assigns a ton of homework but it's usually helpful to learning. she gives a midterm or quiz every 2 weeks, so you don't fall behind. her quizzes and midterms are difficult, yet fair and straightforward. homeworks are graded very carefully, so be careful. she's the sweetest lady ever and always helpful. highly recommend!

Professor Aksoy is a fair and helpful professor.  He class is among the more difficult of the Math 30 courses, but her knowledge of the subject makes up for it.  She assigns a fair amount of homework, but students do not need to study as much for her tests because they are constantly challenged by the homework.
She is wonderful!!! As a high school student, I learned more from her than from my high school calculus teacher. She knows what she is doing.
She was very willing to spend as much time as needed in office hours to get you to understand.

If you are taking Calculus 1 (Math 30) for a general education requirement or simply the economics requirement, don't take this professor. She is one of the toughest professors and assigns a lot of homework. She doesn't like to grade on a curve either. I recommend you avoid her unless you love math intensely. She makes things harder than they are.
Very helpful, clear lectures, well organized, and likable.

AMAZING.  She really cares about her students and does whatever she can to help them not just pass the class, but really understand the meaning behind the material.  I actually looked forward to math class...it was great!
I love Aksoy.  She is the most lovable math teacher i think i've ever had and I like the way she explains things she goes the whole way.  She doesn't skip steps and is generous with the grading.

Professor Aksoy is really excellent.  Her lectures are lucid and her tests are fair.  She has ample time out of class and is really willing to help.  She's also kind cute for a 50 year old( she has excellent fashion).   You will learn a ton, and it's not hard to do well(I thought the grading scale was actually too easy).  Course Grade: A
She speaks and writes very fast in class, and it's easy to get overwhelmed.  She's very helpful in office hours though, and she wants her students to succeed.
No Comments
She explains things in a very clear manner and has funny stories to share in class.  Also helpful outside of class.  Tests are a bit hard but i still got an A, just do the homework!

Always willing to help.  Wants you to succeed.  Oh how she loves when ladies are in her class, she'll try to make ladies into math majors.  Very spirited, enthusiastic, don't let the final screw you though.  The final is definately everything, no notecard.
Has great confidence in her students and makes you want to try your best for her.  She moves pretty fast, so you have to take notes furiously, or just sit and listen.
Good prof
love the accent
You LEARN in an Aksoy class
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Prof Martinez is a caring professor. Her hands-off approach to advising on assignments and lack of clear criteria had me struggling. She really helps develop your writing and critical thinking skills through the comments she makes both in class and after assignments are graded. She's deeply passionate about the subject, which is nice.
Love Prof. Martinezvery clear speaker and cares about her students, super helpful outside of class.

Patient, highly knowledgeable, creative, kind, and passionate. First we read R.K. Narayan's version, then focused on specific scenes. She assigned readings from many diff. versions and critiques from a range of scholarly perspectives. I have a better understanding of Hindu concepts and how epic literature continues to influence Indian culture.

Prof Martinez is a really caring individual and it is clear she cares about her subject. I took it as a GE and honestly had no interest in the Ramayana or religion. That said, she turned religion I did not care at all about into one that I could talk about without being bored - which is hard to do. Great person and Prof for a religious GE.
Lectures are quite boring and long; however, when meeting with him in office hours he is very helpful and caring. A lot of reading and he is a very hard grader. Very particular for writing.

Great professor! Bit of a dry lecturer in the beginning. But the class picks up and the way he clearly explains and analytically thinks about the subjects covered in class is incredible. Busy man but is available during scheduled office hours, great in studying for midterms. Middle of the road guy politically, open to all ideas

Professor Miller is a caring professor who provides great feedback on your writing. Make sure you visit his office hours and take his advice when writing papers for his class. Be prepared to read, especially towards the end of the semester since readings tend to be bunched up at the end.
Miller's a straightforward and reasonable professor. He's also really approachable during office hours. If you put in the effort and do some reading you'll do well. I'd recommend him for GOV20!

Prof Miller is a pretty dry lecturer, but I still learned so much in this class. It's really a masterclass on everything CA Politics and is a must-take for anyone interested in getting into that space. The trip to Sacramento is one of the best things I've done in Claremont!

Miller is passionate about the founding fathers and principles, and lectures reflect that. Intro to American Politics consists of 2 large research papers and 2  tests (midterm & final- in class essays and short answers). Overall- as long as you pay attention, do most of the readings,  and work hard on papers you should be good to go.

I'm still confused as to whether he is a good professor or not. Miller is a good professor in that he's very helpful when you get hold of him and that his assignments and grading standards are reasonable. However, he has too much on his plate and is very hard to get hold of. His lectures can be boring. Not a bad professor but not the best either.

Professor Miller is an extremely knowledgeable and good professor. Lectures can be slow and dry however he is extremely helpful and wants everyone to succeed and do well in his class. Pretty hard grader but gives a lot of assistance in office hours. Interested and concerned with his students and I would highly recommend.

Miller is my favorite professor at CMC. Taken CA Politics and Con Law with him and he's an excellent and passionate teacher. Supreme Court simulation in Con Law- best experience of college. Ps- He can get a little dry and he's on the soft spoken side, and he's the best help in office hours, NOT via email.
Very fascinating professor. A great teacher who knows his stuff. Hard to get an A but easy to get a B/B+.

Really great and super interesting.  So qualified and really knows that material in and out.  Midterm is tough and tests are a lot of writing.  No tests besides midterm and final.  One big essay - field research project.

This was easily one of the best classes I've taken at CMC. Prof Miller is a great guy and always willing to help. You realize every time you study for his tests just how much you have learned. If you are interested in California Politics even slightly this class is a must. Also a fair grader as long as you put in the work.

If you're interested at all in California Politics, take the class it's totally worth it. Even if you're not sure you're that interested, it's a great class. Prof. Miller is also the nicest man, and super helpful in office hours. His lectures can get a little dry, but the workload is not too bad and his tests are straightforward. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
Good for an intro class.  Tests are essay/short answer. Two "projects" during the semester.  He knows his stuff and is a great guy to be around.

You must read, you must go to class, and in order to get what's going on, you should probably participate.  There is a whole lot of reading, and two papers (5 pg and 15 pg) that are required.   He knows what he's talking about and if you challenge him he might fling all of his degrees at you.  Overall he's a really great professor

As a non-CMC student, I can say that I felt extremely comfortable in this class. He is a brilliantly clear and comprehensible lecturer and not partisan on any issues. Very highly recommended for people interested in the constitution.

CA Politics was, and still is, my favorite class that I have taken at CMC. The content is extremely interesting, especially if you are from, or plan on living, in California. Miller is awesome, and is so much fun. I highly recommend this class if you have an interest in California politics.

Great Professor AND Teacher. Really knows what he's talking about, and knows how to deal with confusion. Not an easy class- You must attend, you must read, and you must go to office hours if you really want to do well. Great availability and makes clear what he expects of you. A must if you are a Gov major.

Great professor. Really interested in American Government and wants you to be too, but at the same time realizes that it is a GE. Really open to both left and right thinking. Is super helpful. Go to his office hours during the first week of school, and he will totally help you out. Final reserch paper is hard, but rewarding.

Miller is the go-to guy on state/local gov. CA Politics is an excellent overview of the big issues facing CA, and is a must for those considering work in Sacramento (ask him about Capital Fellows). He's probably the most moderate faculty member and one of the easiest to approach. If you have trouble, go to office hours - he wants you to do well.
He's a genius and a stud. Challenging material, but he does a great job teaching it.
the supreme court simulation was straight righteous

Appears dull at first, but grows on you. This knowledgeable government professor has been there, done that: DC semester while at Pomona College, State Senate fellow, Harvard grad school, lobbyist in Sacramento, etc. Very fair, passionate, helpful, laid back.

Bright young guy, does a great job of keeping the class both currently relevant and 100% comfortable for right and left views. The field research project is a **** without a car, but worth it. Fun debates. Tests are tough but he threw a sweet study party, cocoa, cookies and everything. Take him!

Professor Gonzales has so much energy and this makes the course so engaging. He makes sure that everyone in the class understands what is being taught and if not you can visit him at office hours. He is very accommodating and caring. He is a very fair grader and gives you exactly what you deserve based on his grading criteria. Highly recommend.

Prof Gonzales is the sweetest man ever and really builds a genuine connection with all of his students and wants them to succeed. His homework is super manageable and class is fun and there's nothing to stress about.

Prof Gonzales' class is the most fun class I've had so far. He assigns lots of textbook activities and small assignments for homework each day, so make sure to stay on top of that, but then you're fine. No final, just 2 big noncumulative midterms. If you're struggling, go to office hours! He's really caring and will do his best to help.

Nice guy. Your grade is made up of SO many small components (homework, written tasks, pair presentation, participation) that you just have to show up and do the work. 3 midterms, no cumulative final-very reasonable. Willing to help in office hours.

Best Professor I have had at college. He really cares about you and the class environment. I am very close with everyone in that class now. At first he seems really tough but he's a sweetheart and will help you. Small homeworks and only a couple tests.
Great guy 10/10

Carlos is the best Spanish professor I have ever had. He is incredibly caring and I have so much respect for him. He does not teach to get through the curriculum, but because he loves his students. Having not taken Spanish in a few years, it was not the easiest class, but there were clear instructions and I always received help when it was needed.

Such a nice and caring professor. Cares about your development in Spanish and as a person. Every piece of work you have to do is carefully considered to help you master the language. Furthermore, his office hours are extremely helpful. Language is not easy for me so that is why I made it difficult.
Carlos is the bomb!! Super fun teacher who really loves and cares about each and every one of his students.  He's a very understanding person and I would love to take more classes with him.

The class is not hard, tests are very fair and not much HW at all. He is a great guy, but not the best teacher ever. His presentations can sometimes be unclear and you will have to teach yourself grammar points. The class atmosphere is relaxed and fun. He is a kind man who wants his students to succeed!
LOVE HIM. HE'S A TEDDY BEAR.

Professor Gonzales, while unclear on expectations from time to time, truly cares about his students and their success. As long as you can show him that you're putting in the effort you'll get a good grade. Also he's a great guy with a sense of humor.

Senor Carlos is one of the best professors/ teachers I've ever had. He allows you to joke around in class, and have fun. His tests aren't hard at all, and as long as you've had a little bit of spanish before you'll be alright.

There's a fine line between "it's part of the culture" and inappropriate; the last time Gonzales saw that line, he was still living in Peru. Any time work by a female poet is read, Gonzalez lectures on how mysterious/delicate women are, and how they truly have all the power. Otherwise, he speaks mostly English in class and grades arbitrarily.
Gonzales is a great guy! The class is so fun, and he really cares about the students. I recommend him to everyone taking Spanish at CMC.

This guy's hilarious. Totally one of my favorite profs from last semester. His accent can be hard to understand at times, but get on his good side, and you'll have a great class. I'm really bummed I can't take more classes with this guy.

Senor is a lot of fun. Our class was pretty tight because Gonzales is a fun guy. He's a bit difficult to understand in class, and you really have to focus to pick up on what he's saying because he goes over things pretty quickly. All in all he's a good teacher, tests are fair, presentations are simple, and class is fun with Carlos.

unless youre interested in being taught by a guy who's less intelligible than ozzie guillen, taking this class is a waste of your time and money. flatly refuses to post anything on sakai even though he inundates you with handouts and other various junk.
Great prof.  Daily homework is optional, with a small assignment turned in every 1.5 weeks or so.  Very reasonable work load and he has a good sense of humor.

At first this class seems boring.. but hang in there.  Prof. Gonzales is a caring and dedicated professor that wants his students to succeed - if you do well in his class, a good rec. letter will follow... as well as a much greater enjoyment of Spanish Literature.  NOTE: much of the handouts he gives are missable... just do the daily work and enjoy

Spanish 33 was an easy class, but he's not a very good teacher. He doesn't explain a lot of things very well, but the workload is relatively light and the tests are super easy. A few projects, but he gives you ridiculous amounts of time in which to do them. I recommend this professor for span33.
Very helpful during office hours, slightly incomprehensible in class. Do *not* take this class if you place into it without having taken Spanish 44--bad idea.
No Comments

work load high just like any span33 class but he grades really nice. tests are hard but he will basically give it to you in a pretest and will clarify it if you go to office hours-this really helped me. i would recommend him to anybody
I found this class very easy, but I know others in the class found it very difficult.  It was kind of a drag though, having to go to class 5 times a week.
Greatest Professor on the 5Cs and the most knowledgable film professor you will ever meet. Love him.

Professor Schur is very clear with the layout of his grading and his course immediately. It is writing heavy, however, you are not actually graded on your writing. Rather, you are graded for submission but still receive great feedback from both your peers and Professor Schur on your pieces. Participation is very important. Easy to do well.

The course's structure seemed perfect for FWS: we would write 750+word pieces every week and then discuss them in class. Prof Schur's feedback is sometimes not supported by anyone else, which is confusing, but he doesn't consider it to be the only right one, so it's fine. Papers weren't graded - just write them, attend classes, and you'll get an A.

Professor Schur's Writing & Experience FWS was one of the more unique classes I have taken. As long as you are active in class and meet the 750 word count each week, you will get an A-. In terms of the feedback I got, I agreed with only some of what he offered. He opened up as the semester went on, and seems to be a really nice guy.

Class was graded on completion so if you did all the weekly assignments/showed up to every class you get an A. Assigned a wide range of movies and I genuinely learned so much about film! He has an interesting/quiet demeanor but he's funny and loves hearing what his students have to say. HIGHLY recommend if you like talking about movies.

Most of his classes are discussion based, so make sure to read the material in advance. You can get by with just Sparksnoting. Bearing in mind my C+ grade, I probably should I have gotten an F for missing most classes and not handing in major assignments. His class is easy which will make you more interested in learning the material.
Best prof I've had at CMC. Cares so much about the learning of his students. It's a challenging class but it really makes you think.

Great Professor, really knows his stuff; however, it seems like you cant give him enough. I gave him A quality participation and got B+ on my papers and final, but ended up with a B+ in the course. All this despite attending office hours weekly and participating and utilizing his feedback.

It seems like participation matters in this class because he is so engaging and caring towards students, but the class is graded on 4 papers and not much else. I consistently got B's on all of my papers EVEN THOUGH I went into office hours constantly and applied ALL feedback given. I honestly feel worse about my writing after taking this class.

Very participation heavy, which I personally wasn't a fan of but many people enjoyed. Workload is manageable, with a lot of reading/short papers during the first few weeks of the semester and then just short blog posts for the rest of the semester.
Great guy and the class is pretty much completion. Just pay attention in class, do your corrections, and you'll do well.

Not a bad professor. Has a little quirk and quiet demeanor to him. Likes smart students that participate with smart comments. Does not like grading so he will give work that is generally completion. Lots of reading in the first half of the class that is hard to understand. You will probably fall asleep if you're not engaged. But u won't if you are

I am a international student and a freshman. I definitely recommend his class. He knows how to teach and how to teach wisely about writing. More than that, I love him because he is such a knowledgable,  "mysterious" man. He is really a writer, thinker. He is so much like Kafka. Take his class and You will be amazed by literature!!!

If you go to his office hours he will make sure to give you extra time and help you out as much as he can with precision. His lectures are very interesting and his class is very organised. I would take him again and again because he is so helpful and open minded and encouraging. Take him if you can. His papers are very short too. Students love him
Great professor that deserves tenure. Obviously highly intelligent without being stuffy, I would highly recommend him.

Took him for FWS. Very little reading with 5 short essays (2-3 pages) and one final essay (8-10 pages). Really nice guy who was very helpful in class and during office hours. At times I was confused by his grading on certain assignments but I would definitely recommend his class

Extremely helpful professor. Go talk to him during office hours, it will be worth the time. It's easy to get a B+, but you'll have to work for an A. He is also very chill and friendly. I like to just go talk about the movie that I watched over the weekend.

Very helpful outside of class, and a good discussion leader. Workload is light - only 3 decent papers, participation, and another assignment. Interesting readings and overall a good course. Go talk to him if you want to make the most out of the class.

Professor Cannon had a very well structured class and grading rubric. There is a lot of HW, but the class is very easy if you attention and keep up with the material. I would say minimal to no coding experience is required to do well in this class.

Prof Cannon's Discrete Mathematics class was very engagingshe taught the course material quite well and clearly, so I had a great understanding of the grading criteria and explanation. If you're struggling, I would seek help early as her office hours are really helpful for working through problems at each step of the way. I would highly recommend!

Prof cannon is a really great professor! Her lectures are clear and she explains things really well. I took her for discrete. I will say she is a tough grader and not very lenient with simple mistakes. She assigns a ton of hw, in the end I learned a lot but ended with a c plus because shes just a hard grader.

Probability gets hard near the end, but in general, it is at the lower end in difficulty among math courses. Prof Cannon has been very clear in introducing the subject. She is also very patient in answering our questions. She also gives a brief intro to her research in the field. I feel I like probabilities after taking this class.

If you have not taken calc before, I would be a little weary of taking mistry's class as he can be a bit scattered but overall, such a nice man. I did poorly on a midterm and he gave me 10 points back after I met with him. He is not here to fail you and wants to be as helpful as possible. I didn't learn much in the class but did in my 1:1 meeting.

great prof who isn't here to fail you. extremely generous when it comes to making sure our tests are fair and he's rly funny. would ABSOLUTELY recommend him if you've taken calc before; but even if you haven't, if you pay attention you'll do fine. he'd be great for a higher level math class if he decides to teach one
Can be a little challenging if you've never done calc before but if you have, it is an extremely easy A. There is one group project and three midterms, all of which are extremely simple.

The math profs at CMC aren't the best but I'd say that Prof Mistry is a decent choice. He's very caring and you can tell that he loves math, but sometimes, he unnecessarily goes into the theory behind simple concepts which may make it confusing for people who are learning calc for the first time. Overall a solid choice though

SUPER nice but do not take if econ isn't your thing or you've never taken econ before, he moves much faster than other econ profs and his tests are confusing for someone who's never taken it before, but genuinely a great engaging lecturer

Prof Kim is a hard grader on midterms but if you put in the work and communicate with him if you're struggling, your final grade will reflect your work more than the previous grades you received. Great professor and explains concepts thoroughly well, you just need to be dedicated.

super nice prof, holds tons of office hours and increases availability before exams; organized, but sometimes he loses track of time; make sure you go over the slides THOROUGHLY esp if u haven't taken econ before bc it can get tricky, but put in the work (aka GO TO OFFICE HRS) and he will notice it; also offers LOTS of resources before each exam

Prof Kim is the best! 2 midterms, 1 group presentation, 1 final. Everything on the test is in his lecture notes which he gives to you on sakai. He also gives you past midterms to help you study. He's incredibly helpful and cares for his students. The content was straightforward, math was fairly simple, and you didn't even have to go to class.

One of the best experiences I have had with a teacher, extremely caring very good at explaining concepts and very accessible. I took Macro with him and although the material was a bit dry I enjoyed every class.

Take a class with Prof Gilbert!! He is insanely knowledgable and very unbiased in his teaching. This is honestly one of the best classes I've taken in college. Clear expectations, reasonable but not easy grading, gives extensions if needed. Lots of reading but don't need to do most, take good class notes though and don't miss class. Learned SO much

Prof Gilbert is very engaging in class and accessible outside of class. Very understanding and willing to grant extensions. Jewish Civ includes lots of reading, a required participation exercise, and a couple huge papers, but I found the content really interesting. Would definitely recommend you take a Gilbert class!

Professor Gilbert is incredibly knowledgeable about Jewish Civilization. The class is incredibly broad in scope, so we are constantly rushing through the material. While Professor Gilbert encourages discussions sometimes, the class is mostly lectures. Get ready for a rewarding but challenging five-thousand-word paper.

On the one hand, the final project for this class was the most work I've ever done for a homework assignment, and took more time than some of the other entire classes I've taken. On the other hand, I told him I was going through a rough patch and he gave me an extension to the end of the semester no questions asked. Would recommend.
Great professor. Easily accessible and always willing to help out. There's a lot of reading to do, but the texts and discussions are interesting.
He's very approachable and helpful, but he assigns a lot of reading.

Students will take lead a class discussion and the nice thing is that you get to choose when in the semester you do this. You can get away with not reading the entire text as long as you read a summary and you don't even have to participate much to still get a good grade. Very understanding as long as you communicate with him, has good vibes.

I was mislead when looking at RLST classes. Here is the truth. Professor Gilbert is caring, intelligent, and the most boring lecturer I've ever encountered. He has an uncanny ability to reiterate the same fact several times without noticing which makes class a dreary endeavor at its best, and downright tortuous at its worst. Caring, easy, BORING!

Professor Gilbert has been one of my favorite professors so far, taking my Freshman Humanities Seminar with him on Natures of the Self. He assigns quite a few papersoften requiring that you turn them in before discussing the book in classso be prepared to read. Very friendly and accessible; however, meaningful participation is required for an A.

He assigned 8 essays for the semester, but 6 of them were short and the other 2 were the midterm and the final. He is a tough grader and expects you to put the work into the essays for a good grade. His class is insightful and if you choose to participate and engage in it, you can learn a-lot. I definitely would recommend.

Engaging lectures every class with some (not a lot) of students participation. I found the tests to be very difficult, but this was not a feeling shared by the whole class. Definitely have to put in the work, but you'll get something out of it.

Prof Gilbert is one of my favorite profs here. His FHS was a lot of reading but the discussions are very thought provoking. His comments during discussions are pretty inspirational, and gives you the chance to speak your mind. Super fair grader.

His lectures are really dense but well organizedGilbert makes it easy to learn a lot. A decent amount of writing plus mandatory field trip to a museum. I honestly wasn't that interested in the subject matter, but now I'm really glad I took the class bc I learned so much. Wish I had taken more cool random classes like this during my four years.

Gilbert is a great person and professor. He is passionate about the subject. But he rushes through many topics to cover everything he wants to cover. The tests are also difficult and are graded fairly rough for a GE course. It's as if he expects non-majors to take a significant amount of time from other major courses to prep for his class.

Great lecturer, clearly extremely knowledgeable on the subjects of the class. Assigned readings are recommended but not necessarily required. Only complaint is that there isn't really time in the semester for all the info he tries to cover.

Really wonderful person and professor - very easy to contact and talk to during his office hours (he always brings up helpful questions to consider for research projects!) His tests are pretty hard and arduous to study for, and my only critique of his teaching is that I think he tries to cover too much material. Reading semi-required. also RLST163

Gilbert is a wealth of knowledge on Jewish topics from antiquity to contemporary issues. His lectures are structured, thoughtful and relevant, but mostly recapitulation of the reading.  Though my class was especially quiet, discussions were not always fruitful, making the class very lecture-heavy. Interesting subject material with cool analysis.

I love him and his class, definitely would like to take another class with him. The first 2-3 weeks of class were filled with boring powerpoint lectures that covered huge amounts of material, but don't get discouraged! After that, it's more lecture and discussion and it's so interesting! The class dynamic he creates is what makes it so great.

An overall great teacher! His lectures are captivating, he is an expert in his field and is very helpful. I really enjoyed and appreciated his help on papers, and he always got me excited to write about my topic! I learned a lot in his class and wish I could have taken more classes with him!

Professor Gilbert is absolutely incredible. He is so knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. Although this class was lecture-based, he still posed questions to the class that encouraged great discussions. He is a fair grader and willing to meet with anyone during office hours. I only used one of the textbooks once or twice for an essay.

While Prof. Gilbert is very knowledgable in his area and is obviously very intelligent, his assignments can be vague while looking straightforward in disguise. Getting an A is not as easy as it seems. There are lots of readings but he goes over the material in his lectures. He also talks a lot so the class is like 80% lecture 20% discussion.

Took it for GE but Prof Gilbert totally made want to be a RLST major! Class is lecture based but he raises interesting questions for you to think about. Workload is fair(2 8-page papers and 2 exams w/ study guide). He is super helpful if you go to his office hours to talk about paper or before midterms.
If it was at all possible, I would probably add a religious studies major to my degree because of Professor Gilbert. I wish I would have taken his class earlier!

Gary is one of the most thoughtful, kind, and measured people I have met, and despite the touchy subject that is Jerusalem, his goal was clear: to impart as complete and nuanced an understanding of the Holy City as possible. He's an OK lecturer, but nonetheless an extraordinary educator and discussion leader, and his grading is difficult but fair.
Amazing professor! Amazing course! I learned so much from the text. If you wish to learn about the Western traditions, especially Judaism and Christianity, take Professor Gilbert's courses!
This professor is very understanding about absences if you keep in touch with him constantly through email. Stay on top of the essays and you will be fine.

Amazing professor. I have never been as inspired by a professor or by classes as much as I have been with Gary. He is passionate about the subjects and wants the students to do well. There is a lot of reading but you don't really need to do all of it to do well in his classes. Take a class with him if you ever have the chance!

Gilbert has a great wealth of knowledge and experience in his field - he is superbly qualified. However, he never holds discussions and literally talks the entire time in a monotone boring voice. He can make an interesting subject boring in class, but readings are good (but way too much and he never uses them in class). Mixed review.

I would make sure to stay away from this professor. There is a lot of reading, a lot of work, a fair amount of essays, and the grading is based a lot on favoritism. Although, I will say that Professor Gilbert is very passionate about his subject.

Really good professor, really interesting class. Completely discussion based, and similar to a high school AP English class. The class is what you make of it - you can get a good grade by using sparknotes if you choose, but the reading is pretty interesting.
Class can sometimes be dry

All of his classes are discussion based. If you are not writing the text paper about the book discussed in class, then there's no point in going to that specific class. He assigns a lot of writing and a lot of reading, so SparkNotes is your best friend.

He is a hard grader, but wants you to do well. Very easy to talk to and barely even looks at his notes.  It can be boring, but it is a lecture class. There is a lot of reading but if you pay attention and take good notes, the readings are not necessary and he wont test you to make sure you did it. I'm thinking about taking another class with him.

Gary is amazingly knowledgeable, the his lectures are enjoyable, and he is a fair grader.  Doing all of the supplement reading is not necessary if you have some background in the subject, but do read the primary sources. Take a class from him. You will not regret it.

He is one my favorite profs. I took the first Jewish-Christian Relations class and learned so much. It was A LOT of reading, but it was doable. Plus he is very excited about his suject, especially the ancient period. Take him when is comes back for Oxford.
i love him!  he's my fav. prof.  so interesting and helpful and just a nice guy
Good professor. Not too difficult a class and he is approachable and intelligent.

He's a very nice guy, its ok if you don't do the reading...he doesn't call on people. You have to do a presentation on a book for the whole period which can be a pretty big task but he grades fairly. Never gets upset and has a great sense of humor!
No Comments

Gilbert is a very nice and friendly professor, but he still sets fairly high standards. He runs a relaxed classroom, but a very focused one. He is a great moderator for discussion, creating an environment where people can feel free to take a risk and add to the discussion.
I've taken two classes from this prof so far... 132 and 120... both have been awesome.  He's interesting, knowledgable, and approachable.  I highly recommend his classes.
Very knowledgeable prof who is very willing to help students. Readings are interesting as are the issues discussed in class. WOuld recommend highly.

if you are interested in Western religions, you must take a course from Dr. Gilbert. He is the sweetest prof who really wants to teach you something. Go chat with him in office hours too, very approachable.

Course Title: The Life of Jesus (from a historical point of view, of course. blah) Work: One page analysis of each canonical gospel. Midterm quiz based on readings. Three papers, including a 15-20 page final. Nice, approchable man. Doesn't call on people.
No Comments
OH YEAH!!!

Prof Fortner's classes were always so enjoyable -- he's really friendly with all of his students and jokes around a lot, but still manages to run class seriously. Very discussion and reading heavy but the class is more about discussing politics and questioning your own beliefs than learning the specifics of U.S. government.

gives good feedback on papers, really engaging and insightful discussions. reading heavy but all the choices were really interesting and not very difficult. pretty straightforward and easy grader if you do the readings and put in effort!

One of my favorite professors and class so far! I took this class just for a general education requirement, but I loved it because he really made me question my political beliefs and think critically about them. Hes super caring about his students! There is a lot of group work, but I became very close to each of my group members!
Great Prof!

Favorite Professor yet at Claremont Mckenna College. Most classes were heavily discussion-based. He is available during office hours and will make more office hours if you cannot meet on his specific date. Truly enjoyed every class. I recommend taking a class with him!!

The class isn't particularly difficult to pass but Blitz only lectures from a set of notes that seem reused every semester. He's not engaging at all and speaks in a very quiet monotone manner, making it incredibly difficult to engage in the class. Overall, I'd say the hardest part about this class is not falling asleep.

Professor Blitz's class was mostly lecture, which made it fairly monotonous. Even though the class was a Humanities class, the emphasis was on regurgitating the professor's ideas rather than exploring new ideas together. Be sure to ask questions of the professor to stay engaged.

If you're looking to just get the gov GE out of the way - this is a good class to take. The lectures are dry and it's hard to stay interested, but there was no homework. It's all good if you read the books, and if you've taken a general gov class in high school, the material will basically be a recap.

Professor Blitz was a good intro to gov prof, but his lectures were very long and dry (this does mean you don't have to do your reading outside of class though). His grading is decent but does not always reflect the amount of effort you put in. This is a great class to take if you want to get your gov GE out of the way with almost no homework.

Bright and knowledgeable but lecture intensive, dry, boring, and too monotonous. Appears he follows the same script every year. No class intimacy or fun times. Class engagement is dry too, and he makes little effort to break ice. Too many readings - easier to finesse with summaries, that's how I made it.

Avoid this professor at all costs. His lectures are beyond boring, and he reads directly from his notes the entire class without engaging students. I learned nothing, and if another government professor praises Abraham Lincoln for freeing slaves without providing adequate context to the situation, I will lose it.

Pro: He makes you understand the material and reading. You will learn a ton. Con: Generally boring class periods. He isn't too nice and he has high grading expectations. Conclusion: Take the class if you can do all the reading VERY thoroughly and can stay awake in class. Otherwise, try to get someone else
Very good professor. He will make sure you understand the texts to the core. If you're not interested in government, don't take his class, as I imagine it would get very boring.
Torture to stay awake in a class when the professor speaks in a monotonous voice, even when he is passionate about the topic. Avoid if you can.

How can you fully engage in this absurdly boring class. Don't read the books - he goes over everything 10 different ways in class. Take good notes and you'll ace the test and papers... but it'll be hard to keep the drool off them. Work load is not too bad... two tests, two papers.
Although his lectures can be dry and repetitive, Professor Blitz is quite bright.  Anybody who engages fully in the class will learn a lot.

Extremely bright yet extremely boring.  I think he uses the same lectures every year.  He KNOWS all of the text, by heart, and wants you to know and understand them as well.  That being said, he does not want you to fail.  He's kind, but certainly not for every one.  Unfortunate, considering that the other section of this class is taught by a nut.

Long, droning lectures are a bit difficult to get through, but you have GOT to go to class to do well in this class. The testing method - identifying and explaining passages - is a little weird and gets REALLY hard on the final, when you have 7 or 8 authors to choose from. Still, learned a lot and he will help you out if you ask for it.
Professor Blitz is one of the best profs at CMC.  His class is hard, but he is brilliant and his lectures are interesting.
prof. Blitz is a genius.

Excellent.  Extremely generous with his time in and out of class.  Students can learn much from this man.  A word to the wise (but especially the unwise, however): if you say stupid things, he will not feel shy about repudiating your stupidity.
Everything he says is relevant to his tests and paper assignments. He's incredibly clear and very willing to meet during office hours.
Not especially entertaining, but has some good things to say if you can pay attention.

Tendency to be monotone but guy is incredibly intelligent and willing to help. Exams are not too difficult but the final is sort-a evil. Requires a ton of reading. Go to class and all books wil make sense.

Not only does he expect you to read all 7 long political philosophy texts, he suggests that students reread them all before the final.  You should also be sure to attend every single day of boring lecture if you want to do well.

very, very boring, he knows his stuff, but if you can sit through his class, youre a stronger person than I, his voice is a v. annoying monotone. He also has a tendency to clutch, or lean against, or otherwise grope his podium.
Intro to political philosophy--holy **** this class is so hard.  had to work madness. plus the final is absolutely impossible.  must identify all these quotes etc.

He's okay. Lot's of works covered. He lulls you into complacency by spending too much time on the Republic and then expects you to read over 30 chapters of Hobbes' Leviathan in a week later in the semester.
If you enjoy teacher's reading straight from their notes and you copying those notes yourself, take him. Also, on midterms you have to quote and identify authors and their works, very very hard.

Love this Prof! His FWS is amazing and super interesting to learn about! The discussions are engaging and the course material is not too heavy (just a bunch of movies). He gives good feedback on papers (3 total). The only thing to be aware of is he's a bit inaccessible by email.

easy hw & good discussions, but wasn't always clear abt what he wants. 3 essays throughout the semester that are graded relatively harshly. i always made sure to follow his instructions on the syllabus so i did fine, but the class averages displayed on sakai stayed in the B/B+ range for each assignment. hard to tell what your final grade will be

Any film/cinema class with Prof Smith will leave you blown away. Not only did he navigate the Inside-Out dynamic well, but he always has so much insight to share about the films that we are discussing, and make the experience extremely interesting for all those involved. There were very few assignments, and his grading is very forgiving.

Opens your eyes to the world of film and the domestic/global perspectives that go into the internalized and externalized racism in Hollywood. An incredibly kind and understanding professor who always keeps class engaging and fresh. I can't recommend Prof. Smith enough, this is one of those classes you won't forget about 10 years later.

took Blackness in American Cinema with Prof Smith and I LOVED it! For anyone interested in film, or or wants to think and talk about movies in a new way, take this class. Lots of films to watch, but not much writing. He doesn't rly teach writing even though it's an FWS, so if you struggle there you might want to go to a more hands-on prof.

Professor Smith is hands down one of the best professors at CMC. He kept a really heavy topic of the carceral state super engaging and his deep knowledge of how the world works convinced me to embrace the principles of abolition. Only had one paper, group project, and a couple reading responses. Every CMC student should take his class before grad.
He's a super nice guy and his class is engaging and informative.

Dr. Smith is amazing. Considering this was a writing seminar, he made it feel like we didn't write as much! He's very funny and inserts funny anecdotes into his lectures. The movies we watched were spectacular and he provided some great insight. This was by far my favorite class and I hope you're lucky enough to take him.

Prof. Smith is an amazing professor and so articulated. He puts in effort in planning and structuring the course. He is great at making you think about change and how it affects us and society at a different perspective. I highly recommend him.

Prof Smith gave me a different way of thinking about life and history. He connected historical events in my mind that were never connected and literally made me think differently about how change is affected. He has an amazing story too and fosters closeness in the classroom. I don't think I missed a single one of his classes. CMC NEEDS hims. 10/10

I made an account on ratemyprofs just to give him a good review. He is truly an incredible person, brilliant and so very kind. He knows so much about the topic and ties in all sorts of contemporary cases in hip hop with much greater analysis of neoliberalism, feminism, etc. He makes an effort to be approachable and is very engaging. Stellar, 10/10

He is fantastic. Super smart, funny, chill guy. He puts a lot of effort into planning classes and assigns great readings. Not the best at facilitating discussions and keeping people engaged, but you can learn a lot from him and sometimes discussions are good. He assigns a ton of reading, but you can get by without doing it all. Not much other work.
Favorite professor I've had in a long time. His FWS is the best one by far and so interesting. The majority of the homework is just to watch movies!

Professor Valenza is amazing. His tests are super easy and he is a good teacher. Will never forget how he explained calculus using arts such as famous paintings. Really changed my perspective on math.
Valenza teaches linear algebra very differently. It is very abstract and noncomputational. Good for math majors but I'm not sure it's that helpful for computer science.

Professor Valenza is one of the best math teachers I've ever had. He cares so much about his students and tries to make calculus interesting for non-math majors. It is not hard to get an A if you listen in class and do the homework. I would highly recommend taking his Calc 1 class if you have the chance to fulfil the math GE.

Professor Valenza is a great professor. He really cares for his students and knows how to teach Calculus. He constantly stops and makes sure that everyone understands what he is teaching.
